Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: JFLapham
Reviews.Content: Whenever I am in the Los Angeles area, I always book this hotel. From the friendly and very helpful staff, spacious rooms and nice amenities its my hotel of choice in Los Angeles. I especially enjoy the convenience of the parking underneath the hotel. Plus if you are staying at the hotel, you can get a guest pass and enter and exit as many times as you like for the 24 hour rate. A big plus for me. The lobby is very impressive upon arrival as well. Extremely comfortable beds and very clean rooms. Definitely worth staying at! I am looking forward to my stay there next week. John Lapham

Reviews.Title: “I was sadly unimpressed with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: amanda d
Reviews.Content: i only spent one night at this hotel before flying out of lax the following morning. I was happy to be so close to the airport for an early flight so in that respect this hotel is very convenient. However there were several different events going on at the hotel and their was a long wait just to get on the elevator. From watching the elevators it appeared that at least two of the elevators were not currently working or operating and one of the other elevators that we ended up on got stuck on the 7th floor and took several minutes of people slamming on buttons before it continued. After watching the way other people were slamming on the elevator buttons these problems may not have been the hotels fault in the end. There were different elevators for the parking vs the room floors which seemed to confuse other people staying there. The parking alone was a pain as there was nothing to tell you if there were any spots still available on any of the floors so we drove around for a good ten or fifteen minutes just trying to find a spot and there is an additional charge of 25 dollars for one night of parking. We tried going into the bar for some food and drinks and after sitting at a table for five to ten minutes without anyone coming over to take our order we decided to walk down the road to try somewhere else. We asked who we thought was the concierge at the concierge desk for directions to a store and after he gave us directions that apparently included a back alley and another less then attractive road, the actual concierge came running out telling the other worker no that was not the way to go and they did actually want to see us again and make it back alive. So be careful who you ask for directions. The room was average overall, it was clean and the beds were comfortable so it was about all we required it to be for one night. Only drawback was we seemed to be in a corner room that must have been near some type of utility room because there was a lot of machine type noises that kept coming on and off.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: BMOL
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my way to NYC from Sydney, to break up the trip. We were planning to stay at another hotel in LA on the return trip home, but enjoyed the Hilton LAX so much, that we stayed here for on the return trip. The service here is very good. All the departments are great, and we particularly were surprised in the landings bar at how good the cocktails, and waitstaff were. The room service waiter was also very exceptional, a pleasant surprise. The hotel is very nice. The lobby is great, and has these massive amethyst and quartz crystal clusters throughout. The rooms were spacious, and very comfortable. My mother had a room that opened onto a courtyard, which she enjoyed very much, and I had a room on an executive floor, that had nice views. The decor is very elegant and understated. The executive lounge views of the runaway were good, though the lounge, as typical in US Hiltons, offered pretty disappointing food etc. The meals we ate in the restaurant and downstairs were very nice, and also from room service in the two times we stayed there. The price of this hotel was very reasonable. There is an airport shuttle that runs every 10-15 mins to and from the hotel. This was very convenient. There are buses that you can take to Venice Beach, and other places, and we also went into LA city quite easily by bus with the directions from the concierge. We both really enjoyed our stays at Hilton LAX, and actually were very pleasantly suprised at this hotel. Really great way to break up the long flight to and from Australia to NYC or the east coast.

Reviews.Title: “Day rates available for those with a layover!!!”
Reviews.Author: ccesq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a twelve hour layover in LA so we booked a day room for $79. For that price you get access to the room from 9am to 6pm. It was perfect for taking a nap and shower before catching the red eye. Please not that day rooms have to be booked in advance. The room was on the 7th floor so it had been recently renovated. The bed was so comfortable that I would have loved to stay for a full night. The room had a view of the runway but there was no airplane noise. The hotel had several dining options available. There is also a Carl's Jr. within two blocks if you're just looking for something quick and cheap. The hotel operates a free airport shuttle which make getting to it extremely convenient. We'll definitely be staying at this hotel again on our next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveler83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel due to the rate. It was the most reasonably priced hotel with a good rating. The hotel is by the airport, so a rental car to all LA locations is a must. It took me approximately 25 minutes to get to Beverly Hills. The valet staff was extremely attentive and friendly. The gym was clean with plenty of machines and weights. The rooms were adequate. During the afternoon and evening, I could hear planes flying, but since there isn’t much flight activity at night this did not affect my slumber at all. During the evening Hilton honors reception and morning continental breakfast, I was unable to find an open seat, so both times I made a small plate and returned to my room. I would return to this hotel if unable to find a reasonable rate for a hotel closer to the heart of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place near airport”
Reviews.Author: kpham04
Reviews.Content: The Hilton LAX recently renovated floors 5-12. The rooms are spacious and it was nice to watch the planes fly in and out of LAX. If you are sensitive to airplane noise, this may not be the place for you. However, I found the airplane noise rather soothing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect over night stay before flight with bonus upgrade!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelover99
Reviews.Content: Only here one night and had only booked basic two double bed suite for four of us. We have stayed in many Hilton properties and after 7 stops around the US we thought this would be our least favourite hotel as it was certainly the cheapest! We are Hilton honors members and were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to a suite on the executive club floor which provided us with complimentary evening drinks, snacks, desert and breakfast. Also had lovely bigger suite with 2 bathrooms. Very clean. Very impressed. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Aweful Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: foxmooder
Reviews.Content: We did not actually stay here but want to tell everyone about our experience briefly that perfectly described the customer service we got and as a result of this, we will never return to this hotel if we needed to fly out from LAX. We took the free shuttle hoping to go to the Hilton Gardens near LAX. It was past midnight and dark. Our flight just got canceled. We got re-booked for the next flight in the morning. We were traveling with two young child: ages 2 and 4. And we had two big suitcases, a stroller, and three carry ons. The shuttle driver was friendly but she innocently dropped us at the Hilton LAX instead of the Hilton Garden Inn. It was so dark and we were tired so we did not know we were in the wrong hotel. We found out when we checked in. The lady at the front desk (wish I remember her name) told us to take the free shuttle back to the airport at the drop off, then walk to the area for free pick up to find the right shuttle that will take us to the Hilton Garden. Are you freakin serious? Past midnight, with two young child, exhausted with tons of luggage back to the airport for pick up. We begged her for sympathy and told her about our situation with young kids. She just stared us like a cold hearted person and told us "NO." She told us we can pay for our own taxi and did not bother to waste another second with us. So we were fed us. We took a cab: paid $12 plus tip to save us some time and trouble. When we arrived at the Hilton Garden Inn, the front receptionist apologized for what happened to us. She said she would reimburse us for the taxi if we had our receipt. She said that we did not have to go through all that trouble. She said that the Hilton has shuttles that they can call to take us directly to the Hilton Garden Inn. She apololized many times. It was not her fault. That night, we were not the only one that experience this horrific treatment. There were two young ladies that actually did not take the taxi and went back to the airport waiting for that shuttle: they ended up waiting for more than an hour and they got fed up and paid for a taxi which they took to the Garden Inns. We are Hilton members and got treated like this? We will never return to the Hilton at LAX ever again! We will make sure we never recommend this hotel to our friends and families because we do not want anyone to experience what we went through. Traveling with young children with canceled flights is stressful enough, and they (Hilton LAX) just made it worse for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: PlanetTt
Reviews.Content: I just love staying at Hilton LAX the first and the last night of my trip to West coast. I need to have a good sleep before and after long flights. And the location is perfect! I have to say I am a spoiled person, so all my reviews are based on that. The rooms are very comfortable and very spacious. The bed is even better than the one I sleep in at home :) The room is cleaned and the bed is made every day. You have an iron and the iron desk in the room, hair dryer, TV. The furniture is not in the latest fashion but good. Sometimes I order a room service, the food is good. You also have a fast food restaurant Carl's Jr next to hotel, which I like. Check in is fast and the front desk people are very friendly. There are parking facilities underground the hotel, I think they charge you 10$/day.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Ann G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night before my early morning flight out of LAX. The location is convenient to LAX and the airport shuttle worked out great. We got upgraded to a corner room that was very nice and modern. The airplane noise was a bit of an issue, but that was to be expected being so close to the airport. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beyondbrowneyes
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. Clean rooms, comfortable living. Good staff. Location is very convenient especially if you don't have a car or don't plan on renting one. You can easily catch a bus (i think its #3) if you plan on going to santa monica pier or promenade street. the bus also goes to a lot of other places if you wanna go shopping or catch a movie. shuttle service to the airport is another plus.

Reviews.Title: “Lost in the Crowd: Impersonal Staff, Over Priced and Dirty”
Reviews.Author: brenagain
Reviews.Content: Well, again, I have terrible reviews for the Hilton. Be it vegas, Oregon or California, I have not had a good experience at the Hilton. This hilton is first of all impersonal and rude. We checked in and asked for two beds and were told "there are no more rooms with two beds." After checking into an old outdated room with a little tube TV, we called to request a room with a standard flat screen and were offered a room the following day with a flat screen but told that there were definitely no rooms with two beds. After having a ten dollar drink downstairs in order to cope with our misery, we went to the front desk for one last try. We begged to get a room with a flat screen TV. Well, we were given a room with two beds. We were not hassled nor was it hard to find a room with two beds when we hit the front desk for our third request. Why? The room with two beds was all that we would expect for a 3 star hotel. This hotel claims to be a four star. I have no idea why. The room was okay but there was trash sitting outside someone's door when we left for our conference at 8am. When we came back at 10pm, the bag of trash was still sitting there. We went to go check out the pool. I have never smelled such a poor smell nor seen such filth. The route to the pool is bad enough but the filth in the rooms you use to get to the pool was inexcusable for a four star hotel. The smell- the smell was jet fuel. Jet fuel fumes are trapped in the pool area and I don't see how people even use the facilities. Finally, Parking is over priced. You are charged $25 per day to park. The parking garage makes you drive your car five floors under the hotel and the spaces are tiny. IF you want valet, be prepared to spend $38. I have traveled all over the country and in Europe and have never confronted such parking prices and such a high star rating for such an undeserving property. Not even Turtle Bay on Oahu is so price with parking in comparison to the quality of the hotel. How can this hotel keep the four star rating? This is a 2 star dump with 3 star rooms and some hints of 4 star quality in lobby decorating at best. Dump!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: kawaiitraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after arriving at LAX, the location is really good since it's so close to the airport and you can use the free shuttle bus. Check in took a little long and I didn't find the staff at the front desk to be particularly friendly or welcoming. The room itself was fairly standard, but the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was very small and basic. Room service was overpriced but the food good. We also ate at the small cafe, the staff were friendly and the food was good. We did not use the swimming pool, but our room overlooked it so we could see that it was small.

Reviews.Title: “A good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: b7601
Reviews.Content: The rooms, if you are in the updated area of this hotel, are nice. Soon they will be renovated. I stay here monthly for work and find the beds very comfortable. Surprisingly, the hotel is pretty quiet considering its proximity to the airport. I find the rooms with the best views those facing the airport. The Executive Lounge is nice, but sometimes a bit crowded for breakfast. The Exec Lounge evening fair is slim pickings and if you drink, alcohol is sold, not gratis. There are a few food options. One nice option is the cafe where they make pizzas to go. Only negative- nothing to walk to from that area besides a fast food restaurant or two. There is a free shuttle to and from LAX airport, but I've never used it. One other negative- the elevators from the parking garage are super slow and always one of them is out of order being worked on. I would recommend hotel for business travelers and for a reasonably priced LA hotel to visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Three Star Property Earns Fourth Star with Staff”
Reviews.Author: Matt2540
Reviews.Content: If you grab a rental car at LAX and drive to this property, you win a golden ticket if you actually see the arrival drive entrance on your first pass. The road out front is very busy, very fast, and it's easy to miss. My guess is this hotel was built in the '70s and has been nicely kept up to date. Compared to the attrocious Heathrow Hilton, this is aces. But they did cut corners in some updates and the frequent traveler will notice them. So in one sense, it is not like a new Hilton, but it's not shabby either. I had a fruit plate brought to my room which was very nice. The coffee from room service is horrible, head for the espresso shop in the lobby. Dinner in the lobby cafe was good and the service outstanding. When I arrived at the hotel, I asked for a high floor facing the runways of LAX. The kind young lady was very nice and accomodated this request with a room on the executive floor. It's fun to watch the hustle and bustle of the LAX tarmac. BEST HOTEL SHOWER WATER PRESSURE EVER! Likes: Staff, location to LAX, good food, very secure, great shower, nice bedding Dislikes: Not a nice area, pop machine is not loaded properly so you don't get what you ask for (I'm out $6 on some really crappy liquid I didn't want), STEEP surcharges for everything from parking to internet access, building is aging, pillows suck.

Reviews.Title: “Location for an overnight.”
Reviews.Author: 1manWOLFpack_12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here numerous times before and I'm a Diamond Member but I will say I was tempted to check out within my first 2 hours here. I did not receive any type of "upgrade" and my room had 2 mediocre beds but the furniture had been updated. My room was located next to the elevator and the size and appearance of a inner cruise ship room. The window was about 1 foot by 1 foot and facing another building. The executive lounge was completely empty and had appeared to not have been cleaned since earlier in the day. I brought this to the tenants attention but nothing was done to replenish any of the snacks or mess. Upon arrival I needed to complete a few things for business but beware they do have a business center but have your credit card ready. $3 a minute to use the internet, $.35 per age printed and $.50 per page to fax. I mean how can Hilton advertise having a business center and whats the point in having status when you have to pay for these items to use. I have stayed at numerous other Hilton properties and never had to pay for this. Stay at the Embassy Suites around the corner if your needing to get work done. Trolley to Manhattan Beach and fitness center is the only reason I give this place a 3/5

Reviews.Title: “Nice updated room but comes with loud noise from the hall all night”
Reviews.Author: paterpan
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was nice, the rooms were updated and modern and the beds were comfortable. Location is great as it is very close to the airport and to my surprise I did not hear much airplane noise.

Reviews.Title: “Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoMex
Reviews.Content: Average Airport hotel, tv was malfunctioning due to the system, or so they said, nothing they could do about it, too bad when you just want to rest and watch tv, or order a movie. Only some channels were available, at least... Only good thing is they have a 24 hour Deli in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “MIA receptionist”
Reviews.Author: jn9okhu
Reviews.Content: This is a bad review for one particular reason. My wife got booked into the hotel after a flight was diverted and rescheduled. I called late at night 4am, to make sure my wife didn't miss her flight (early that morning). There is no direct room calling system; all calls must be routed through the lobby. I called on and off for over 1/2 hr with nobody answering. Finally, 40 minutes later, the receptionist picks up the phone and reroutes me to my wife's room. Cross your fingers that she makes her flight. Being a Hilton, I'm sure daytime services may be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CricketGirlDarwin
Reviews.Content: We had a day room whilst in transit. The free shuttle bought us from the airport & our room was spacious & clean. The room service was very good. The hotel is a little tired but for a transit visit it is all you need. In saying that, the lobby & bar are very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for visiting LA!”
Reviews.Author: sasakidalem
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Hhonors Diamond member, so I am sorta prejudiced toward Hilton properties, however I was still very impressed with the service and personnel. Location is fantastic to get around LA when you are vacationing with family. Even with hitting rush hour (it seems like it now is all day...) coming back from Hollywood to LAX, it was still 20 minutes. You were within 10-20 minutes of Venice, Santa Monica, downtown, Hollywood, etc. It's not set up for family in reality as you don't have a refrigerator to store leftovers or simple stuff for breakfast (Their fantastic restaurant Andiamo is rather expensive for family dining). You can pick up pastries and Starbucks at the Cafe or Bistro, but otherwise, walk one block to Carl's Jr for breakfast. Denny's is 3 blocks down. Many, many reasonable options abound nearby in Inglewood, Manhattan Beach, Hawthorne, etc, all within 10 minutes drive.They are still doing some remodeling so if you go relatively soon there is some work being done, however, I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Model_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hilton, Los Angeles Airport primarily for 2 reasons, it was very reasonably priced and also it's proximity to the airport. I'm quite picky about my requirements, however, I E mailed Tim Gilmour and he was able to answer all my questions and was extremely helpful. I visited the hotel at the start of a family holiday and it was a great after a long flight to catch the free shuttle bus to the hotel and not have to drive when tired. We were literally in our hotel room within an hour of landing. The hotel is very plush in the lobby and there was no queue to check in. We were checked in by a very helpful and friendly spanish lad (I'm not sure of his name), however he set the scene for all the staff being helpful and friendly. We were assigned room 8030 which was a newly decorated corner double bedded room. I have to say it really exceeded my expectations. The views were excellent and had a twin aspect, they were a plane spotters dream as they looked directly over the runway (I'm not a plane spotter but I appreciated the view!). The room had a 50 inch Panasonic flat screen, coffee maker and bottled water provided. The decor was immaculately clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and found it a good base for travelling to Universal Studios. Whilst at the hotel hotel we ate predominantly in the Towers Executive Lounge on the 16th Floor. The breakfast consisted mainly of cereals/pastries/yoghurt/muffins/toast/juice/hot drinks and was perfect for our needs as a family. In the evening from 5-7pm the lounge serves hot snacks such as pizza/cheese and biscuits and drinks, be aware you pay for any alcoholic drinks but all the rest are free, from 7-9pm there are sweet snacks provided such as cookies etc. We also purchased food at the bistro which we took back to our room. The portion sizes were large and the food was good. As you would expect at an airport hotel there is some noise from the planes taking off, however this didn't bother us at all, and if it did I am sure that the staff would have accomodated a room request the opposite end to the hotel away from the airport. All in all I can genuinely say our stay was faultless and was a great start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A good value airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelRichard
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Hotwire for 1 night. The corner room was large with windows on two walls. It also faced a runway and was a little noisy as a result. The property caters to groups and there was a wedding party going on-no noise and facilities were on floors above the lobby. Good facilities in lobby - gift shop,nice restaurant and Starbucks with extended menu. Airport Checkin kiosk with printer for boarding pass The only negative was a charge for in room wifi which I find insulting especially when it is free at Starbucks. It ranks right up there on my annoy meter with Resort Fees

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff & great location for airport overnights”
Reviews.Author: KWelker
Reviews.Content: This staff was great. We were stuck in LA trying to catch a flight to FIJI which was repeatedly cancelled. Hilton made great efforts to allow us late checkouts and found us rooms when our flight did not take off.... For three days!!!! This is one of the busiest hotels i have ever seen and tgey still managed to accomodate me with style and grace. When I come to LA for an international pacific flight, I will always stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “restful sleep”
Reviews.Author: kathy-hammond
Reviews.Content: i found this hotel very pleasant,was a bit worried as some of the reviews didnt show it in a good light.a good way to start the cruise,did have breakfast at dennys as the hotels was a bit expensive

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing start of our holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Jans_family
Reviews.Content: Requested connecting rooms which were available in the system for Towers rooms but reality was different. In fact suddenly not available which was very strange. Did give the hotel one week in advance a call to confirm there are connecting rooms available and they were. Reservation was changed to a Towers 'suite' with 2 rollaway beds. Room was very outdated and wallpaper was pealing off? Desk for rental car is in the lobby which is very convinient. Will most probably look for an other hotel in LAX next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience by a airport”
Reviews.Author: edolvera
Reviews.Content: I personally try to avoid staying at hotels near airports. After staying at the Hilton Los Angeles Airport, I think they have changed my mind. What a great convenience! Wonderful shuttle service to and from LAX, A Hertz counter where I was able to drop by keys off instead of driving to Hertz. What impressed me more was the wonderful service and the great rooms. I never heard a plane pass over head and the service was first class. I was really impressed by a note that I received from Ricardo Catubig who introduced himself to me and asked if there was anything I needed before I arrived. I did requests some things and Ricardo made sure it was done for my visit. It's people like Ricardo that make staying at the Hilton wonderful! Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just as Good as Before”
Reviews.Author: kelownacruiser
Reviews.Content: We once again stayed here for one night before boarding a cruise at the Los Angeles World Cruise Centre. We took advantage of an e-upgrade for $9 and got upgraded to a Tower Room with access to the lounge and continental breakfast. Well worth it just for the breakfast. The room itself was average but clean and had a great view of the runway. This hotel definitely needs a top to bottom renovation but given the room rate it was decent. The lounge is too small given the traffic it gets for breakfast. They need more tables and chairs. The breakfast was good, easy to fill up. I recommend this hotel for a short stopover if you need to catch a plane or a ship. There is aircraft noise especially when aircraft land due to the thrust reversers. We are aviation fans so it didn't really bother us and it's not loud enough to wake you up.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Fayaya
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be more conveniently located if you are in transit at LAX. We had a one-night layover on the way to Taipei and made our usual choice--the LAX Hilton. Check-in was a tad uneven (no one was at the Gold Card desk and a long line at the desk for the regular guests), but hey, it was New Year's eve. Room was nice--nothing special, but no problem. Free breakfast was OK, but nothing special. And van to airport was crowded, but we got a seat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & very comfortable at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: weigy01
Reviews.Content: I had a 1 night stop over with the day in LA so opted for somewhere close to the airport for ease of connection. I was not sure of where to stay in LA as it was my first time. This was an excellent choice! Firstly for connections: There is a bus that can take you to the beach for only a few dollars, a day trip sightseeing tour (which I opted for) collects you from the hotel and drops you off again and was organised through the concierge. They also have a frwequent shuttle bus to the airport, which is only around 10 mins away. Secondly, the service was excellent. There was a wedding, some sort of meeting on and you would never know. No waiting in line for receptionists to become available, freindly staff, quick service, really excellent. Lastly, the place was comfortable, spacious and exceptionally clean. The rooms were obviously very newly renovated and wow, I felt so relaxed here. Only down side was breakfast. I wouldn't recommend including breakfast as part of your room booking and just opt for someting off the a la carte when you are there as I have seen better breakfast offerings, but this is really minor point. Overall, cannot recommend enough!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Raymondocanuck
Reviews.Content: We arrived from an exhausting flight from Bangkok hoping for an early check in. The shuttle driver was very professional and helpful. We received a very warm welcome from the staff and were grateful that he was able to provide us with a room on the 6th floor. The room was spotless and inviting. It was also very quiet considering the proximity to the airport The bed was extremely comfortable with lots of pillows so we had no trouble getting the sleep we so desperately needed. My travel companion was ill and needed some special attention from the restaurant staff who went the extra mile to ensure that dietary needs were met. All with a smile. The concierge advised us of the hotel shuttle that runs every hour to Manhattan Beach and two shopping malls. At $5 round trip it was a good way to spend the day waiting for a late flight next day. Free wi fi in the lobby was appreciated. Checkout was fast and friendly. Cold lemonade and citrus water was provided in the lobby. All in all, this stay was the ideal way to shake off the travel blues. This is a well run hotel with well trained and outstanding staff. I'll stay there again in a heartbeat and I'll be recommending others do so too.

Reviews.Title: “Los Angeles Favorite”
Reviews.Author: Nipper1234
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times in the last 8 years on business. The location is excellent, a free airport shuttle, and excellent fitness facilities make this a favorite. The staff are friendly and the executive lounge for Hilton honors members has great views of the LAX runways, plus nice snacks and breakfast. The typical hotel restaurant is OK, but the adjacent Italian restaurant is very good. Only negative experience was when they had a large group of tourists using breakfast coupons which really messed up getting to a meeting on time. Hertz has a desk and rentals at the hotel which is a very nice convenience. The rooms are spacious and clean, at typical Hilton standards.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs, though it is convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: rpb2654
Reviews.Content: Hilton LAX. Spent over 100 nights there in the past few years. Have developed some great relationships with the staff there over the same time period, and for the most part, have considered it my home away from home as I travel weekly. The executive lounge is the perfect mix of convenience and food options in the am, with a more than helpful and friendly staff. Ricardo in the executive lounge, on more than one occasion, has checked me in, in advance, and placed me in my preferred room. (Having stayed so many nights at this property, I unfortunately have memorized more info regarding this property than needed). The evening lounge is nice as well, and a reprieve from the general business of the day. There are challenges here. Check-in at the front desk can take forever at the wrong time. Shuttle service is unpredictable depending on how many people come in at any given time, and if you're in a hurry you will not want to rent from the Hertz on-site. In January 2012, my business rate increased and I sought out other local options. I definitely appreciated the people, and my 3 out of 5 stars is no reflection of the staff. Aside from the intermittent frustration with check-in and timeliness on other limited matters, the overall experience was positive, and if it were not for a substantial rate increase in January 2012 I would still be staying at the Hilton LAX when in LA on business.

Reviews.Title: “Big Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: peggysue930
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for an overnight before or after a flight at LAX. By shuttle, it is 10 to 15 minutes once you are on the shuttle. The hotel itself is nicely appointed and clean. The staff has always been friendly and helpful. The downsize though is the size. This hotel is huge and when several planes land near the same time, the line for check in can be very, very long. It has taken me anywhere from 5 minutes to check in to over an hour. The bar is fine- but the bartenders aren't very concerned with service. The food at the Italian restaurant on site was less than mediocre- especially considering the prices. Overall, though, this is a very convenient and clean hotel near LAX

Reviews.Title: “The convenience trumps any negative”
Reviews.Author: llesniew
Reviews.Content: Convenient not only to LAX, but so many other spots in Los Angeles that I actually stay here pretty much all the time as my base when in town. And if you have a 6am flight it's even better. The Executive lounge is a nice touch with views of the runways if you are an HHonors elite member - but unfortunately it is only open mornings and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Okey hotel, but nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: VikingsEnjoyingLife
Reviews.Content: Good hotel compared to the other hotels nearby. The bathrooms are either very clean or very dirty! We have ended up with both. Last year we asked them to store two bags for us when we went to hawaii, they did it for no extra charge! very good!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with no soul”
Reviews.Author: Clubworldfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night before an early morning flight to Florida. Hotel was functional, no passion or interest from the staff, you are simply a guest. Ordered a room service breakfast by hanging the menu on the door handle at 10pm, woke up and checked the door handle and found it still there at 6am, so had to pack up quick and get down to the restaurant. Shuttle bus is a general service that stops at a few hotels, it was very crowded even at 7.30am so would hate to see it when all the long haul flights are getting ready to go. It was OK for the 1 night, but there was nothing special about it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nikki721
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the airport with free shuttle service to and from airport ever 15 to 20 minutes. The check-in process is so fast an easy with pleasant employees. I was actually put in a newly remodeled room which was very nicely done and beds very comfortable. Even the hallway were remodeled. The only bad thing was the walls are thin. I could hear the shower and blow dryer at 5:30 a.m.. The executive lounge is average and nothing to complain about but nothing to be brag about. Basic veggie tray, 1 hot appetizer, some cheese, and fruit. Breakfast is the standard cereal, fruit, yogurt and breads. Kinda wished they would of had boiled eggs to have a non carb item.

Reviews.Title: “Used To Be Better”
Reviews.Author: JSSMetroD.C.
Reviews.Content: I know that this hotel is simply for those going in and out of LAX airport. However, two things stand out and not in a good way. The Executive Lounge's offerings have been going steadily downhill and this last visit, breakfast was bare bones. Yes, there is fruit, cereal and some breads. But everything is spread out on the counter to look as if there is an abundance of items. The rooms have comfortable beds but when are the t.v.'s going to come into the 21st century? Service at check in is prompt and cordial.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, close to LAX with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: flenart
Reviews.Content: The only negative thing I can say about this hotel is that there is no free wireless internet, and that you have to pay for the day (I think it's 12 Dollars). Otherwise, the rooms are comfortable and quiet and the staff do their utmost to make sure you are happy. Especially if they happen to give you a room that is not to your liking - it will be changed in a snap. Otherwise the Bistro and Bar downstairs are good and there is always a hot beverage to be had. Great for traveling.

Reviews.Title: “A lot more then I expected”
Reviews.Author: McGeepers
Reviews.Content: Room type; Standard room : Stats: Beds; comfy, plenty of pillows. Bathroom; standard style, clean with nice accessories. Check in; Fast and efficient. Overall impression; Due to it being an airport hotel my expectations weren't that high, but the from the moment you walk into the lobby and then into your room it's hard not to be impressed by this property. The rooms have been recently renovated and are comfortable and functional. I only had coffee, so I can't comment on the onsite food. Parking was $25 for the night. The complimentary shuttle was reliable and had ample space. I will stay here again next time I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lovellfamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on stopover in LA. a very pleasant hotel with good facilities. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Rooms, Average Service, Average Location”
Reviews.Author: EndlssSummer
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Location within 2 minutes of hotel Cons: 1. Location not at airport 2. Rooms feel old and stodgy

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a stopover at LAX.”
Reviews.Author: PerthKarmon
Reviews.Content: Close to LAX and very reasonably  priced for a nice hotel. Arrived at 11.30 and was given an early check in - no questions asked. The room had 2 double beds and was quite spacious. The bathroom was small but big enough. Bath with shower over. The shower tap was damaged in some way which made it hard to turn on (but we managed it). We purchased 24hour access to wifi which cost $12.95. It did not work very well in our room at all. My daughter was able to access a free connection in the lobby area which had excellent response. We had a nice meal in the lobby bar which cost $14 each for a nice steak (ground beef) burger with fries. The drinks were well priced as well. We were here overnight between flights so had a free afternoon. There is an excellent shuttle 'tram' (Ocean Express Trolley Service) that runs between the airport hotels and Manhattan Beach & Village shopping centre, each hour, for $5 per head. This gets you there and back and you can hop off at different stops along the way. Lots of little bars, coffee shops and restaurants - a great way to kill a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Lessons I would like to share with you”
Reviews.Author: personaindecisa
Reviews.Content: We bid for a hotel on priceline and got hilton. Unfortunately, I had to move two times because the rooms they gave me the first and second time had tiny bathrooms. Here are the lessons I have learned - 1) Request for a refurbished room 2) Request for a room with a big bathroom 3) Request for a room facing away from the airport if you want to sleep well 4) Park elsewhere because Hilton LAX parking rates are very high. 5) Bring your workout clothes because they have a fully equipped gym.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, Refurbished?”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhotelcritic
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton LAX for one night before a flight. I was placed on the most recently renovated floor. The room was OK, but the bathroom was approximately 6' x 7' and circa 1950. Additionally, the bathroom was filthy with poor water pressure. The shower and toilet were obviously not touched with the renovation and helped to make the bathroom a complete disconnect from the room . The Hilton should have reduced the room size and increased the bathroom size to create a more modern and updated bathroom. Service was horrible from the front desk to the restaurant. I had communicated with a Front Desk Manager named Tim early the day of my arrival to pre-assign a room which was given away to another guest when we arrived. The front desk clerk lied and said the room was not ready only to be told a few minutes later by a Manager that the room was actually assigned to another guest. Why did it matter? It mattered because I was with my wife and 2 children and needed a room with 2 double beds and was given one with a king instead. In the morning when it was time to catch a shuttle to the airport I encountered a long line that I waited in for 30 minutes before deciding to take a cab to the airport. I barely made my flight. Anyway, the Hilton LAX simply does not need to care about service as they area very busy airport and convention hotel that gets booked solid and sold out frequently regardless of the rooms/service. It amazes me within the major chains that wear the names such as "Hilton" that the chains allow such discrepancies from hotel to hotel within the brand that are simply inconsistent. There are certain chains such as the Ritz Carlton or even the Hilton Garden Inn's where consistency amongst properties seems to be much more predictable. For people needed to spend a night at LAX who want a reasonably nice room that is updated and modern I suggest the Westin LAX. If you can afford to spend a bit more the Ritz Carlton Marina Del Rey is about 10 minutes from LAX, but a really terrific property. They also provide a free airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: takemewithu28
Reviews.Content: I was sick by the time my flight arrived at LAX. Really sick. Ready to cry, wanting mommy sick. So by the time I retrieved my luggage and boarded the Hilton's shuttle (which arrived within moments and featured a very helpful and kind driver), all I wanted to do was crawl into bed and sleep. But check-in wasn't for a few hours and I worried that there might not be a room available for me. No need for the worry. While the hotel was bustling with people and activity, check-in was swift and a room was ready. The hotel clerk was very sweet and made the process painless. Within minutes, I was in my room on the renovated 9th floor and enjoying much needed slumber in a wonderfully comfy bed. And the room was quiet! I didn't hear a thing until my alarm went off hours later. Truly, the HIlton was a godsend to me. When I finally did arise and look around, I noted that the room was modern, very clean and extremely comfortable. There isn't free WiFi, but that wasn't important to me on this trip. My view was of the pool, which was closed for renovation but, I wasn't in need of a pool, so that didn't bother me. I could see the airport, which was kind of cool. If I really listened for it, I could hear planes landing and taking off, but it was faint noise and nothing that bothered me. There were complimentary ear plugs in the room. I never used them. Two days later, I was feeling much better and treated myself to the breakfast buffet. The options were many overall but I'm gluten free and, therefore, basically had fruit, scambled eggs and some bacon. It was quite a pricey breakfast and the quality was just average, but that's pretty typical of hotel food. I wasn't expecting more. The service was attentive and it was pleasant to sit, sip coffee and read the paper. There was a big conference going on the weekend I stayed here but, again, I wasn't bothered by any noise and got a kick out of seeing the unique attendees for this less-than-mainstream event. And even though the lobby was crowded, I never waited for service, got cabs quickly and felt well taken care of (many thanks to wonderful Tim in customer service). I took a trolley car into Manhattan Beach for $5 -- a cab would have cost me $30-- and that worked out well. The trolley stop is just outside the entrance of the hotel -- buy your ticket at the valet desk. The free shuttle to the airport was an excellent perk and eliminated any need to rent a car. I'd stay at the LAX Hilton again, happily. By the time I boarded the plane to return home I was feeling so much better. Thank you, Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a base to see LA”
Reviews.Author: jeffniffer
Reviews.Content: Hotel is adjacent to Airport. Rooms refurbished. Very comfortable. Breakfast $22 excellent, good choice, everything you could think of to eat, even Asian food. Sets you up for the day. Waitress service excellent, very attentive. Had dinner as well. Reasonably priced,lovely food. Light and airy restaurant. Concierge very helpful, put us in contact with tour company who do, Studios, Rodeo Drive, LA by Night, Hollywood and many more. Picked up at door and returned to Hotel. Good prices. Also right outside the Hotel is the Trolley Bus stop. Had a trip to Manhattan beach. Good coffee shops and restaurants there. Lovely beach, surfing, pier, skating path. Calls at shopping Village (80 shops) and Plaza el Segundo (40 shops) . Cost $2.50 return.

Reviews.Title: “Long overdue renovated rooms are a big upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Popovova
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the new updated rooms that were long overdue. The rooms are now much brighter, fresher, and more modernly furnished. Some great upgrades include new carpet, good beds with a nice headboard, a comfortable chair with ottoman, and a dresser with an integrated safe. Unfortunately, the safe had not been hooked up yet, so was useless. And while it is impossible to compensate for the very low ceilings, the way the headboard and curtains were designed seems to make the room more spacious. Unfortunately, a terrible experience with a room service ordering attempt kept my rating of this property from being 5-star. In an attempt to order breakfast, I was unable to get the operator to accept an order for rye toast with my eggs! Despite spelling R-Y-E, and the fact that it was clearly on the menu, the order taker said that they never heard of it! After agreeing to get wheat toast, I was then told that the order would be ready in one hour! Really? I just went to the executive lounge instead...much easier, and received service more reminiscent of expectations of Hilton (and rye toast!). I've stayed at this hotel more than a dozen times, and will happily return given the room improvements, I just won't order room service.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, food is worse.”
Reviews.Author: chiefbeef85
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, just make sure you don't eat at the hotel itself. The food is very sub par. The room was fine, it was clean and comfortable. The gym is nice with plenty of equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Depressing hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpalmer
Reviews.Content: Something about the rooms and corridors in this hotel will leave you wanting. Perhaps it's the low ceilings or the lack of furnishings and lighting in the rooms, or maybe it's just the hotel's location in general. I can't imagine why you'd want to stay here unless you had an overnight layover at LAX; otherwise, pick something with a little more character. On the positive side, the concierge lounge is among the best of the domestic Hiltons. Great views of LAX and ample breakfast offerings. Lounge staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service and Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: RayceCar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night, on a 2 day trip to Los Angeles. This was our first time to LA and we loved it! Our flight came in at 11:30am, and we had no trouble checking in at NOON. The front desk lady even upgraded us to a corner suite! (Room 1612). It was AMAZING! I am an airplane freak, and this room provided amazing views of aircraft on final to the south complex! (Next time, I will request a corner suite on the west side of the building, as it will provide you with awesome views of LAX and the Pacific Ocean! Many tours leave right from the hotel doors -- literally! We took the 4 1/2 hour LA tour ($65), it was amazing! They let you get out and walk around at Rodeo Drive, the Farmers Market, and at Santa Monica beach (we didn't that day because it was raining -- but we still saw it!) Sleeping was no problem, as the walls are very well insulated! (I didn't sleep much, as I was watching a bunch of red eye/international departures! :) The next day we got up and had breakfast in the lounge (very small and crowded but provided a nice breakfast!), then went down and caught the 10:00 Ocean Express to Manhattan Beach (It stops right outside the hotel, and is only $5 roundtrip!!) We spent an hour at the beach and on the pier. It isn't as cool or fancy as other piers such as Santa Monica pier, but it is very nice and everyone is really friendly! We caught thr 11:30am Ocean Express back to the hotel and got back around noon. Just in time to catch the very nice airport shuttle to LAX, in time to catch our 3:00pm flight to Omaha (via Denver)! Very nice hotel, and will DEFINATLEY be back this summer when we return to LA! Thanks for the awesome, friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Airport Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Craigsworld
Reviews.Content: There are some hotels that I keep coming back to . . . and the Hilton LA Airport is one of them. It's a well run hotel with excellent customer service, very close to the airport with frequent shuttle service and, on this visit, I was provided an upgrade to a two-room junior suite. The beds are super comfortable, two flat screen TVs, comfortable furniture, and, even though I had a smaller bathroom, there's a great shower. I am also a big fan of the Hilton Honors breakfast and evening lounge. While the lounge is rather small and sometimes a bit crowded, they serve a generous breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms = Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: TravelPrincess69
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice in the past 2 months and yes, they are undergoing an enormous renovation. Because of my status, I got a renovated room both times -- they are gorgeous -- high tech, great big flat screen, comfy beds, lots and lots of electrical outlets, clean carpets, etc. Internet worked perfectly, so I could get my work done. I love the executive lounge -- Mr. Smiley takes care of us well, and even at 10 minutes to closing the appetizers, he called down to have them replenished -- outstanding!!! The views from the lounge are nice -- planes taking off and landing. Gentle readers: yes it is an AIRPORT property -- meaning there will be airplanes nearby! I felt my room was very quiet. I dined in the restrauant for first time and was delighted. An attentive staff -- you have two choices -- either the Italian side or the American side. I chose Italian and had a lovely meal from appetizer, beverage, all the way to dessert (love the shot glass sized desert portions -- cuts down on the guilt -- "just perfect") Check in was a breeze, so was check out. I like to drop my rental off -- the valets are accomodating to watch it while I check in and run up to drop off my luggage. I then come back down and drive the rental car to nearby Rental agency. It's a nice 10-15 minute walk back, and I don't have a car to juggle in the am. Their shuttle service to LAX is good -- super busy, long line -- so give yourself extra time. They get you there quickly and with a smile. To sum: I love this property!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, very secure stay”
Reviews.Author: dctraveler6010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for a quick recent trip. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was large. We had an upgraded double room. Decor in halls was updated and clean and bright. All staff were friendly ad helpful. There was a lot of security in the halls, lobby, elevators, etc so we felt quite safe. We weren't sure if there had been incidents in the past to justify so much security but we had no issues as everyone was friendly and bright. The chicken wings at the bar were quite good. Full amentities. Nice light breakfast in a lounge upstairs. Gym was a bit dated but adequate. Got used to the noise from the planes. Convenience was terrific for our short weekend trip. Overall of comfortable stay with no issues

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Good Sized Room”
Reviews.Author: EmmaCherry
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stop over here to break up the long flight from Australia to New York. I arrived at the check in counter at 8.30 in the morning with fingers crossed that I could check in earlier than the hotel's policy. The gentleman at check-in was very welcoming and gave me a room straight away. The room was a great size, the furnishings were all clean and in a good state of repair. I found the bed to be comfortable and the bathroom was immaculate. I ordered room service for dinner and it was delicious and I thought that the prices were fair. A very economical hotel that is staffed with courteous and professional people. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Medicore, Older Hotel Which Is Good For No More Than 1 Night”
Reviews.Author: Michael_SD
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I understand you don't go to airport hotels for their fabulous accommodations and amazing dining and incredible customer service. You pretty much know they will be high-volume hotels which offer the basics. Due to my job, I am put in this hotel often. And it's fine. It's good for a shower and a night's sleep. This is an old hotel....like 1970s old. But they are in the midst of a room renovation (sorely needed), which is making it a little more liveable. The old style tube tvs are being replaced by large flat screens, the stained carpeting is being replaced by a fresh new design and the overall new room style is modern and boutique-ish. The bathrooms do still feel old, but they are clean and offer the new Peter Thomas Roth bath products. This Hilton offers 2 dining options - a 24-hour cafe that offers pizza, salads and sandwiches, and a full-service restaurant. Both are not that great, but there is nothing to eat in the area (except for fast food). The Landings Bar also offers some food options. I've never had the room service, but that is available as well. The bartenders in the Landings Bar make great drinks and are friendly. There are large crowds at this hotel. There are often lines for the airport shuttle and the hotel hosts large conventions with weird people - just imagine a hotel overrun by people dressed in anime outfits, stuffed animals or wizards. Most of the staff are pretty friendly and handle the weird crowds well. However, the front desk staff are a little irritable at times, and you can tell they are tired of the chaos and just want to go home. Eventhough the hotel is located right at the airport with views of the runways, it is fairly quiet. I've never had trouble sleeping here, except for some of the noisy rooms next to housekeeping closets. I have also had a couple rooms with heat that didn't work. On cold nights, it kind of sucks. Both times it was late and I was tired, so I had to run the shower at full heat to steam up the room since it was so cold. This is a perfect hotel for one night before or after a flight. Any longer than that, you will be unhappy by the crowds, old feel of the hotel and lack of anything to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “hotel,clean cheap,nice”
Reviews.Author: suwwoz58
Reviews.Content: i recentley had to go to a wedding at this hotel , flew in from boston, so this was a good location for alot of out of towners for this wedding, the accomadations where great. we had a corner room and it looked like the planes where coming to greet us, even though we could see them fly close we never heard them, so i guess they had good windows for sound. the room was very pretty, great beds .top floor, continental breakfast one floor down, took the shuttle from the airport , i/2 mile away. we took a taxi into hollywood,42.00 dollars the room was 99.00 a night , i split eveything with my friend. they also offer night drinks and snacks and dessert at 7pm. included in rate, great place for short time, not a place to be close to sightsee, but recommend it for a quick stop, because the neighborhood is no place to walk around,but beautiful inside. food was great too

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient airport hotel, almost everything works”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after a late-night LAX arrival. It's got just about everything an airport hotel needs: clean and spacious rooms, good food, a nice executive lounge. And I got a reasonable room rate. My only complaint was that the hotel shuttle took an awfully long time to get to the airport pick-up area. I was waiting for over 30 minutes, possibly because one Hilton shuttle drove by without stopping at my location. Meanwhile several shuttles for less highly regarded hotel chains stopped two or three times to pick up their customers. The main reason to stay at an airport hotel is to be in your room significantly sooner than you would be if you were staying downtown. In this case that objective was not fulfilled. Any more than fifteen minutes' wait for an airport hotel shuttle is too long.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility and location negated by the details like poor parking, internet, elevator maint., and staffing.”
Reviews.Author: BunnyandEeyore
Reviews.Content: My room was fantastically spacious, with new flat screen, roomy accessible closet, all new and fresh. The bed was comfy, the furnishing first rate...a lot of money's been invested here. On the otherhand, the front desk was consistently under staffed, half the elevators were working at any given time, parking for guests was in the bottom of the basement while employee parking was much more convenient (never seen anything like this), I've stayed in some primitive low budget backwater places where the internet actually worked and was FREE...but not this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's easy”
Reviews.Author: igbtys
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Hilton LAX after staying at other hotel chains around LAX. I will be back. The hotel shuttle runs regularly (as it does for most hotels) and whilst the hotel's interior is rather "tired" (again, not on there own here) the thing that puts the Hilton ahead of others is the service and quick, easy, painless checkin/checkout which is exactly what you need after a long flight and are desperate for some sleep or rushing to the airport for an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Management is great”
Reviews.Author: Hernandezmm
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Food is great. Management is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Test C
Reviews.Content: We got it for a good price, so were overall impressed. The rooms were large and clean. The pool was under renovations. We had a good meal at the bar. They had a shutlle to the airport. You could hear the planes, but we left the air conditioning on which drowned out the noise. We had a king size bed, but I feel my partners every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find service”
Reviews.Author: Eugene1992
Reviews.Content: Arriving at night at around 11 pm in a major city should not have been a big deal. When we got there it was very hard to find someone to help us move in, and when we did, it took them a long time to compete our request. It was surprising how slow things happened there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stopover”
Reviews.Author: OskieTor
Reviews.Content: Shuttle took about 20 minutes to arrive at LAX and made several pick up stops before heading to the hotel. As a HHonors member they had upgraded us to an Executive room near the end of a quiet hall which was perfect. I was also offered free Internet access in the room. I was told in advance a charge would appear on my bill but just ask in the morning to have it removed. That worked fine. Our flight was later in the afternoon and we asked for a one hour extension on the room check out time and that was fine. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Brusselscharlie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hilton LAX a number of times over the last 10 years as it was convenient with a courtesy shuttle bus to the airport. This will however have been our last visit. We had booked a King BedTowers room. What was a good standard 10 years ago is now in dire need of refurbishment. They are refurbishing the hotel, but they were also doing it already last year and somehow they still put us up in a room with insufficient sound insulation to block out the noise of airplanes taking off, with no welcoming light as you walk into the room so that the first thing you have to do is scramble for a light switch, with a huge old TV from the dinosaur age, with a tiny bathroom that has no separate shower, but the old fashioned thing of a curtain over the bath tub. The view did not offer us any joy either as it was the full view of the airport runway ! The only excellent element in the hotel is its concierge service : friendly, knowing and expert.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic break, just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: arowetravels
Reviews.Content: We usually travel on a budget and then splurge on a nice dinner or special event but after our journey and experience in LAX on our way down to Colombia.... Where we had no sleep for our 8hour late night lay over we decided to award ourselves a treat. This was my first Hilton, and it won't be my last, it was clean, warm and welcoming. We found the service fast and friendly. Our room was a spacious king, with a great shower. The hotel has nice amenities inside but outside there really isn't much. It ALS had the best hotel room coffee I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD airport noise 24/7 - OLD and run down”
Reviews.Author: SoFLme
Reviews.Content: I spent 100 nights/yr in hotels - mostly Hilton family. I don't expect much in general from airport or convention center hotels generally. The LAX Hilton was at one time pretty nice. Those days are long past. Even on the "executive floor" in a suite, the airport noise is very loud and constant all night long. The furnishings are worn and shabby. The air conditioning is loud and you cannot set a temperature and expect it to be maintained. All night you're up turning the thermostat dial up or down trying uselessly to get the temperature right. I really have nothing good to say about this place. Even the executive lounge - my favorite amenity in Hilton hotels - is far too small and thus you cannot find a place to sit. If you have to be at LAX and belong to the Hilton Hhonors program you may want to stay here. Otherwise, I'd keep looking. This property desperately needs renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Such great value for money”
Reviews.Author: xena_mojo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before we flew on to Denver. It was so good that we booked another night for when we returned. Our room was an executive king on the 17th floor and had the comfiest bed I have ever slept in. We want to know if you can take one home, just like you can buy the robes! The room was surprisingly large for a hotel near the airport. The bathroom was big enough. Sure, the fittings are not luxurious, but it is clean and inviting and certainly perfectly fine for the very inexpensive price. What really matters is if the bed is comfortable and it absolutely is!! We had a continental brekky included which was had in a breakfast room. On the 16th floor. It had all forms of bread, pastries, fresh cut fruit, yoghurt, eggs, cold meats and cheeses etc. it was certainly good enough to give you a start to your day. There was also snacks later in the afternoon and desserts later, which was only cookies the one time I went, but what can you expect for free? We paid $114 a night - what a bargain! We also were allowed an early checkin on arrival at 8 am and a late checkout till 2 pm on leaving. They also store your baggage if you have a late flight, which we did. I emailed the hotel before I left home to ask questions and was able to talk with a manager about my arrival. Emma was very helpful and bent over backwards to accomodate my needs - above and beyond my expectations considering the small room tariff. Hertz rent a car is on site, so convenient and reasonably priced. We got a small to medium sized Chevrolet for $85 bottom line cost with complete and total insurances, GPS, petrol to drive with and no need to fill up on return, pick up and return to hotel carpark, or we could return to the airport if we wished. Our stay with Hilton was excellent! I will return time and time again!

Reviews.Title: “A Clean, Quiet and Convenient location to LAX”
Reviews.Author: Jay A
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers Park & Fly packages that include up to 7 days of parking in their underground garage with your hotel stay either the night prior to your flight or the night after your return flight. It is a large property (12 - 14 floors) yet manages to provide excellent service. For views of the runway at LAX, ask for a room on the side facing Century Boulevard. There are the usual services like a gym and cafe though I didn't use them. The shuttle to the airport departs every 15 minutes and operates 24 hours a day. I liked this hotel so much that I will be staying there again in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “quality, comfortable, safe air port hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harithw
Reviews.Content: great location, great staff. actually very helpful staff. They agreed to keep my luggage for an extra day. comfortable spacious rooms. great for overnighting. will repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Clean and Excellent Insulation”
Reviews.Author: YTOAY
Reviews.Content: Close by to LAX airport, lobby is grand, hotel securities at elevators, room insulation is great you cannot hear outside noise nor next room noise.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: jeanie693
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great price during Christmas. It was very comfortable, clean and quiet. The bed was extremely comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Convenient to the Airport”
Reviews.Author: Zaideeanne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Los Angeles Airport for a night while between flights from the eastern United States to Southeast Asia. The hotel was very nice, and the reception staff was friendly and helpful. I was concerned about hearing airplane noise all night and asked to be given a room in a quiet location. The hotel staff obliged, and my room, which faced away from the airport, did turn out to be very quiet. The hotel seems to be well insulated from the noise of airplanes constantly flying overhead. I also was able to get a late check-out at 6:00 PM for $50.00 extra, which seemed reasonable for having the use of the room for an extra half day. (My flight to Singapore did not leave until 8:00 P.M.) The bed was comfortable, and the room was very clean. I checked in and out at off-peak times, so there was not much of a line at the reception desk during either check-in or check-out. I thought it was nice, though, that they had a separate line for HHonors Club members.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected for an older airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: NERoth
Reviews.Content: Extremely friendly and helpful personnel though the hotel is large and impersonal. We were in a recently updated room. Nice furnishings and large floor plan, though low ceiling created cramped feeling. The hotel if fully functional for an overnight before or after flight stay. The Cafe in the lobby had a limited menu but terrific food and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better...”
Reviews.Author: Mauizach
Reviews.Content: Flew in to LAX on a Friday pre cruise stay before New Yaers Eve. As you leave baggage walk out the door and look for a light blue shuttle for Hilton careful get the right one because they share shuttles between hotels. Everything was fine until hitting the Hilton checking in was an issue, one person checking regular guest two checking Hilton Honor holders. Was not bad, but employee's need to react better with customer upon arrival. We got in very late so missed out on the main restaurants that night. The breakfast buffet the next morning was good for a buffet, but service again was lacking due to the amount of business. This large of a hotel should have a larger server staff over all during holiday events. The place is large long walks to rooms, but the room are very nice. The airport noise level is not a problem at all. Sleep very soundly bed are also great....Overall Very Good place just missed out on Excellent by the lack of overall staff. Even the doorman was overtaxed, but looked fine in his formal attire, nice touch Hilton. Would stay again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good to stay for a short time”
Reviews.Author: marishka21au
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good service-however a bit far from attractions, main shopping centers.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eleomorsa
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel. We booked a "Great Getaway," and it was. The room was clean and comfortable, the breakfast was excellent and the service no complains.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: zocko
Reviews.Content: Flew in to LAX on a Friday pre cruise. Walk out the door and look for a light blue shuttle for Hilton. Within 30 mins. we're checking in. We were very late so we just missed the restaurants but did get to enjoy the buffet in the morning. The place is beautiful, would go again. You can see the planes out the window but we slept fine.

Reviews.Title: “Day Room before LAX Airport”
Reviews.Author: gwallis1
Reviews.Content: As you would expect this is a BIG business type hotel, with crowds of People coming and going all the time. The hotel was very clean and the rooms Surprisingly Quiet and well appointed. The concierge desk, is able to arrange Tours of the LA area to suit most needs. Just a note for International travellers with Virgin, dont try and print your boarding passes off from the machines in reception, as we were eventually told it was for domestic travel only, that was after a lot of people had tried and failed. We took a cab down to Venice beach, which cost approx $30 each way. We also did the Venice Canals Walkway, which was a lovely cool and quiet walk. The airport is approx a 5-10 min transfer from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: JAD07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton LAX prior to flying home to Australia. I cannot rate this hotel highly enough. We had booked a tower suite room - one bedroom with two double beds. This was perfect for my husband and I, and our two children. The staff, especially at the restaurants, were very accommodating to our young family. Gus, the Concierge was a delight. We spent a day in Santa Monica before flying home that night. It was a $40 cab ride which was worth it to get out and about in the sun. I would definitely stay again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to the airport and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: a4j21
Reviews.Content: On our honeymoon, we had a one night stop over in L.A. so we stayed at the Hilton. The shuttle from the airport was very easy to find and the drivers were very friendly. The staff were very kind and welcoming to us. The concierge was very helpful. The room was neat and clean. We just had the King Bed room which was very simple, our only problem was that the shower head was quite old and although had great pressure the water went every where and flooded the bathroom floor. We didn't try the room service however we did have dinner and breakfast at the 24-hour bistro and the food and service was great, but pricey. The shuttle bus only took 10 minutes to get there and back to airport. It is close enough to the airport and is somewhat noisy but the room came with ear plugs that we didn't use because it wasn't that bad. Overall I would recommend this hotel for over nighters. :)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & clean for airport stay”
Reviews.Author: JoshBillings
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hilton on multiple occasions for fly in/out trips for business in LA. Unlike some other hotels around LAX, Hilton is clean, well organized, and open late hours. Hotel is in need of updating and I wouldn't recommend it for extended stays for conferences or extended business travel, but for staying close to LAX, it's very well suited.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a quick layover”
Reviews.Author: audreyalan
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on January 1st for one night before a cruise. It was nice and close to the airport, with a free shuttle, Rooms were fairly big. Only disappointment was that we had booked for 2 queen beds but ended up with 2 double beds, which for 4 of us, can be a challenge. Otherwise, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, be prepared for extra costs”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: I loved the beds in this hotel. The room was pretty small, however, for the price, more like the size of a dorm room. The rooms are in clean, quiet, and modern. Costs $20 a day to park the car yourself and the hotel asks you to agree to pay $12 a day for internet access in your room, although they promise to waive the charge. I had to ask remind them of this at checkout, however. Taxes in LA compound the cost as well. The deli in the hotel is expectedly overpriced and pretty bland. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel definitely needs to work on its TV channel selection, though. It has like 10 channels.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Niek87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on January 4 and was not really impressed. Considering that this is a Hilton hotel, I'd expect more. The corridors look like a Quality Inn and need some much needed remodeling. The room looked good though, and the bed was excellent. The bad room was good as well, with a good shower. However, it are the small touches, such as a toilet roll holder that needs to be fixed and a closet door that wasn't properly fixed etc. The hotel just needs some attention on the details. Furthermore, the hotel staff appears to be friendly, but service can be improved. If you can get a good deal you should stay there as the hotel has a good location and still good quality, but paying more than $150 is not recommended! Also watch out for the $20 parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “Best LAX airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonytigerjaz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here more than 100 times. I always stay here on my last night before I fly home the next day in the early morning hours, since I live on the east coast. I check into the hotel and drop off my rental car at Avis the evening before. They don't charge for parking in under 30 minutes. I walk from Avis back to the Hilton.I love the corner alcove king bed rooms overlooking the LAX runway.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive parking!”
Reviews.Author: Elle S
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on a room, loved everything about the hotel. Location was close to major tourist areas as well as highways. Only thing was the $20 parking per night - very expensive plus parking garage seemed to be full all the time and had to circle around for a while for a spot. Would stay at again though.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Thor G
Reviews.Content: Location: 3.5 stars. Very convenient; it is very close to the airport LAX. Accessible to other establishments like Costco, Target, Gasoline station, restaurants, bars and clubs. They offer shuttle services (Free to small fee) not only to the airport but to any local areas as well. The hotel however is hard to find. If it's your first time here, you might miss the small street opening to the entrance of the hotel. Parking: 3.5 stars. $20 self park (validate your ticket for all day in and out parking), $30 Valet per day. Parking lot can be full especially during conferences or weekends but so far, I really have not had an experience where there was no space for me at all. Their parking structure is underground, 4 levels and a bit narrow but hey, it's better than nothing. Imagine staying at a hotel with no parking structure? Some hotels mandates valet parking for $25-30 PLUS tips. So really, this one is not bad. Price. 4 stars. You can actually book $100/night on weekends, which is pretty good considering it's very close to LAX. I think you can get better deals online as well. Room and Decor = 3.5 stars. It's clean, well stocked, comfortable and smells clean. Sheets are above average. I find their room decor/theme simple but pleasant. They have triple thick curtains so if it's pulled shut, the room is pitch black, great for those who need to sleep during the day. I've stayed here multiple times a year, never had problems with noise factor. Sometimes you can hear muffled sounds of planes but not enough to wake me or bother me. Service = 4 stars. Hit or miss for front desk and concierge service. Quick, friendly and accommodating chambermaids, bellhops and valet service. Multiple times, valet would permit me to park at front, just to pick up (or drop off) something in my room or to change clothes. Sometimes, my car will be sitting up front for an hour and there was no hassle from them. TIP: You can request NICELY for a small fridge to be sent up to your room and as far as my experience is concern, it's free. Food = 2 stars. The Cafe and Bistro in the first floor, as well as the room service are expensive and the food are not worth it, but convenient esp. at late hours. Biggest issue I have about this hotel is their telephone service or front desk guest list system ---It's always either broken or in chaos. I have to take 1 1/2 full stars for this nonsense. Not once, twice or three times but almost everytime I'm here, I cannot be contacted by outside parties. If I don't give my room number directly to friends/family who are going to meet me or call me, 8 out of 10, I cannot be reach due to number of mishaps as follows: 1.) Front desk informs my guest that I'm not checked in yet or that there is no such guest at all or I have already checked out! 2.) My guests calls is connected BUT to a wrong room. 3.) My phone room simply doesn't work. It will not ring at all on my end (ringer is on, yes, we checked this multiple times) yet my guest have been calling or trying to reach me. And when they request assistance from them about this error, front desk argues that maybe I'm not in the room or have fallen asleep. Seriously! There's 2x they had to change my room phone when they found out it was really broken (after multiple troubleshooting). This use to frustrates me but now, it's almost comical. I swear, my guest makes fun of this mishap now and have learned not to call the hotel to reach me anymore. Thank God for cellphones! Unlucky for those out of the country visitors who doesn't have local cellphones. TIP: If you don't have a cellphone, make sure to call your party as soon as you are in your room and give your guest your room number. Inform the front desk that you are expecting an important call. If they could not reach you, give them permission to knock on your door. Overall, it's really not a bad hotel. For 3 years now, we have been staying here 2-3 days at a time, 5x or so a year.
