We might venture out and try another hotel in the area but for now, this is our choice of hotel for a short rendezvous in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: srobby
Reviews.Content: We had a hint upon arrival when earplugs were provided on our bed stands and they were needed to quell the sound of the plane traffic across the street at LAX but that was the only negative in an otherwise clean, friendly hotel with two great restaurants and a lovely lobby decorated for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BreckBearSki
Reviews.Content: I had read the other reviews on Tripadvisor before arriving, so when I checked in, I asked "Can I have a recently renovated room?" They gave me one, being Hilton Gold may have helped - but the reviews break up into 2 groups - you either got an old room or a "new" room - the folks with the old rooms are not happy, so do yourself a favor and ask for a "new" one. Set your expectations properly - it's an airport hotel right next to the Marriot and Radisson and all of the airport hotels - so they ALL are going to hear a little bit of airport noise, especially with so many International flights to Asia departing at night. You also hear people in the hallways - coming and going - at all hours of the night - but this is the same as it would be with all of the other airport hotels. The Hilton has a restaurant open 24 hours which is great, fitness is open 24 hours. The breakfast is expensive but if you don't want to pay it, you can either eat at the airport or leave the hotel and walk 100 yards to a fast-food restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stopover”
Reviews.Author: sherbet
Reviews.Content: Had a great one night stopover in early December. The room was quiet and comfortable and included complimentary continental breakfast, as we had upgraded to the Towers. This was great for a quick getaway the next day. The valet was helpful as we arranged to meet relatives at an airport restaurant and had just missed the free shuttle, so he gave us a life there. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok I guess”
Reviews.Author: Twohappygirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lax airport Hilton due to the fact we had a early morning flight out of lax. There was good and bad about our stay. Pros: nice lobby, helpful concierge ,shuttle to the airport that runs every 20 mins or so. Cons: we were given a room on the 3rd floor and while not a smoking room the whole floor reaked of smoke and when I asked to be moved was told this was the only room available. Hallways and rooms were dark,stained and dingy, the room we had had a old tube tv and very limited channels. Pool was closed for remodeling,with no channels to watch on tv and no pool I was at a loss on how to entertain my 2 daughters, it is not like there is much to do near this Hilton unless you have a car which we had turned in prior to checking in here. All in All not a awful stay but next time I need to stay close to LAX I would probably book elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price, free shuttle, no breakfast included”
Reviews.Author: mltubio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for the price and I would stay here again. Good things: there is a free shuttle to/from the airport, which runs every 25 min ***or so***, there is a good gym with great equipment, the bed is good, the room is nice, the soap is quite nice (for hotel soap). The bad: the shuttle doesn't come very often. It is shared with other hotels. We took the Hilton Doubletree shuttle when we arrived, the driver agreed to take us because the Hilton LAX is on the way anyway, that was really nice of him. The hotel has carpeted floors everywhere, which I hate since I am allergic. It is very clean, but could be cleaner. For breakfast, you either pay 20 USD for a buffet style breakfast or you can get a 10 dollar sandwich or a bagel at the deli. I thought there should be a 10-dollar option that would not be as bad as having a sandwich for breakfast. And options to dine at the hotel are not great either. Either a quite expensive Italian restaurant, or a sports bar. We went to the Marriott and ate there, it was quite nice, just a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “A good airport hotel but room service took forever to deliver”
Reviews.Author: asimplejazzlover
Reviews.Content: Hilton LAX is a nice base as an airport hotel. It has a nice lobby. Room is nicely appointed, however the bathroom is rather small. The bed is nice, and the room is adequate for two. It has a coffee maker and amenities provided. I found some rooms are bigger than my room even though we are booked in the same category of room. I do not know why. The concierge guy is really nice, a definite uplifting point of the hotel. I would really recommend the manager to value him. I forgot the name but he was a guy. They have a tour desk at the reception in case you need a tour arrangement. Or else you may also want to rent a car in LA to make your travel smoother and easier. However, the room service takes forever to provide my request. Sometimes I need to call them twice or so. The longest I took note is that they took almost an hour to deliver the plate to my room. All in all, Hilton LAX is a nice airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations Exceeded at every step”
Reviews.Author: Azands
Reviews.Content: We intended just a reasonable place to stay a few nights in LA on the way home from the "real" vacation. We were pleasantly surprised at every stop. The staff was happy, qualified, and helpful for any needs. The room was quiet, super clean, newly upgraded and/or remodeled. The free breakfast buffet was quick, nicely appointed (though the scrambled eggs could have been a lot better/fresher). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFaye
Reviews.Content: Well located to LA international airport and easily accessed via a free hotel shuttle bus. I found the staff accommodating, giving me a room when I arrived about 8am, including breakfast that and the next day. Breakfast was simple but adequate (cereals, toasts, teas and coffee, muffins, fruit, boiled eggs). My room was large, pretty simple and with a comfortable bed and a large-ish bathroom with a shower over a fairly shallow bath and basic toiletries. Staff were well informed and helpful about sights, tours, transport etc. The cafe downstairs served a light and tasty Asian salad.

Reviews.Title: “room with a view”
Reviews.Author: zula44
Reviews.Content: nice lobby (with christmas decorations), very quick check-in, we arrived around 10 in the morning but got the key to our room within af few minutes, very nice. The room was a good size with a comfortable king bed, rather small bathroom but clean. But no safebox, so used one at the reception (no cost) just some administration. My husband loved the view of the airport, expecially at night, see the airplanes land and take off (we were on the 14 th floor). Food in restaurant was oK, friendly service. Wine in the bar rather expensive (for little glass) not impressed with the service. We took the big blue bus to santa monica (1 usd). We will probably stay at this hotel again if we have a flight from LA because of the price was not expensive at all for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very busy top class airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: dougalfreebee
Reviews.Content: The flow of people in and out when we were there was amazing. We waited some time for the shuttle at the airport which also services Embassy Suites and then could not get to the front of the hotel due to the number of vehicles loading and unloading. The room was clean and modern with a comfortable bed as you would hope when in transit after a 12 hour flight. Breakfast was great value with every thing you could want buffet style. Busses stop outside to Santa Monica so easy to get some great shopping in if you have time. Great short stay and a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient and good value”
Reviews.Author: Bartje83
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as a base to explore LA by car. Renting a car is not only useful because the hotel is pretty far from downtown, but LA is so sprawled out a car is pretty essential anyway. So can't really fault the hotel on the location. Rooms are pretty large and well-maintained. Beds are big and very comfortable, linens are clean, bathroom is clean and functional (nothing luxury though) Housekeeping does a good job and never disturbed us. The pool area looked pretty nice, but we didn't get to use it (bad weather!). Breakfast was great, plenty of choice, nice fresh foods. And by day 2, the waiter asked us if we wanted our eggs like we had them the day before. Nice touch. Though we could hear a lot of noise from planes when we first entered the room, we never heard any noise while trying to sleep. It would seem the rooms are not that soundproof. Guess we got lucky, but remember to bring earplugs if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded Rooms and Beds”
Reviews.Author: dcslatts
Reviews.Content: This airport Hilton is one of the largest in the world, but it doesn't suffer in quality or service because of if. Many of the floors have been refurbished and I like the upgrade. The beds and linens in the newer rooms really are some of the most comfortable I've experienced. The only downside is the stale restaurant and bar. They could use major remodeling, especially with the nice places at the neighboring Marriott and Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Very average but convenient”
Reviews.Author: chicksfly000
Reviews.Content: We've stayed herea couple of times when we've had a very early flight the next morning. They have a great shuttle service and they're friendly and efficient. And it's quiet so you get a good night's rest. But the rooms are in need of a bit of redecorating. Hardly a concern though if you're just passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: jazzboots
Reviews.Content: Although convenient for an overnight stay the lax hilton was disappointing. On the plus side it has a useful airline check-in facility. On the minus side our room was in serious need of a makeover. The bathroom in particular looked worn and dated. The tv in the room was a pre flat screen with an awful picture. The prices in the cafe were reasonable but overall unless you get a deal and a refurbished room it is not worth paying a premium just because it is a Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: River0m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not new... but its a pleasant enough stay if you want to be close to the airport. We had a few days there so used the free transport (on a little bus) to Manhattan Beach and other shopping areas which we found really handy. Room service was good, and the bar downstairs plays sports if you're so inclined.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful front desk and concierge!”
Reviews.Author: JHeieck
Reviews.Content: I am a hilton diamond member, so I stay at a fair amount of hiltons. I recently moved my LA Hilton hotel to the Airport Hotel - what a difference! The hotel is very nice - it is a fresh respite from the bustle and grime of the airport. The rooms are well appointed. The hotel has room service 24 hours a day. The exec lounge is well appointed with wonderful views. The hotel has both valet and self parking - depending on your liking. My only issue would be that the suites do not have a small refridgerator.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Great For Business”
Reviews.Author: tara l
Reviews.Content: ARRIVAL: Once arriving in los angeles airport just out side the door you will find various transfer buses which are regular and easy to find. They leave very regularly about every 15mins to go to the hotels. Stopping at maybe 6 hotels but the hilton is usually the first. Hotel entrance is very grand with a few shops coffee and restaurants. Food is shops is snack food but you can also get great meals in the restaurants or order in. Lobby is full of seating so you can rest with your bags when coming in or just hang out during day or before pickups. Wifi is available in lobby and through out hotel at a cost. Conference rooms on second floor are huge and extremely professional. Every thing is very grand and smartly decorated. Checkin: There are about 6 check in staff working at any one time so check in times and queries are quick and efficient. Card keys are provided along with clear direction to rooms. Security staff are working around hotel so it always feels safe. GREAT GYM down stairs. TVs on machines with separate head phones. 4 treadmills, cross trainers, cycle machines and lots of weights. Both free and machines. Small fresh towels in gym and water machines with paper cones. You just use your key card from room to enter gym. ROOMS Great big heavily and newly bedded linen beds with a range of pillows from soft to hard for all needs. No fridge in rooms or mini bar but there is a coffee/ tea making facility. You can hear airplanes passing hotel as it really is that close but the sound proof windows work well and even though i am a very light sleeper i had no problems here. Room service is available. Great deals on bed &breakfast and the buffet was first class. They had something for every one. Healthy fruit both dried and fresh. Breads, buns, eggs, yogurts, cereals. The list goes on. Even strawberries which was a luxury. So if you get the b&b offer you must take it. I didn´t get top ups of coffee as regularly as i would have liked but i know if i had flagged down the staff that would not have been a problem. Dining hall is pretty full of people in mornings but there is plenty of seating arrangements and it means food is always fresh and plentiful. Staff very friendly and helpful at all times. The valet guy even used his own phone to ring my excursion company when i couldn´t find my bus. That was very nice. All in all i would most definitely go back. I was very pleased and even if you spend that little bit extra you get what you pay for. A worry free, speedy checkout very reliable business conference centre with great work out facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay near airport”
Reviews.Author: Alextanbu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here before my parents flying back home. And it is clean and near the hotel. And I reserved it from Hotwire about an month ago and the deal is pretty cheap. Only concern is the hotel is kind of old, but it is pretty clean. Nice by the way

Reviews.Title: “Huge room, grand lobby”
Reviews.Author: amethystam
Reviews.Content: Hotel is about 5-10 minutes from the airport via shuttle bus. Location is remote but quiet. Their is a Carl's Junior Buger and a supermarket nearby. The lobby was posh and very grand, and even the room was big and spacious with good amenities. However, was indeed a hassle to get into downtown Los Angeles. Suitable if you are in LA for only a day or 2.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport location”
Reviews.Author: Hammer222222
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night each way travelling to and from Hawai'i. Within sight of LAX so extremely convenient for airport travel. Complementary shuttle service was frequent, curtious and very well organized. Several airline pilots were also shuttle participants so hotel must be well received. Room was clean, well appointed, nothing fancy but nice. Pillows and king bed were very comfortable. 24hr cafe offers sandwhiches, snacks, pizza, drinks, fresh coffee etc. all essentials for the beleaguered traveller. There's also a bar and more comprehensive eatery available until 1230am for those so inclinded. Only negative: Aircraft engine noise which appeared to cease for 6 hours (1200am - 600am).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for the last leg of the trip”
Reviews.Author: mhd114
Reviews.Content: A few days before heading back East, I realized that my flight is in the early AM. There is no way I wanted to fight with LA traffic in the rush hour with 3 kids in the car. So I chose Hilton (LAX) as always when allowed by company's policy. The hotel location was simple enough to find (with GPS). Found a parking spot under ground P5 level. It was late when we checked in, all of us were pretty tired and just wanted to washup and went to bed. To my surprised, the TV was a 27" tube. I thought I was in the wrong hotel for a moment. It did remind me of the HIE chain elsewhere. The next morning when I was ready to check out, I found out that Hertz has a office here as well. But I needed to move my rental car to P6 level. If I had known about this before hand, I would of park on P6 the night before. Anyway, I wasn't aware of any other HHonor incentives like other reviewer's mention until now. My kids had some cereal for breakfast on the lobby level. The shuttle (every 20 minutes) took us to the airport. Overall, I would stay here again but wish they would upgrade the tub TV to LCD with HD signal.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Thermal Underwear!”
Reviews.Author: DJH-in-Austin
Reviews.Content: Several years ago a friend told me about his experience working for a construction company in California. They were building a large facility for the Air Force. They put thermostats throughout the building and even connected wires to them, but the wires from the thermostats dead-ended above the ceiling. The thermostats were merely there to entertain the occupants, not to actually control the temperature. The Hilton Los Angeles Airport seems to have employed this same construction company…. While the fan control in the room does indeed control the fan speed, the thermostat seems to have no effect on the temperature of the air coming out of the vent. The air is cold, regardless of whether you turn the knob all the way to left to 60 degrees or turn the knob all the way to the right to 80 degrees. I mentioned the problem to the front desk the morning of the second day and was assured that the problem would be fixed. However, the second night was just as cold as the first night. Be sure to bring your thermal underwear because they only provide a very thin foam blanket for the bed. Other than that, this is a pretty functional and well maintained Hilton property that is convenient to the airport and reasonably priced. Here are some tips: 1. Parking – if you are going to drive a rental car, you can pay for your parking in advance on their website and get a slight discount. After that, your credit card functions as your entry and exit card. I found this feature very nice. (See https://www.airportparkinglax.net/ for details) 2. Breakfast on 16th floor - If you are a Hilton HHonors Gold and above member, you can have a complimentary breakfast in the 16th floor lounge. Breakfast was a simple continental type (toast, pastries, fruit, cereal, hard boiled eggs) but it was adequate and the view of airplanes taking off was really pretty. It does get a bit crowded, but if you are patient, you can get a table when someone gets up to leave. I ate at the lounge both mornings. 3. Nice CuisineArt single/double coffee maker in room with Lavazza coffee. 4. Free internet for Hilton HHonors Gold and above. 5. Local Area – if you are planning to drive around and look for local shops and restaurants, the areas to the east and south of the airport are scruffy and uncomfortable. However, the area just a few blocks north on Sepulveda Blvd is very nice with extensive, shiny new retail and nice, well maintained neighborhoods. 6. Dinner – I had a very entertaining dinner at the Buggy Whip Restaurant, about 10 minutes north of the airport on surface streets. The address is 7420 La Tijera Blvd and it is next to Interstate 405. This restaurant is an old establishment and is sort of a time-warp back to the 1960s. The hostess was delightful and served me personally in the bar. I had two excellent martinis and a very nice steak dinner including a salad with Green Goddess salad dressing (their specialty) and a bowl of home-made split-pea soup. The atmosphere was very nice. As I walked out, I noticed that they had a display of several posters of movies that had been filmed there. Notably, the initial restaurant scene from the movie “Date Night” was filmed at this restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Highly Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Marina H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Hilton numerous times on layover and to catch early morning flights. This was perfect when I had about eight hours between trips. The staff are very professional, check in was easy, and I'm certain it was not just the rather late hour. The rooms have soothing color schemes, spacious and very comfortable with excellent quality linens and mattress. I used to fall asleep with no problem and sleep soundly. Food can be ordered in late night and the service was excellent. High speed internet was available in room, and you could plug in your ipod or phone into the stereo system in the room. The price for the rooms is just right.

Reviews.Title: “Service area”
Reviews.Author: Russscot
Reviews.Content: When arriving on the floor on which my room was located I felt that I was on a service corridor. However the room was standard Hilton. The hotelneedsto upgrade the public area on each floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pit Stop”
Reviews.Author: Cassie L
Reviews.Content: I wished I had stayed overnight at the Hilton before boarding for New York. For the price you pay for this hotel and the service you recieve it was amazing. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are travelling from Australia to New York. The flight from Australia to New York is too long and you really need to stop overnight to avoid having jet lag.

Reviews.Title: “Home ... If you have to go there.”
Reviews.Author: avodoc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about 3 or 4 times now, so I don't completely hate it. I keep getting lured by their stay, park and fly deal, I guess. This is a very large, very busy hotel, which means you're probably going to have to wait in line at least once during your stay. Honestly, my overall impression of the hotel is a that of a rather depressing place. Getting to our room, we had to negotiate a windowless, dingy, meandering hallway. It sort of reminded me of an underground, military installation of some sort. Once in our room, it also looked sort of dim, gray and tired. Throwing open the curtains revealed a "view" of an interior shaft that was open at the top ... so no view and no natural light to speak of. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable and room was spacious and as clean as old furnishings and carpet can get I suppose. I don't no if it has just been my luck, but every time I've stayed there, we've had to wait 20 or more minutes for the shuttle to the airport. One time we ended up sharing a cab with another exasperated couple who were also in danger of missing their flight. Robert Frost once said, "Home is the place, when you have to go there, they have to take you in." That's kind of how I feel about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid consistent place to stay when using LAX”
Reviews.Author: alhaines17
Reviews.Content: Located minutes from the main terminals at LAX. The hotel has everything you need including a 24hr coffee/snack bar, Restaurant, Bar, Gym, Pool, etc. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel has no issues with accepting letters / parcels on behalf of guests. The rooms are typical US Hilton standard. A good solid option when flying in or out of LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Your room can make a big difference”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelpros
Reviews.Content: This hotel is big - in a LA Airport sort of way. The lobby is nice and the convention areas are ok. That is pretty much the positive I have to say about the place. After checking in I went to my room, 3071, which is unlike any hotel room I have seen - almost as large as half a tennis court with only a bed stuck in one corner and a cheap desk. The televisions are those absolutely huge ones you got rid of 5 years ago for a flat screen - not exactly HD - more say circa 1990. Oh yeah, and the furniture is not of Hilton quality, I think they picked it up at a closed down fairfield inn!! The fan in the room had an incessent ticking noise it made and the view was unbelieveable - when you opened the blinds there was about four feet to the next wall. There was not a chance of any daylight getting through to the windows in this room. I am surprised that they can even call this a room - so truly bizarre and sad. Probably the most depressing and dark hotel room I have ever seen. I ordered room service twice - and both times the wrong food came. If you valet park your car you should arrive well in advance of the time you need it as it took nearly 30 minutes to claim our car from the valet guys out front. All this being said the staff were always polite, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hilton property and very convenient to airport.”
Reviews.Author: Ariktravel
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in this hotel for many years. Always been a solid performer. Very close to the airport. The shuttle service this time was great. I have had some minor issues in the past with long waits. I had a room on the top floor facing the airport. I can hear the airplanes but that never bothers me. The hotel is renovating again, closing a floor at a time. You would not even know it though. We have a nice contracted rate at this hotel making it a steal so the value for the money was right on!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a decent place to stay near the airport....”
Reviews.Author: jbwilkins
Reviews.Content: Overall a good place to stay near the airport….nothing really special, exactly what you expect from a Hilton…..I will say, if you’re checking in around 5-6 in the evening it may take a little while…..Lot’s of business travelers (me included) and most are getting to the hotel around that time…

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: JGDALLAS
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, easy to get to. There were large parties during our weekend stay which wouldnt had been so bad if they weren't staying on the same floor as us. The hallways got a little nosiey from time to time and the planes can be a little loud. Overall the hotel was clean the housekeeping crew was awesome they went the extra mile every day and made sure our room was clean (I really appreciate this kind of detail).

Reviews.Title: “One night stay -”
Reviews.Author: BAB17
Reviews.Content: After a long flight from Munich, the checkin was quick, room easy to find, clean and adequate for a one night's stay Shower felt great -good water pressure. After having free WI-FI all over Europe, it would have been nice to have in at the Hilton too.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: tessah25
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying a night here after missing our flight to Las Vegas. Check In was quick and efficient. Room was ok, a bit soul-less! Very good location for airport and the shuttle picks you up from outside the hotel door. They had also provided coffee out there which was much appreciated in the early hours of the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel very dated, rooms not quiet”
Reviews.Author: GeauxTiguhs
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy shuttle ride to airport, but rooms and hotel overall need a facelift....free wifi would be nice too. Fitness center was more than adequate with free weights, machines, and cardio eqpt. Complaint: I might as well have been on the LAX runway....every plane taking off shook my window so the night was long with intermittent sleep. Would probably stay somewhere else next time for this reason alone.

Reviews.Title: “Day room review - well worth the investment”
Reviews.Author: LP70
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the LAX Hilton on a day rate package, having arrived with my mother at 6am after an all-night flight from Lima, with a long wait until 11.40pm for a flight to Sydney. I had a pleasant (and unplanned) stay at the Hilton LAX a while ago and based on that experience and wanting to give my mother a chance for a decent rest, decided to try their day rate option, $92 (with taxes) for a twin room (double beds) guaranteed available between 9am and 6pm. This turned out to be an act of genius on my part. I have colleagues who recommend other airport hotels but for us, the facilities at the LAX Hilton were fine. What do you want on a layover like this? A reasonably sized and clean room, comfortable beds, hot shower, early check in, and easy to navigate base for a bit of stopover shopping. Most importantly, no hassles. And the Hilton LAX delivered for us on all these elements. Since my last visit there have been some upgrades, the TV in our room was flatscreen with full cable options, and the bathroom amenities seemed better quality. Staff were very helpful and friendly, we were able to check in at 730am which was greatly appreciated, room was large and clean and the shuttle service was again excellent - very professional. The hotel is always well-staffed and the lobby areas are very well appointed. It was great to be able to have a shower and sleep for a couple of hours in comfort, do some shopping then get ourselves organised for the LAX to Sydney flight. We even had time for a cocktail in the bar. For the price it was a sensible investment that kept Mum and me happy after one long flight and before another. Minor downside was the pool closed for renovations but we wouldn't have used it anyway. Our floor (level 3) smelt quite strongly of cigarette smoke but the room did not. There are no in-room safes or mini-bars, and wifi is charged by the day ($12.95) or hour ($5.95). With a couple more upgrades to the rooms the hotel would be improved but overall I was pleased with the rate, service and facilities. I would recommend this option for a day room for anyone in a similar situation, and will be booking this for myself in the future if I have a long break between flights.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: enjoytravelling_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel on arrival into US to help with jetlag and then two nights prior to return trip to Australia. I had contacted the guest relations manager prior to visit as I booked the night before I arrived to access my room early a.m. of arrival. He ensured the details were noted and also made sure the room type I requested was in a quite part of hotel. The first stay I had a one bedroom towers suite. Of course large and comfortable. My only concern I found the sofa material made my skin itch and I put the bedcover over it. No bites, just itchy material. I didn't find the check-in clerks on stay one as friendly and helpful as stay two but would not deter me from staying here again. Hotel is extremely close to airport and the shuttle bus runs very frequently and great way to access airport and hotel. Upon stay two my request for corner executive king was met, great room. At first upon entering room I thought I smelled cigarette smoke but assured by staff this would not be the case. The smell seemed to come from bedlinen and I assume it is the product used for washing. The bathroom was large and more than adequate. Both rooms have not been remodelled but I didn't think they required it but I didn't see a remodelled room either to compare. The rooms more than met my needs. Majority of staff are very helpful and the hotel is very clean. I tried the ex. lounge one morning for breakfast, very crowded and I've seen more food choices in other Hiltons but this would not put me off staying here again. There is a fast food burger place in next block plus dennys two blocks down. The trolley bus to Manhattan Beach is also close enough for some sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Only if the price is right!”
Reviews.Author: kpoconnor
Reviews.Content: staying one night on business trip. I am Diamond HH members. Was upgraded to junior suite but got to room and it had a terrible smell! Was switched to a standard corner room. Rooms are clean with comfortable beds. Public areas are in need of updating. Hallway carpets are nasty! Still have Tube TV sets with no Hidef... Wifi is very week and slow. Did not get any breakfast coupons but did get access to Lounge. Only thing they have there was cookies and Drinks for purchase. Do have central air so AC is quiet. Rooms are updated with modern furniture. Location is close to airport so quick trip to terminal. This would not be my first choice for hotel at airport. The prices but much less then everyone else for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: Greay location for quick access to the airport. The hotel is older although it is kept clean. Public areas are showing some wear and tear - especially carpets. I echo the other posters who say rooms are small and drab. Bathrooms are positively "tiny" and poorly appointed. Televisions are tube-type. Few electrical outlets at the desk. Concierge lounge is very nice and very spacious.Staff is friendly. There are better options nearby at compatible price.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: GT6
Reviews.Content: I just stayed two nights while in the LA area on business. This hotel has a restaurant, a cafe, and a bar. Valet is $30 per night and the slowest valet I have ever encountered. The check in staff was very friendly but the process was quite slow. One of the greatest disappointments was when I arrived to my room. The room itself was extremely small - maybe not even 10X10. The bathroom was more of a closet than a bathroom. You actually have to shut the door in order to get in the shower. The room still has a 1983 tube type television in it. I mean, this is an over $210 per night Hilton, not a budget motel. Water rings all over the desk and bathroom counter. It makes you wonder if it was even wiped down. The walls are very thin as I could hear my neighbor talking as well as the ice machine two doors down and around the corner. By the way, the business center charges to use their computers; however they do offer a kiosk in the lobby you can stand in line in to print your boarding pass. I did eat the breakfast buffet and it was very good with a nice selection. I had dinner one evening in the bar and the food was good there as well. Even with that, I was not impressed at all considering the money spent. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby, dissapointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: Windswept_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby is nice and checkin was nice and efficient, although it was 9:00pm when arriving so queues weren't an issue. The room I booked wasn't avaible for some reason, so was upgraded to a suite. Oh dear, what a dissapointment, the room was increadibly dingy, the wardrobe door was hanging off its runners, the desk looked as if it has been reclaimed but not restored, the air conditioning didn't seem capable of lowering the room temperatiure. The bathroom was of a similar level of quality. However, the bed was comfortable, and as I has to be up at 5:00 am that was all that really mattered. The bar menu seemed reasonable, but the food that arrived was mediocre and service was incredibly slow. 15mins to take an order despite sitting at the bar by the register that was constantly being used by the staff. Breakfast spread was far better although the layout of the area was a liitle odd, with seeting seeming to be allocated in to a room to the side of the main eating area - perhaps they were near capacity and havibg to use an overflow room. Checkout was simple and efficient, but if you need to use the free shuttle to the airport be prepared to wait a while, the queues can get quite long. If you're not up for waiting, then turn left, walk down the ramp and the taxis are lines up atthe sideof the hotel - 5 mins sees you at the airport for a handfull of dollars and not standing around waiting for the shuttle. Hotel is surrounding by several others or differing brands, and I'd probably try one of those the next time I find myself needing an LA airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average aiport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TKEVancouver
Reviews.Content: Your pretty average airport hotel. My buddy got a great deal on hotwire and it served its purpose but it is a massive hotel with really nothing special and only very basics amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: siegfried b
Reviews.Content: A very good way to rest about a long fligth.You can find although good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Our Go-To Crash Pad for Pacific Long-Hauls”
Reviews.Author: DanielAndRachel
Reviews.Content: The LAX Hilton is our home away from home when we're heading out to the West Coast to catch long haul flights over the Pacific. It's located very close to the airport, with great views of the runways, especially on the South and West sides of the hotel. Surprisingly, you hear very little airplane noise due to excellent sound-proofing of the rooms. The free airport shuttle service can be a little spotty--on occasion we've had to wait much longer than the advertised 15 minutes. The rooms are spacious (though slightly dated), and they have big windows and comfortable beds. There are several different food options in the hotel, including a 24-hour cafe that provides to-go food and quick breakfast choices. The Landings bar is a nice place to relax and have a drink and a bite to eat after a long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Some Places get you by the room.”
Reviews.Author: plotkinms
Reviews.Content: What can I say it was a Hilton - $10 to use the internet, $20 to park.

Reviews.Title: “Strange old rooms but being remodeled”
Reviews.Author: jolena28
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel just for one evening to catch an early morning flight out of LAX. It seems to be a very busy hotel (or at least it was while I was there). Staff was friendly and helpful. Ate at the restaurant for dinner - average and way over-priced but that's to be expected from a hotel by the airport. The shuttle was very efficient and convenient. There is a Hertz return/rental in the lobby. Parking for the hotel was confusing (levels go from 4-6 with 4 being the highest level) and Hertz returns are on the 6th level. Driving to the hotel I stopped at a nearby gas station - didn't seem to be a safe part of town. I can't really rate this hotel based on my room because it was pretty obvious I was in an old room that had not been renovated yet. It was huge but just a lot of wasted floor space. Had an old large tube tv, mirrored sliding closet doors, and a really small wood paneled fridge in the corner on the floor. Someone told me it may have been an old junior suite? Strange but not really anything wrong with it. The bathroom and the room were clean and the bed was comfortable - pretty much all you need for a short stay. I would stay again but only after renovations were complete and only in order to catch another early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “old reliable”
Reviews.Author: notnecessary
Reviews.Content: The forte of this hotel is its location very close to the airport and its Hilton brand. Have stayed here a number of times with the same results, will be staying here again. It has decent shuttle service to/from the LAX terminals, it's clean, quiet and comfortable with all the trimmings: restaurants, bar, bell service, etc. It offers very good advance internet rates on the rooms. Expect big hotel type prices in the restaurant. It is obviously a good location for travelers as airline crews and cruise ship passengers stay here. The negatives: few; modest airport noise, busy hotel, pricey amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Howtle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a "destination" but has everything you will want for a business stopover. Many trans-Pacific passengers seem to utilize it for minimizing jet-lag as well. Airport shuttles run every 15 minutes. The lobby is large, lively and inviting. The staff provides an excellent service. Check-in can sometimes be slow due to the high volume of travelers. The rooms are modern, clean and well appointed. The beds are very comfortable. The Wifi is fast and free to Gold and higher Hhonors members. The work out room is adequate though it could be bigger for the size of the hotel. It has free weights, machines and cardio. There are large ballrooms available for business functions

Reviews.Title: “Be careful on Internet usage”
Reviews.Author: nhlivefreeordie
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hilton Los Angeles airport for 3 nights. I was surprised to find firstly internet in room is not free even for Hilton Honors member, secondly if you connect your laptop and iPad then they will charge two times. It is not per room but they charge as per number of device connected to wifi. I was not aware and no one told me during checkin. However, I found when bill came to my room and when I went to reception to check for two times charges, they told me the internet is not free for Hilton Honors member ( Like I always get at each Hilton hotels) plus it is per device of connection. I learned this lesson and advise here to you all be careful and take note of this.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice!”
Reviews.Author: thepieshop66
Reviews.Content: This hotel is smart, tidy and in the process of being renovated. I have stayed here 3 times in the past year and never had any major issues, my only complaint is the lack of security safes in the rooms. Within the hotel is a hertz rental car desk and there is a frequent free shuttle to the airport,

Reviews.Title: “Worked great for us!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth23
Reviews.Content: I booked this on priceline the day of our stay to avoid the LA rush hour the next morning. We got a great deal. Hertz return was on site and the staff was great. My only complaint would be the price of the breakfast--but I wasn't surprised by it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!”
Reviews.Author: NonRIUTraveller
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice hotel near the airport because our flight was leaving early and we wanted to ensure there were not any issues. We travel a lot as a family and always try and stay at a Hilton because the chain has a quality product with not a lot of surprises. This hotel is not the case! It is run down and in need of a major face lift. I have stayed in nicer motel 6 rooms! Extremely disappointing after traveling all day and looking for a higher end hotel. Save your money and source out a super 8 or motel 6 until they update this place!

Reviews.Title: “Huge room with great views”
Reviews.Author: Jamie M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before flying home to Canada. I was with my brothers on our way back from Las Vegas and we were going to book a cheap room but then decided to splurge a little. We booked an executive corner suite and were very impressed with the room. We had an awesome view of the incoming airplanes and the mountains. The room had two bathrooms and lots of space to spread out and relax. We had access to the lounge, which overlooks the runways and had free snacks and breakfast. The living room was very nicely decorated and so was the bedroom, but the baths were a quite dated. The location is great if you're flying out in the morning and need to drop off your rental car. The rental car return depots are literally just behind the hotel, less than a minute away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: tink07_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed hear for two nights before flying home on a midnight flight. The location was handy for us as we had very little planned but to chill out before flying home. The staff were helpful, the rooms old but clean. And the Breakfasts were GREAT! We also had dinner at the restaurant, the service was wonderful and our children were made feel special.

Reviews.Title: “There has to be a better choice...”
Reviews.Author: JobbinsHill
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here as a result of a late landing flight but I wouldnt go back. The beds were uncomfortable, the rooms smelt musty and the service was non-existant. The teabags in our room had gone mouldy - clearly rarely checked by housekeeping. My husband went to buy a cup of tea instead and was scorned upon by the server in the coffee shop. Hardly the standard I expect from the Hilton Brand.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of average, food choices were disappointing & pricey”
Reviews.Author: Kat82
Reviews.Content: I just attended a conference at the LAX Hilton. The meeting spaces were large and adequate. I could see the planes from my hotel room, which had a set of ear plugs & a letter explaining the noise level might be loud. The room was nothing special and the wireless internet kept dropping (on the 8th floor). The service in the Bistro (24-hour restaurant & Starbucks coffee) was slow--they seemed completely unprepared for handling a large conference. The salad bar in the Cafe restaurant (sit down restaurant) was $15 for a very basic selection of items. The shuttle to and from the airport was fast and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Good Hotel. Needs new carpeting.”
Reviews.Author: yakadi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the evening of October 2, 2011. We would stay here again. When you first walk-in the hotel it is very impressive - marble floors, beautiful lobby, a huge restaurant on the main floor to the right and a deli serving a limited Starbucks menu to the left. A nice gift shop. Looks beautiful and clean and huge. Excellent service from everyone we encountered. Our room wasn't ready (it was 11:00 am) but they were VERY nice and the concierge took ALL of our bags, no problem (7 bags for 2 people). They had non-smoking rooms available but my husband smokes so we waited less than an hour for our room. The third floor has smoking rooms - and they have sliding glass doors which open-up to a big, outdoor smoking patio. VERY nice. Never seen anything like that before. It was great. You could sit out there and hear the planes taking off. When we checked we took the elevator to our floor and I immediately knew what all the bad reviews are about... the ONLY thing... and the ONE thing... that is MAJORLY wrong with this hotel.... THE CARPETS IN THE HALLWAYS ARE DISGUSTING!!! STAINED AND DIRTY AND DISSSGUUUSTTTING!!!! IT IS SOOO GROSS!! I was freaking out walking to our room... and then we got to the room... and it was GREAT! I was so relieved! The carpet in the room was clean, the room was clean, the room was great, the bathroom was great. It was all very nice inside. Even the bathroom was upgraded like the newer Hiltons!! We went up to the 9th floor to see my in-laws room and it was the same situation... gross hallway carpets and then a clean, nice room. Strange. So, basically... we had a fantastic stay and would stay here again... but close your eyes when walking down the carpeted hallways!! We are Hilton Honors members and have stayed in a few Hiltons the last couple of years and I can't imagine why there isn't money to replace the hallway carpets?? By the way, the hotel is in a good location - Carl's Jr. next door and Denny's one block down (easy walk on the sidewalk). We ordered Pizza and it arrived quickly and was a good deal. The guest services guy was very funny and nice when I called him to ask for pizza recommendations. Also, we had breakfast the next morning in the hotel restaurant - which was very clean and busy. It was expensive (like $17 for an omelet plate) but the buffet was loaded and only $20. The service was EXCELLENT - the waitress made me some fresh iced tea and continually kept my glass refilled. The food was good. The place was clean and busy. We would eat here again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hilton ...small bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Joanne L
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through hotwire as we had an early morning flight back to NYC. Check in and out were fast and efficient. The room itself was very clean although a bit small (pretty typical though by New York standards). One thing to note is that the bathroom was quite small. If you opened the door, it just about touched the toliet and completely cut off the bathtub. There wasn't much room between the toliet and sink either, making it a bit claustaphobic to get out. Other than that, the shuttle driver to the airport was great. Just note that there's no fixed schedule for it. It arrives about every 20 mins but when I called down to get an approximation of when it would be there ( e.g. It arrives on the hour, 20 after and 40 after) I was told "there's no fixed time, it just comes when it comes", which isn't really the best info the concierge could have given. FYI: it takes between 15 to 25 mins to get there depending on which terminal you are heading to. This Hilton was fairly standard, a bit older on the exterior with relatively modern rooms. Be warned though, there is nothing around it within walking distance other than a gas station convenience store so you will either need to order room service or drive out to eat somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms are better than others”
Reviews.Author: traveller_yyz
Reviews.Content: Checked in around 9:30pm and was out early the next morning for a flight from LAX. Check in was very busy as they were just processing the passengers of a cancelled flight who were given vouchers to stay overnight at the hotel, but I was through in less than 10 minutes. I was given a room on the 13the floor which was labelled as an Executive Floor. The hotel is shaped like a cross and my room was one of the ones in the intersection of two arms so I only had one small window which looked into an alcove shared with the window from the adjacent room. I don't there there would have been much natural light, but I was out early the next morning, it didn't bother me. Room was large and comfortably furnished although the dressers, bed side tables etc looked older. Older tube type tv but it was a decent size. Bed and linens were very comfortable. Bathroom was small but renovated. I could hear planes taking off regularly. Used self parking at $22/night- spaces are tight and its a long way down (I was on P5, but I think there were a few levels below that.) I tried to print out my boarding pass at the machine in the lobby, but it really wasn't worth the effort now that most airlines have switched to self checkin at LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and not going ever going back”
Reviews.Author: Gary_n_Kimberly
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations. From the street, the place looks grand and magnificent. That came to a screeching halt because an employee of the hotel told us that my wife's Nissan Exterra was too tall to fit in the parking garage and that I would HAVE to valet for $33 per night. The vehicle's highest point is 6'0" off the ground. I'm 6'3". Are you telling me that I would have to crouch down to walk in the parking garage? That the ceiling in the structure is less than 6 feet high? I call bulls%&t. The representative at check-in was exceptional, very engaging and seemed genuinely happy to be working. I've read below that people have labeled this place modern. I have stayed at many a $69-$120 hotels that at least have a modern flat screen TV. Our room on the 9th floor was equipped with an old-school cathode ray tube 27" TV with a curved screen. The bathroom was so tiny, that if you are sitting on the toilet, the door cannot be opened. The temperature control consists of this ancient rotary knob labeled 40, 60, 80, 100. The fan control is a completely separate type of toggle switch. This place is stuck in 1981. This hardly seems like a good representation of the Hilton brand minutes away from the airport in the 2nd largest city in the US. The final nail in the coffin was coffee on the way out while we were waiting on the valet. The coffee shop touts that they sell Starbucks. We got two iced coffees to go. They tasted days old and completely watered down. Neither one of us could drink them, and we're not coffee snobs. Starbucks needs to be aware that the LAX Hilton is selling swill with their name on it. You're better off at the Embassy Suites or Marriott in this area.

Reviews.Title: “An off day ..?”
Reviews.Author: TitanicSnowdonia
Reviews.Content: We queued for an hour at check in. Unfortunately it seemed some computer glitch had had caused mayhem with the booking system. OK fine, problems happen, however its what you do to mitigate the inconvenience that distinguishes you from the competition! Perhaps they could have sent someone out with a tray of drinks and an explanation for the delay? Perhaps they could have provided a voucher for dinner? Anyway, the hotel was clean, modern, convenient and perfect as a transit stopover. Perhaps thats why customer service was so poor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helena V
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 times at the Hilton. The first time we had a spacious and clean room with a sliding door. The sliding door gave access to the pool which was very nice. The staff is friendly and will help you with anything. The second time we stayed in a room on a higher level. The room was again very spacious and clean. The hotel has no free-wifi. The hotel has an underground paying parking. I think it was about 20$ for a day. You get an access card to the parking so you can leave the parking whenever you want and ride back in it when you want. The only disadvantage I noticed the both times was that you have to be patient to check-in. Both times there was a huge queue. Maybe it was just bad timing but the staff was really doing his best to make it go as quick as possible.

Reviews.Title: “COULD BE VERY GOOD : NEEDS SOME REVAMPING THOUGH”
Reviews.Author: HOTELLMEMORE
Reviews.Content: I did not have to wait more than 5 minutes for the HILTON LAX dedicated shuttle to pick me up from curbside. Although I took care of and carried my small luggage it looked like that the driver was expecting a tip. Check-in was courteous, efficient and quick in line with what I was expecting. Hotel lobby is huge and beautiful though the front desk is not easy to locate from the main entrance door. However, this bright and luxury decor suddenly vanishes once you enter the one of the elevators. From now on the decoration is dark pastel grayish somewhat outdated in hallways and guest rooms. Obviously no remodeling and no revamping have been done for years in most part of this hotel. My room was large, clean and well maintained with every item serviceable. The old non flat TV set was in line with this ageing hotel. Moreover and surprisingly there was no minibar to cool down your stuff. I booked this hotel because I had a 12 hours night stop-over on my way to Maui, HI, just wanting to relax between 2 long-haul intercontinental flights. However, due to very poor window’s sound insulation I could hear each and every large aircraft taking-off from the only half mile away runways thus not allowing a good night sleep which is at least what I expect from an airport hotel. I was also surprised that everyone meaning even non hotel guests can easily take elevators to guestrooms due to the lack of room card readers to control access. This did not make me feel comfortable especially in this area of town known for its high crime rate though I honestly did not have to report any particular issues.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: OskarandSunny
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very good , both modern and clean rooms, we had a small problem, the water in the hotel was not working and the hotel had direct guests to various other rooms for facilities. This was fixed during the night. It is a busy hotel and check in could be an issue but all in all we were more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: DavidColumbusOhio
Reviews.Content: I spent four days at the Hilton and felt relieved that it wasn't as bad as I thought it would be. I walk into the cavernous caramel lobby with restaurants and quite a few lounge chairs. I checked in 10:30 AM by a very professional pleasant lady. The room decor and TV was a little dated. The room was very clean. It was very quet when I was there,. (Sat-Tue) No noises in the halls at night. Parking is $22 a day. Although I rented a car, I road the bus to Malibu and The Santa Monica Pier. A lot of streets were blocked for a few days. (President in town and a marathon, )The Bus stop is across the street. The pool was small (regular hotel size) but the whirlpool was nice after a day of walking. Food is very expensive, so I got a quick bite at Carl's Jr, a block up the street, before I left the area. Housekeeping was a little lax. Coffee was never replenished and cleaning bottles were left in the room one day. Overall I had a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: jgmiami
Reviews.Content: I go to LA every year for the Grammys and I've stayed twice at this property and both times had horrible experiences. It seems like Grammy week is also the week where ex employees block the driveway and protest their wages and benefits. The hotel staff seems disinterested in helping move them. Also, both times multiple elevators didn't work and it caused a long wait. Not worth giving another chance...

Reviews.Title: “All the Good and Bad of a hotel in the 80s”
Reviews.Author: MarioYeong
Reviews.Content: A big hotel near the airport with a regular shuttle bus. Check in was fast and efficient. Everyone is friendly and smiling. Great coffee maker and toiletries and everything was clean. But they forgot to remove a used ear bud left conspiciously on the table. Nice lounge and room overlooking the airport.The decor is old and the bathing shower switch was anti-logic. The ceiling is low and the big CRT TV hung around like a decor, much to my amusement. The lift cranks crazily up and down but I understand that an upgrading is underway. Some aircraft sounds still permeates into the hotel but is ok for me. The club lounge is so so and no free internet despite booking a Towers (club) room. They wanted $12.99 a day for that. Overall an ok hotel for its price but don't expect a sleek wait-on-you-hand-and-foot Asian style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here”
Reviews.Author: WestwoodTrekker
Reviews.Content: I like this place. It is great for a weekend in LA. If you rent a car, then it doesn't matter that it's near the airport. It's only 15 minutes from Santa Monica and 25 minutes from Hollywood. The airport area is less expensive than downtown but you still get great service and good rooms. Hilton has a nice product and while this is not a "resort" type property, it is a good business hotel with plenty of amenities for a quick vacation stay, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great for an overnight stay in LA, nothing longer”
Reviews.Author: TeejMcTeej
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the morning at LAX after a 14+ hour flight from Australia, intending to rent a car from LAX and drive to San Francisco. We thought it would be worth while spending the night in LAX to get over some jet-lag and acclimatize, especially with 2 small kids. After reading some reviews on tripadviser and deciding on this hotel, we managed to get a very good deal using credit card points (for an overnight stay at the LAX Hilton) Although we arrived at the hotel at 08:30, the man at the Hotel Check-in was kind enough to let us check in very early (09:15), which was several hours before the standard check-in time (3pm?). To our delight we were upgraded to the "concierge level" whereby we were entitled to use the free buffet business/meal area. While we were waiting for our room, we had a lovely complementary breakfast with the kids in the concierge lounge. Once finished, we called reception, and found that our room was ready on the top floor. We had a fantastic room on the top corner level overlooking the run-way at LAX. We had a mid-day nap, in exceptionally comfortable beds (2 x queen beds). Surprisingly, there was very little noise from the overhead aircraft, and we had a great rest. Later we had a swim in the central pool which was clean and maintained well, but very dull and quite dated (this didn't bother the kids who were happy with any swimming pool). I don't recall any staff or facilities (bar/grill) in the pool area. Later we went back to the concierge lounge for drinks, and a light snack, and put the kids to sleep. I went to grab a coffee from Starbucks in the main lobby (worst coffee I have ever had, and a total rip off for $4.50). My wife and I had a terrible room service meal which was totally overpriced, and very disappointing (steak sandwich with fries). Unfortunately most hotel food is very poor, so we half expected it, and didn't bother complaining, and go through the whole ordeal of talking to the manager, only to wait another hour for a simple sandwich and fries. Overall the room we had on the concierge level was great, and the beds very comfortable. We didn't have much interaction with the staff other than at check-in. The public areas of the hotel look a bit tired and dated, although I saw some signs in the lobby advising on a long awaited and well needed "face lift". Hilton is very much hit/miss in the USA with very inconsistent standards in the USA, so i was interested to see how this compared to other Hiltons I had booked for our vacation. I would stay at this hotel again, if I could get the same/similar room on the concierge levels, overlooking the awesome LAX run-way, for a decent price or deal. I would definitely not stay more than one night at this hotel, as there is nothing much to do in the area, but it is good for a break in a long flight. They do need to improve the standards of the room service meals, and the food prices are ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “It seems to be slipping”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and it has been fine, but this stay is slightly more revealing. The place seems to be more worn out, grimy in spots, noisy and not as good in many respects. On the Honors floor the carpet is filthy, the walls are spotty and I find the room musty and sterile. The airplane noise is very pronounced and seems worse than on other stays. The Cafe Restaurant has a buffet that has all the basics, although by Asian standards it is sparse. Very international guests. Parking deep under building with all the good spots reserved for the valets. This used to be a very clean and smartly-turned out place, but now seems over-used and under-maintained. I have not tried the Honors lounge. Possibly that is better.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you need to stay here”
Reviews.Author: LovedToronto
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times over the years. Always on business or honestly I wouldn't stay here. Not that anything is necessarily wrong with the place, it's just okay. And I HATE that they gouge you with food prices. I've stayed in many expensive hotels, but nowhere else have I experienced such high food prices. If you're staying here for a seminar, you're pretty trapped, because there's not much else nearby. And if you're a female traveling solo, you probably don't want to wander around this part of town alone. That being said, do they really need to charge around $30 for one egg, an order of toast and a cup of coffee? Can we not get a chicken or tuna sandwich in the bistro? Do we really have to go to the restaurant? On a positive note, I will say that on this last trip this August, they have really upped the friendly factor in customer service. Check-in, concierge, food service personnel...everyone was MUCH more friendly than the have been in the past. Room was fine. Mine already had a fridge in it and I didn't ask for it. It froze my $4.50 bottle of Perrier that I bought downstairs, though. Bed was comfy. Housekeeping fine (I believe in always tipping). Elevators are fairly fast. It's an okay hotel if you have to stay here, but not one you necessarily WANT to stay in. Does that make sense?

Reviews.Title: “Of the airport choices this one is darn good”
Reviews.Author: EpicureanFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have many good memories staying at the LAX Hilton over the years. Of the airport hotels in the area I find this property to be as good as or better than the others. The Sheraton nearby wasn’t nearly as nice a few months ago. The Radisson (the old Hyatt for those of us in our 40s) looks terrible from the outside, but has been redone inside. The Westin , while nice on my last visit, has received mixed reviews and it is the newest one on the strip of the major hotel brands. The Marriott, as old as the other properties was nice when I had an unexpected missed flight several months ago. All in all, I’m happy at the Hilton. The executive lounge on the 16th floor is open for breakfast and then again in the evening. I'm not sure why they close and do not allow access to the lounge during the day, but I found this to be a downside. It can be nice to go to the lounge during the day for a beverage and regroup before moving on to other activities. The lounge does have a nice view of the airport and it can be fun watching the airplanes land and take off from the venue. When we made our reservation we opted to upgrade to a larger suite upon check in. We ended up having one of the suites with two adjoining rooms. Since we were traveling with our children the extra space always comes in handy. The large dining room or boardroom table in the middle suite area worked out well for a morning breakfast. The hotel is older and that means small bathrooms. I don't know that the property can overcome the small bathrooms by remodeling. For now, and probably the future, the hotel will have to suffer with the bathroom that is barely large enough for one person. The furniture feels dated, but the room was clean and acceptable. The bed was comfortable. While I seldom use a TV when staying at a hotel, I was surprised that the TV was so dated. The hotel works great when you are getting into LA late at night and you are on a different time zone and need a place to sleep. It also works great if you are visiting LA and want a hotel that is convenient to places both north and south. Yes, traffic can get bad in LA, but I have often found this hotel a good place to base when visiting the city. I used the Parking Spot garage next door and the parking was only about $18. I didn't park at the Hilton because I had a large SUV and it wouldn't fit into the garage area. What was nice was that while I was taking the SUV into the self-serve parking garage the gate shut and I was given plenty of warning signs that my car wouldn't fit. Very nice set up.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for one night”
Reviews.Author: Duhhbeach
Reviews.Content: Overall the room is fine for one night, the beds are comfortable and they have down pillows..bathroom is small. They offer a free shuttle to LAX and for what I paid on Priceline...$75 ..which has gone up from a low of about $50...It's a good deal other than the parking fee which I feel they really gouge you on..

Reviews.Title: “Its not the best but worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Deepthi M
Reviews.Content: I was looking to stay around close to the airport and did not want to spend > 150/day...This was one of the few options I had... The staff is very professional and polite...The restaurants in the hotel are good.. Ambiance is just about ok, especially the rooms look quite old.... They have a free shuttle to airport running round the clock..... Overall my stay was pleasant and I did not have any problems.. Would probably stay again.....

Reviews.Title: “wont stay again unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wholelottaworld
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed for a day stay enroute from maui to the uk as had 13 hour layover. Staff on front desk could not find our booking and i had to present paper work as proof. We were given keys to a room which was already occupied by sleeping guests and had to return to front desk. No apology given but just handed another room key. The customer services manager contacted my wife on T.A after she posted the same complaint as this to say that he would investigate and try to make it up to us. We have had no reply even after giving our home email address. If you want classy surroundings with poor service and broken promises stay here or do yourself a favour and book the Marriott next door, cheaper prices, similar rooms but staff who are caring and most attentive to their customers needs.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location!”
Reviews.Author: lovela65
Reviews.Content: It was really important that I be close to a lot of area attractions. From the Grove/Farmers Mkt to the hotel ran me about $45 1 way since I was dropped off via private transportion...not bad for LA cab fare.Getting to Manhattan Beach was easy since they have a trolley that costs $5 roundtrip that takes you to some area attractions and runs every 30mins. The airport shuttle took me to the rent a car place which was a throw stone away and from there to the Walk of Fame only about 30 mins (if that much)...GPS took me through surface streets and there was no traffic. The hotel buffet breakfast was pretty good but if you're into fast food the cheap option is the Carl's Jr. less than a block away. The room was decent enough (it's LA so I was hardly in there:) and staff was very nice and helpful! The only con is that there were 6 elevators on my side of the bldg but they ran very slow...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for LAX”
Reviews.Author: Staceaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in September 2011 due to a long flight layover. The free airport shuttle seamlessly picked us up and dropped us off at our terminal. Even though we arrived at 11pm on a Sunday night, the hotel was hopping. We were able to get a drink at the bar (although it closed at 12:30pm), and there was a 24 hour counter where you could get a muffin or a sandwich. Breakfast was nice but a bit pricey. The rooms were nice and basic. Although, we could hear someone coughing through the wall, but we were able to get one set of earplugs from the front desk. There was no free WIFI, but you could print out your boarding passes at a kiosk near the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “convenient for an early flight in the morning”
Reviews.Author: Pierre55
Reviews.Content: Very good shuttle service to and from the airport ,fast check in and out ,very comfortable rooms and pleasant staff at front desk

Reviews.Title: “Love it.”
Reviews.Author: edu_cavalcanti
Reviews.Content: Pretty standard Hilton hotel. Comfortable and with a great service. Very good breakfast. Great value as far as the daily rates go. About 05 minutes from LAX. Hotel transportation runs every 10-15 minutes and it is reliable. It sits right besides the Marriott Lax. Stayed recently in both of them and I can say that Hilton Lax is by far a better choice (not as worn down as the Marriott). Only downside is the parking: expensive! Also, I could not park the Chevy Suburban I rented due to height restrictions (I`ve parked this car everywhere, except there, which was pretty annoying). I ended up paying 33 dollars for the valet parking. Recommended if you need to stay close to LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Author: Itha
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors and stay at most Hilton Hotels on every visits in the USA. The room is very nice. I've been staying in this hotel since 2000. Worth staying for transit or just a visit in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great and easy with kids”
Reviews.Author: amueller333
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our 1 year old, service was fast and it was awesome to have the pool and 4 hot tubs to play in. The restaurants were very accomodating to us and let our son eat off our plate at the buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Past its best, but close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: james f
Reviews.Content: We flew into LAX after a long day travelling from Scotland and were relieved that this hotel was only 5 mins transfer. Staff all friendly and helpful, but slightly annoying that the pool wasn't opened up at the time it was meant to be. Didn't open up til an hour later which meant no swim, bah!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent time at hotel”
Reviews.Author: Prashanthreddy
Reviews.Content: We stayed fire couple of days. Room service was good. People who worked there were polite. We could really enjoy the stay because of the patio. We had a really good time

Reviews.Title: “Check in was horrendous”
Reviews.Author: AA1974
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Hilton LAX after a 12 hour flight from New Zealand with 2 small children, queued at check in for 20 mins only to be told that their computers were down and they were unable to check anyone in. Why did they not have a staff member walking the queue and telling people this? I asked if we were able to use the pool area while we waited and was told this was fine and was given directions to the pool and changing rooms only to find that we needed a key card to access both of these areas which of course we didn't have. Went back to check in where they were very unhelpful and condescending. About an hour and a half after we arrived they finally decided to start doing a manual check in, luckily I was just by the check in desk when they reopened so was only 4th in the queue other people however queued for over 90 mins. After I had finally checked in I got to my room only to find the key card wouldn't open the door. Luckily I had a bell boy bringing up our luggage and he opened up the room for me. After this awful start to our stay I was impressed with the rooms and the restaurants. Rooms were a decent size. The restaurant and bistro had nice food at reasonable prices with good kids meals and the staff in them were friendly and accommodating. What could have been a great stopover was ruined by the awful check in process - with 2 kids who just wanted to get to a room and I was dragging them up and down the elevators trying to get checked in or at least into the pool area. Why didn't they move to manual check in as soon as the computers went down as this would have stopped the huge backlog they ended up with?

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: adrianmiami
Reviews.Content: one of the nicest hotels i have been to this year. comfortable beds, helpful staff and very clean.very crowdeed and very noisy people in the lobby.looked like a walmart:) rooms were spacious and nice.(no lcd tv though!!!. great value at 90 us .nice clean and safe place.bathrooms a bit old but ok. la is an expensive city so this hotel is a steal :) to be repeated. shuttle to the airport was free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Convenient Airport Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: AKK2050
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on Aug 31st after a long flight from Asia. The complimentary shuttle service was excellent and very convenient. I traveled with two heavy bags but the driver was extremely courteous and helped me with my bags. Upon arrival, the bellmen was also very helpful and courteous. Check-in was fast and efficient through HH counter and luggage arrived very fast in the room. Had dinner at the bar lounge and food and beverage was fantastic and reasonably priced. The service staff was friendly and helpful. In the night a little noisy being at LAX airport hotel but that is not the case at Hilton Atlanta Airport where you can't hear the sound from planes and can sleep undisturbed. Next morning had breakfast and requested for two fried eggs which Jose took care with very efficiently. Check-out was fast and efficient and luggage assistance was offered and provided. Overall fantastic hotel and very helpful and courteous staff. I will come back when I get next opportunity. Thank you Hilton

Reviews.Title: “Good Transit Stop”
Reviews.Author: Paddles1964
Reviews.Content: We used the Hilton as a transit stop between Las Vegas and our early morning flight to New York. The Hotel was OK, but nothing to write home about and I think that you would be disappointed if you were basing yourself there for a holiday of LA. The rooms were small and ended up putting earplugs in ear to order to sleep as planes were landing either side of the building. We had a buffet dinner down stairs which can only be rated as average to poor at the best. I am sure that the Hotel has a valued use as a transit stop for travellers or for business conventions but for holiday makers there are plenty of better locations available in L.A. Likes - Location for transit between flights - Small but comfortable rooms - Small Kitchenettes - Wifi to rooms - Shuttle service Dislikes - Quality of buffet meal - Noise of aircraft

Reviews.Title: “Room quality may vary”
Reviews.Author: rodjune
Reviews.Content: I was on an overnight stay on business and chose this hotel due to my late flight arrival into LAX. I rented a car and parked it in their garage; it's not cheap - something around $20. Luckily, my employer was paying the expenses on this trip. The hotel is large, maybe too large, which means as an airport property, a lot of people are arriving an leaving at all hours. Check in was smooth. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, I got a room near the top floors facing south towards the south runways of LAX. I found very little noise creeping into the room. Overall, the room was 3.5 stars, definitely not a 4 star, due to its very basic room, amenties, decor, and bathroom. The desk area was not the best lit for work but not so dark that I couldn't see my paperwork. The bed was comfortable, with good lighting on the nightstand. The carpets were clean and the furniture not all beat up like what one often sees at airport properties. The bathroom, which can often make or break my star rating with a hotel after the bed and the room cleanliness, was quite basic, nothing to brag about or a place where you want to leisurly take care of your bathroom and vanity responsibilities, but was efficient nonethless. Due to my status with Hilton, the room had upscale bathroom products (Peter Thomas Roth), which are very nice and I'd say a step above the standard C&E products at most Hilton properties. The following morning around 7:30 am I went down to the lobby area to partake of the complimentary breakfast buffet that was included in my rate presumably due to my status. It seemed to be chaos with no one at the front podium to handle the greeting, and a lot of people surrounding the buffet tables piling on the food like most buffet lines. I immediately left, went up to the Executive Club, and partook of the Continental breakfast offering up there with a nice view of the airport runways to boot. It was the best decision I made that day. Another drawback: The elevators in this hotel are clearly inadequate in capacity and number, which can lead to long waits for an elevator car, especially during the peak morning hour when everyone seems to be heading to the restaurant. I waited close to 5 minutes for an elevator on my way down to the restaurant. Several hotel staff were waiting for an elevator car to transport their service carts to another floor and when I left the downstairs restaurant and went up to the Executive Club, those hotel staff were still waiting to get themselves on an elevator (not sure why they weren't using a service elevator, if they are available). Check out was quick and painless. It's a good airport hotel but not much else. Best part was the Executive Club where it was quiet and peaceful with a satisfactory Continental breakfast spread. Worst part was the long elevator wait. Would I stay here again? Yes, if I did not have a car with me (and have to pay parking) and surely for not more than 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, property needs a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: HoosierCFI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights, and property was very nice and very busy. Was originally given a king size bed room, even though I requested a 2 queen room.
