This did mean a march back to the front desk with small child and luggage @ 10PM, which I wasn't too happy about, but this was quickly remedied and I received an upgrade to their newer rooms. Newer room decor was nice. A couple of small problems, first the TV or remote did not work. Remote was replaced with the actual remote for the TV (not the normal hotel remote). Only problem with this is that you could not access pay services. Also, no do not disturb sign was provided (called housekeeping) and the bathroom door does not fully close or lock. None of these were huge deals, but quality assurance seems to be overlooked. The big positive here was customer service. ALL of the staff was extremely friendly and willing to help. The air conditioning in the hotel worked as expected, which seems to be an issue at a lot of properties. Hallway noise is always an issue @ airport hotels, but our room seemed to be well insulated. There were plenty of dining options (not just the cafe/bar that most hotels offer). Parking was the standard $20/night for LAX, but the parking garage seemed to have a ton of spots. I would stay at this property again, hoping that my past stay issues were just a fluke.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to LAX, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jetset83
Reviews.Content: Before early-morning flights out of LAX, I've stayed in several LAX airport hotels like the Courtyard, Crowne Plaza, the Courtyard at Marina Del Rey, and the Renaissance (on many occasions), but I now prefer this Hilton. It's close to everything, so I usually grab dinner somewhere in MDR, Santa Monica, or Malibu and drop the rental car off and get a free ride from Hertz to this hotel for the night. I’ve found $99 rooms here many times, which is great, considering it’s a full-service Hilton property and the aforementioned hotels go for between $120-150. I guess Hilton is very proactive about keeping the rooms full every night, because it seems very crowded whenever I check in here. Rooms are all nice, clean, and up to Hilton standards, though the bathrooms are usually a bit old-fashioned (always clean though). There is a fitness center on site, a full service restaurant and bar area, as well as an executive lounge for HHonors elites. Both are nice but not exceptionally good. Overall, I will choose this property as my go-to LAX Airport hotel due to its location – you’re at the terminal in 2-3 minutes’ time, thanks to the free shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “Room was comfy but too noisy if you're looking to get a good sleep...”
Reviews.Author: djpositivek
Reviews.Content: Pros: got a good deal using Priceline, close to airport, comfy bed/pillows Cons: Way too noisy, could hear planes flying overhead and was very loud. Also our room was close to ice maker which was noisy and we could hear people talking in the hallway. Poor sound insulation. No complimentary Wi-Fi in the lobby. Breakfast very expensive ($25+ for american breakfast after gratuity, service charges, etc...) Bathroom was also very small. Parking is overpriced at $22 (including tax). Seems they charge around $12 for others (airport parking), how can they justify charging guests more? Also check-in line was slow, they could have used more staff. The check in clerk was friendly. Unfortunate about the noise as we could overlook other things. Getting a good nights sleep is important when you have an early flight the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stop-over at the Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: KateW84
Reviews.Content: We found the service, efficient and friendly from the moment we arrived to the time we departed. There was a free shuttle to and from the airport and we enjoyed a room service breakfast which arrived quickly and was fresh and enjoyable. The rooms are not super modern i.e the bathrooms, (mostly the shower) was a little worn but everything was spotlessly clean and we felt very comfortable for our overnight stay. Our room had a view of the planes arriving into LAX and when it became dark it was fun to watch all the lights lining up in the distance to land. There was a little noise in the corridor but because this was an airport hotel with people coming and going it was understandable. The location is fantastic, just a shuttle bus away from LAX and a short taxi ride to a couple of really decent shopping malls which we visited for dinner. We liked the rooms and the proximity to the airport and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: lacalif11
Reviews.Content: Got a decent deal on Priceline. THEN, i saw the rating on TripAdvisor and thought "rut roh". They rate themselves as a 4* hotel. I would give it 3 1/2 tops. This was a decent hotel. Very close to LAX. There is a Hertz car rental within the hotel. Overall it was clean. However, the checkout was terribly long process. The parking is pretty expensive and the stalls are extremely tight. Did not come with complimentary breakfast. Next time I'm in L.A., I will opt for a hotel with free parking and/or breakfast. Pros: Close to airport, clean, decent pool area, nice gym Cons: Checkout process not efficient, parking is tight

Reviews.Title: “Filthy stench of stale smoke in room 3029”
Reviews.Author: risteard
Reviews.Content: My reviews are typically less scathing but the overwhelming stench of stale cigarette smoke at the Hilton at LAX cannot be overlooked. I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what it was”
Reviews.Author: PMTK_11
Reviews.Content: This was late night stopover between flights. It was fine. Clean and comfortable. Great view of runway. Managed to get a great late night meal in the bar. Staff were REALLY great - friendly and welcoming - particularly the guy on the front desk whose wife comes from Leeds and made us feel very welcome. Very noisy hotel due to people coming and going at strange hours as it's an airport hotel. Free shuttle bus to and from airport. Excellent. Public areas very grand. Rooms nicely done, but noisy fridge!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: tiberius_nero
Reviews.Content: Free, friendly and efficient shuttle. Very expensive room with overpriced food. The room was clean (nothing special). Great pool & gym. Will probably stay here again due to its convenient location Tip : Join the HHonors club - it costs nothing and you get your own dedicated check-in desk. It saves a lot of time at busy airport hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for an overnight stay!”
Reviews.Author: Seedling17
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel given the location is nearby the airport and we were arriving very late (or early depending how you look at it - 1am). I have stayed at many hotels in the Hilton family and this was perfectly adequate for an overnighter. The only niggle I had was around the courtesy bus. I called the Hotel from the airport to ask where to pick it up and how long it would take. Despite them knowing we were waiting, I was told it would be a half hour wait! We ended up taking a 3 minute taxi ride instead. Where is the customer service here? I had requested an upgraded room if there was one available and at check in asked if this was this case, I was told No, however we were in a suite. I dont know about you, but I do not call a standard hotel room with 2 beds and a bathroom, a suite. Nevertheless, I would still stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby old rooms but a great deal”
Reviews.Author: MiguelOtero
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night when we were going to Anaheim. Rooms are old and not very clean, no specific complains but some renovation could help. Very nice lobby, great breakfast. Great value if staying for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Better than average airport hotel but still an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: B2C2V
Reviews.Content: At times, when I transferred in LAX, I stayed at this hotel. Our company has a very competitive price at this hotel. so value wise, positive for me. Room itself is clean but you can tell it is tired and at areas you can sense a make over of old / cheaper materials. You can smell smoking occasionally in some rooms / floors that are supposed to non smoking rooms. I do not like that but can understand it will be difficult to catch offenders in this kind of high turnaround hotels. A lounge at 18th(?) floor is available for premier HHonor members. Not a whole lot of selections in its continental buffet, weak compared to several other Hilton properties I have stayed. I would give it 3.5 star. Better than average airport hotel but still an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff that came through”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through one of those opaque sites who over-hyped it. The hotel itself isn't too bad; the lobby is actually quite nice with a nice sitting area. But I told the management about the over-hype, and they went out of their way to accomodate me. The whole staff was rather nice. The downsides are paying for parking, which is par for the course in LAX. I should have dropped off my rental car earlier and just taken the shuttle. That would apply to any LAX hotel, though. Overall, the experience here was a pretty good one once I got to deal with the hotel staff. It taught my to stop using those opaque sites once and for all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to LAX airport”
Reviews.Author: Francis B
Reviews.Content: Very confortable and well located. Very good quality continental breakfast. Free shuttle to the airport. No frre wi-fi. All the hotels should offer free wi-fi at least in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience. Very clean and elegent room.”
Reviews.Author: Lexi_loo07
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Comfortable bed and very clean. No noise from airport considering I was only across the street from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Perscrutator
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay online and got a pretty good deal for the standard king size bed that also included breakfast. The Hotel has a shuttle that provides a free service between LAX and the front entrance that was really convenient. Upon our arrival, we were fortunate enough to be helped almost immediately. I mention this since this hotel can get crazy busy and then there are long queues for the staff to deal with. Can be quite time consuming if you have locked yourself out of your room :) The hotel has pretty much everything you might need such as a pool, gym and three restaurants depending what you are in the mood for. My only small annoyance about the gym was that the treadmills squeaked a lot while you run. After 5 miles I was really missing my IPod! Other than that, everything was clean and I enjoyed my workout. The hotel's food was really good, I especially enjoyed their Italiano Pizza, really a different bit of a twist to an old favourite. Breakfast was in the form of a buffet and everything was well prepared and tasty. There are no fridges in the rooms so be sure to not take too much take aways! My only real complaint about this hotel is the noise. I cannot fathom why the hallway noise permeates into the rooms so much. If someone opens their door across the hall, it sounds like your door opening. I did a little test and I could hear my wife approaching on her flip flops while lying on the bed almost as soon as she steps out of the elevator. The only reason this is such a big deal is because, as I mentioned the hotel is quite busy. You have people leaving and arriving at all hours of the day and night making it nearly impossible to have a decent nights sleep. Its too bad since the beds are excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachub
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night, lovely airport hotel, Denny's just down the road if you don't want to pay hotel prices for food. Were very helpful when making enquiries about car hire locations. Convenient location after 12 hr flight from the uk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional, with everything you need ... but not a resort.”
Reviews.Author: panoramarick
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed at The Hilton Los Angeles Airport several time. It is a very convenient Park And Fly hotel (I booked through Park Sleep Fly). It is located on Century Boulevard, a short distance from the Los Angeles International Airport. You would certainly not consider this a resort destination, but for the business traveler it is a solid choice. Every time I’ve stayed here it seems to be really busy, but the staff is personable and I’ve never had to wait long to check in. They have a responsive valet staff to meet you and get you in and out of your automobile. There is also a dependable shuttle service to the airport that runs 24 hours a day. One time we stayed here and took the shuttle service to Manhattan Beach and really enjoyed walking around and dining in that cute beach community. This is an option I recommend if you have time and want to get to the beach. The Hilton Los Angeles Airport has 55,000 square feet of meeting, banquet and event space. Being located in a dense area of Los Angeles, it is used a lot for business and personal events and meetings. Weddings, cincineras, anniversaries, as well as business meetings and large conference events have been in evidence every time I’ve stayed here. I’ve never been into these facilities but thankfully, have also never heard loud noise from them either. Although it always seems busy, it also looks clean and well maintained in both the public areas and the rooms. This hotel gets a lot of use and doesn’t let that wear it down. We were hoping to spend some time by the pool, but it is smallish, lots of concrete and little shade and really has nothing much going for it other than it is a pool. It is quite exposed and to me is not a good place to relax. We didn’t stay long. Like I said earlier, this is not a “resort” type of hotel, so don’t go there expecting that kind of a pool area. We had drinks in the bar, enjoyed talking to the bar tender, but have not eaten in any of the dining facilities, so I can’t speak to the quality of the food. There aren’t a lot of dining choices within walking distance of the hotel. Denny’s is the only one that comes to mind. This is a busy commercial district and I don’t feel real comfortable strolling around the neighborhood. Our room was clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. The bedding is high quality with plenty of pillows, which were a bit soft for my taste. Nice big flat screen TV, coffee maker in the room, quality bath accessories… all in all a comfortable place to relax and sleep. There’s a decent sized desk area but you have to pay $12.95 extra for internet access. This really annoys me, especially when much lower quality hotels and motels provide free internet access. That's like charging extra to watch the TV. The room was quiet considering the proximity to the airport. You can sort of hear the air traffic, but with the thick, double pane windows and sound proofing, it is barely noticeable. The website says they have 24-hour room service, which we did not try. Nor did we try the complimentary 24-hour Fitness Center. I’d describe The Hilton Los Angeles Airport as upper scale utilitarian. Clean and functional, with everything you need, but not a resort. I have no reservations about recommending The Hilton Los Angeles Airport and I’ll probably be back myself.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice airport hotel, delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Izzy6
Reviews.Content: The rooms are in line with what you would expect of a Hilton: quality rooms with comfortable beds and pillows. We enjoyed our stay. The breakfast was truly delicious (loved the omelet that came with the buffet) and restaurant service was excellent, friendly and prompt. Excellent airport hotel

Reviews.Title: “It was probably very nice 20 years ago...”
Reviews.Author: KidsInT0w
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in desperate need of a renovation. Everything is of good quality, but after 20 years it doesn't impress. I also felt nickel and dimed, with vending machines that cost $3.00 and exorbitant prices for anything in room service. I was so glad I had a few snacks from the airplane left in my bag. I gave it a two instead of one simply because we did get a good nights sleep and I got a good workout the next morning (even if the gym was in the basement with barely working AC). Skip it!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice for an airport hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stevenandrophy
Reviews.Content: After staying in Thousand Oaks, CA, for a few days, we had an early flight out, and didn't want to drive and suffer through rushhour traffic, so we decided to stay one night here at Hilton LAX. It was definitely a huge surprise to find such a nice airport hotel! In such a huge hotel, I wasn't expecting great service, but from the moment we checked in to the time we checked out, it was great (maybe that was because we were HHonors Gold?)! There was a problem with the WiFi that was supposedly free for HHonors members, and somebody at the front desk helped me fix it very quickly! The room was fine for one night. The executive lounge on Floor 16 was great for a quick bite to eat before our long flight home, and it had a nice view of the tarmac! Overall, a great hotel, but I definitely wouldn't stay here for any other purpose besides having an early flight. One small thing: the "gardens" on the third floor aren't really gardens... but who cares?

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiscomeBay
Reviews.Content: This property is certainly convenient to LAX. Having stayed at this hotel many times throughout the years it is nice to see how it has evolved into its existing property. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the relaxing lobby is refreshing and provides many seating locations. The restaurant menu is a little basic although they do offer a buffet too. The rooms were large and had nice furnishings and I enjoyed my view looking over the LAX runway. The airport shuttle service was convenient too, even at 4am when I used it for my departure. I have no negatives to offer about this property, which is hard to believe, even for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Spartan6
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Hilton LAX and we would definitely recommed this place. The staff was very professional and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The check in process was quick and very efficient. We had no issues with the room, in-room dining, or ammenities. The hotel location is very convenient to the airport, but you will hit traffic everywhere. Getting to the downtown area, Hollywood, or Venice Beach will be an exercise in patience, but all these areas are well worth the cost to your nerves. The Italian restaurant next to the lobby is very expensive! Three raviolies came in at about $7 a piece. They were good, but not that good. Avoid that unless you have a very full wallet. The checkout process was also very quick and seamless. Getting to the rental car return and then to the airport is a breese. This was a very nice stay at a very nice hotel that is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Better options elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: This HIlton property is fairly dated, hard to find your way around, is short on comfort, and doesn't have much else to recommend it. There was a mini-fridge plugged in sitting in the middle of the room - why?! With the other better-priced options nearby, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I am surprized they didn't charge us for breathing.”
Reviews.Author: johnschmitt1964
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us traveling so we booked a suite which had one King size bed and couch that I was told when i call the other two could sleep on. No we could not so we had to rent a rollaway for the 20.00 a night. Also there was not mini fridge in the room. Four people and each of us had a lap top and each had to pay for internet service 13.95 a day each. All on top of the cost of the room. The Tower level lounge had nightly snacks but the seemed to have lost interest in them once that put them out. Also a few bad choices on thier part, like just piling a cheese covered appitizer in a chafing dish which then become a mess of melted cheese stuck together.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FJSjr2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hilton a few times for a night when I was flying into LAX late. It's a nice property and very convenient to LAX. Although you're right by the airport there is very little noise in the room. I found the WIFI to be very good and had no problem streaming movies on Netflix. Rooms are nicely appointed but they still have the old style 4x3 TV's with the rounded picture tube and that's becoming a real turn-off for me in a luxury hotel. The bathroom is small but functional. The shower head could use replacement and was difficult to control. When I checked in (by myself) I had two suitcases, a large box and a backpack and no help was available or offered with the luggage getting off the shuttle or up to my room. Breakfast in the main restaurant was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “DAY STAY WONT BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: geordiedora
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a day stay whilst enroute from maui, as we had 12 hour layover. Were given keys to a room already occupied by sleeping occupants. When returning to the front desk no apology given and a frosty faced colleague served us. The hotel is a nice classy hotel with alovely airy bedrooms but the staff are snobby and unhelpful therefore i would not stay again. After having our onward flights cancelled, we stayed next door at the Marriott hotel which was just as classy but had excellent staff, friendly and approachable we would recommend this hotel, much cheaper but quality staff plus they also have free transfers from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ANDY1888
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night as I needed to take a flight out of LAX at 7am. This is a very nice hotel and the front desk staff was nice and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal travellers airport stop”
Reviews.Author: Narziss
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times recently to recover from flights from NZ and to prepare for flights to NZ, all you have to do is wait for the free airport shuttle which operates frequently 24/7. Has been a great place to stay and for $1.00 you can catch the bus outside to the city and beach of Santa Monica which makes a great rest day activity.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: nytravelergirl
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on it's proximity to LAX - literally minutes (as well as Randy's Donuts!!). Our room was spacious and clean, we were booked for one night only. The bed was the most comfortable bed that I ever slept on - no joke. The dining options were also very nice. Landings (for a late night drink and snack) was very nice, and the Bistro serves a good cup of coffee. My only complaint was that as guests, we did get "lost in the shuffle" a bit and the staff was a bit short - we had a few questions as to parking and payment, and every time we approached someone behind the desk with a question, the person looked at us like we were crazy. Other than that, the stay was fine and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: ladyaviva
Reviews.Content: What a first rate hotel! Convenient location, right near LAX, impeccable, friendly, and courteous service, and beautiful views from my 11th floor room! Cost was reasonable, especially when you consider the convenience. Room was beautifully furnished, with quality bathroom soap (always something I check, because too often the soap in hotel rooms hardly even raises a lather) and a wonderful, steaming hot shower! Bed linens were very good quality. If I had one small issue it was the TV ... placed square in the middle of the window and blocking a bit of the fabulous view. With a skyline to gaze at and watching those beautiful planes come in to land, why would anyone want to ruin it with the blinking box?! A very good hotel experience, nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Best and most convenient to LAX”
Reviews.Author: amaroocars
Reviews.Content: We travel to US once or twice a year and always stay at Hilton Lax on arrival and the day before we depart home to Aussie. Have always found the service excellent even though the hotel is now "aged". Recently upgraded rooms and the higher floor are excellent. Great for the traveller looking to beat jetlag after the flight across the Pacific as its close but so quite, even though its situated between the LAX runways, so great to see the planes comming in but not hearing them. Great shuttle service to airport and have even used it to just go to LAX to check on bookings etc. For those people that use Hertz, the desk at the hotel is staffed by most helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi sucks, food expensive”
Reviews.Author: AirFairy
Reviews.Content: I stay here 3-5 times a month due to work. Wifi sucks! Doesn't matter if you're on floor 5, or the executive floor on 13. Signal drops out every minute. Just gave up and used my 3G on my iphone. Food is expensive, as are most restaurants at hotels in this class. Pool is outdoors, but doesn't have that 'enticing' feel to it. Some nights it is loud in the hallways and I'm wondering am I at a motel? Beds are comfy and room is nice, but you can tell it's an old hotel. Old TV's in rooms, NO flatscreens. Thermostat is old fashioned dial where you're not really sure what the temp is. Just have to guess somewhere between 60-70, 70-80? Shower head is old and not great coverage/pressure. I don't mind staying here for the huge discount I get, but would NOT pay normal rates to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: throb001
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, nice comfortable beds and an incredibly friendly staff. Rates are a bit high on single night stays. The restaurant downstairs is pretty good, and so is the cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Toto2Leavenworth
Reviews.Content: Took a room here for the convenience to the airport. This is a first rate hotel. Valet parking was very convenient, front desk staff was efficient and friendly, bell staff was quick and courteous. Room service was too expensive so we ate at the coffeee shop. Very good espresso, croissants, and fresh fruit. Next to the airport I expected it to be noisy.....I was wrong. And the king size bed was excellent to sink into and sleep comfortably all night.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport without the airport noise”
Reviews.Author: AL_Bandeirantes
Reviews.Content: I travel often to the Burbank and Glendale area but I stay here always on the last days of my trip becaues of the terrible traffic on the 405 and because this hotel is so close to the airport. The rooms are comfortable and adequate, the business lounge on the 16th floor provides an awesome view of the airport runways to watch planes take off and land. The bar is reasonabily priced for the city it is in and the service is quick. Other than that this hotel is more or less for people "on the go" so you will see a lot of activity at all hours of the day in the lobby due to folks arriving from and leaving for the airport. There's not much around the hotel as far as stores or shops but then again it is right next to the airport. I've never had a problem finding a parking space in the underground garage, although the spaces are quite tight depending on the vehicle you have. What I liked best about this hotel is that even being so close to the airport, you can't hear any jet noise from planes taking off and landing, I've had rooms on the 16th and 17th floors and it is very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “not bad...but a bit slow at check in”
Reviews.Author: idontlikechina
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded to an executive floor, room was fine for myself, cbathroom small, but clean and room very quite, but had nothing for a view. Room service speed was OK, food was nothing to write home about. My only complaint was the check in process. Fortunately I got to the desk quickly before the rest of the shuttle figured out where to check in and was #3 in the HHonors line, but the other line was at least 10 deep and only one person at HHonors and the one in the other. Need some staff flexibility during tmes when the guests start lining up heavily.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly managed hotel - poor service at understaffed reception - stay at the Sheraton or Westin, instead!”
Reviews.Author: Carpinteria
Reviews.Content: For convenience, I stayed at this hotel the night before my flight. As an Hilton Diamond member, I'm accustomed to better service than I received at the hotel. It took me 20 minutes to check-in (and that was in the Honors queue!). I told the person at reception I wanted a quiet room. While noting the comments in my profile (high floor; away from elevator), he assigned a room that was near the power-up end of one of the runways, and all evening, all night, and all the next morning I heard jet engines revving to capacity every 1- to 2-minutes. I tried several times to get guest services or an operator, but the phones just "rang and rang." Every time I attempted to obtain any service, it was an interminable delay. I was told by multiple people who work there that this is a common occurrence. This is not an employee problem; it is a greedy management problem. It also took me 20 minutes to check out (again, the Honors line), and not all of my charges (room service lunch) had been posted to the account. Some guests were in line for over an hour to check in (the "regular line"). Everyone was friendly - but overwhelmed and only marginally competent. The manager of this hotel should be fired at once. I do NOT recommend staying here. Instead, stay at the Westin or Sheraton - or anywhere else! This is a poorly-staffed and poor service hotel masquerading as a fine property. Ha!

Reviews.Title: “Easy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fab65Roma_Italy
Reviews.Content: I recently had to stop by LA for one night and I picked up this hotel among those close to the airport. The hotel is perfect if you have to spend one night, the shuttle service with the airport is efficient and the hotel is really close by. The executive lounge is nice and practical. The rooms were just for one night so I did not pay attention to the furniture, while the space is really just enough. The hotel has also a pool we didn't use. the breakfast was good and the staff allover the hotel was helpful. So if you are looking for an airport hotel in LA that's could be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Typical airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: shethang
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night before my very early morning flight. The front desk service was efficient and friendly. The service at Landings Bar in lobby area was too. Pleasant surprise! I would rate higher, but for the price I paid there are a few things about the property that I didn't love. The building is obviously older and very highly trafficked since it is so close to LAX. It's been updated, but it's kind of like dressing up an old pig. You can tell its age when the in-room thermostat is an old plastic dial thing from the 1970's and the room just doesn't cool off properly because building mechanicals are old. It was a sunny day and what looked and sounded like raindrops were hitting my window outside. Clearly something mechanical was dripping outside, another sign of the building age. I'd stay again only if I had a very early flight because it is super convenient to LAX. Otherwise, I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Day stay in transit at LAX”
Reviews.Author: ekirsty
Reviews.Content: I arrived at LAX after a 13hr flight and with a 10 hr transit. I walked out of the terminal and hopped on the first free hotel shuttle which happened to be the Hilton's one. I was offered a room for 8hrs with no hassle. $79. The bed was extremely comfy and the room clean as expected. It was the perfect way to have a 6hr snooze, a shower and refresh before continuing on the next part of my journey. Will definitely be doing the same thing when I pass through again next week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience overall, except for a minor issue”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTravelCrew
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hilton thru Hotwire, having never used Hotwire before. The Hilton rate was $128 but I got a better rate booking thru Hotwire at $77 a night, so I booked for 3 nights/4days. Upon checking in, the lady at front desk made it a point to mention that I had booked thru hotwire, not sure why/how it was important, but she seemed to put emphasis on it. I requested at that point a smoking room and was told that technically that hotel is non-smoking, but that they do have a few smoking rooms. I thought to myself then why dont you technically put that on your site then instead of suprising folks at check-in. She did give me the option of instead of a smoking room, to get a room on the 3rd floor with a patio door to the pool where I could go out and smoke. This turned out to be a good thing, as the room that we got was a non-smoking room with two doubles. Being that it is summer, I didn't mind smoking outside in the tables they have immediately outside the rooms overlooking the pool. I wasn't looking for a room with a view, so I found this to be an added bonus. The room was very spacious, clean, and well-appointed. We kept taking various showers throughout the day, so we asked for and immediately received extra bath towels. The couple times we visited the pool/jacuzzi area, they had plenty towels available by the pool, which are a different color (green) than the room towels. What I found rather disturbing was the fact that on our 2nd night, my friend and I were outside our room having a conversation around 10pm, and shortly thereafter security came to our front door, asked me for my ID, then told me to please keep our loud noise down as they had got a complaint that my friend and I were being too loud. I am not sure how a general conversation at normal tones is considered loud. I understand Hilton has a responsibility to its customers and as such they have to look into any type of complaint, but I just find it disturbing that there were others having conversations outside in the tables, yet we were the only ones to get a visit from hotel security. That was a total mood killer as we went on the rest of our trip literally whispering to each other at the risk of being complained about again. I travel alot and have stayed at this property before, but never had any issues, until this trip. One thing that I also did enjoy was that we were able to use the free hotel wifi (public areas) inside our room throughout our entire stay without having to pay the daily fee for internet. It probably has something to do with the fact that we were immediately next to the pool area, so the signal of the free wifi extended into our room. I can't comment on the food as we always went out to grab a bite to eat for Breakfast and Dinner. All in all it was a very good stay, and would have been all around great had the incident with security not occured. I would definitely stay at this property again, and most certainly would be nice to once again get a room on the 3rd floor with sliding door to the pool. Especially since I will be in the area a few more times this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean and Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tresc0
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night on route from London to Hawaii. The hotel shuttle (which was free) was excellent and on time both inward and outward journey. Check in staff at the hotel were friendly and efficient. Hotel room allocated was on the 13th floor overlooked the car parking area but we had great views of the planes coming in to land. The room was very large, very clean and comfortable with good quality furnishings. We ate dinner in The Cafe restaurant on the ground floor - again staff were excellent and the meal (chicken) was very good and excellent value for money - would well recommend it. This hotel is excellent for the airport and we would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but nothing remarkable -- Better values available in the vicinity”
Reviews.Author: Liteh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton LAX for a few hours between flights in the summer of 2010. Room was adequate. Hotel's public areas are attractive, but fairly busy. Parking is a pain in the neck -- both driving through their maze of a garage and dealing with their system for discounted parking for hotel guests. Lines were too long at check out. Be prepared for this if you are checking out before a flight. Would opt to stay elsewhere on future trips for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel Staff- Parking, Elevator, Dining Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: hiltonsucks-2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very friendly, especially those working in the bistro dining area. The security officers were very helpful, friendly, and handsome! A+ for hiring those fine men!! The maidstaff was excellent! On the flip side, the parking was terrible. i paid 20 dollars a day and assumed that would guarantee parking, but it did not. Coming in during the wee hours of the morning, we thought parking would be a challenge. But it wasn't just a challenge during the wee hours, it was all day. There were empty spaces blocked off for car pools while we went around and around trying to find places to park, Eventually settling on parking next to a wall where our car could have been damaged. People parked cars in, fortunately that was not the case for us, but one guest was very upset when he could not leave. The elevators were slow to the parking ramp One night it tool us 20 to catch an elevator. The entire hotel is outdated to be a hilton. The entire facility is very banquet looking. The rooms were just alright. Nothing special. The tvs were out dated (not flat screens). The concierge although was helpful gave us wrong directions on two separate occasions. Thank goodness for cell phone GPS. The food in the dining area was not good, and I would recommend eating at the bistro near the front of the hotel. The floors of the hotel needed to be vacuumed and shampooed as they were stained. The elevators that take you to the rooms were also very slow even though there was 6 of them! The pool is small. Don't go thinking you will gegt a good spot. there are about 20 chairs even though there are like 4 hot tubs!!

Reviews.Title: “It was a little dated, but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadabug
Reviews.Content: I will stay at a different hotel next time I need to stay near the airport. IT wasn't bad, just not as nice as some of the others in the area. Plus, I couldn't get cell phone service in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: heidigon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hilton LAX as part of a park and one night stay as we were going on vacation. I called the hotel directly twice on the day of our arrival to confirm our reservation. They could not locate our reservation. When we arrived they were able to find it after three employees searched. We were put in a room that was dirty, dated and opened directly to the pool area (like a motel room), with a sliding door. The room is seriously dated, i.e. dorm room with laminate furniture. The nicest area of this hotel is the lobby. The TV did not function, so we called the front desk four times in a 2 hour period before they finally sent a technician. When the technician said he couldn't repair it, the hotel moved us to another room. The second room was equally dated and dirty. On our return from our vacation, we waited 45 minutes (at 5 a.m.) at the airport for a hotel shuttle to arrive. While others came around every 15 minutes. We will not return to this hotel. The hotel seriously needs updating and better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: StripedFeline
Reviews.Content: I was here from the 23rd to the 26th June '11 for a short event I was attending. I'm a 20-year-old girl who came all the way from England, so I was a bit nervous considering it was my first traveling experience all alone. The Hilton made me feel so welcome and comfortable when I arrived and left. The staff I came across were very helpful and polite, and would go out of their way for you. When I was leaving one of the guys at the front door (I forgot to ask for his name!) noticed I was waiting for the shuttle for a while and had me sit down in the lobby area whilst he waited for it himself, which I thought was very nice of him! Speaking of shuttles, these were very convenient for getting to and from the hotel, and the drivers were very nice and helpful and took my suitcase without question when they saw me struggling to lift it. The room itself was really nice, which I expected since I was staying at the Hilton of course! The bed was so comfy, housekeeping came every day, the room looked out to the lovely pool area... The one thing I got confused about was to how to use the shower! We use it differently in England and I couldn't find any instructions, etc. I figured out how to do the bath, but not the shower. Plus my GHD straighteners didn't work or have power when I plugged them in (which I've been told is because they need a lot of power?). Apart from that, my hotel experience was absolutely perfect. Thank you so much for making my trip enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobali
Reviews.Content: We had some contact with the hotel prior to our arrival - after a long 10 hr flight we arrived to what we can only describe as a lovely looking and impressive hotel. The foyer area is large and looks lovely with its sweeping stairs, gold and marble fittings and polite doormen. Check in was efficient and easy and we had 2 big corner rooms as promised over looking the runway, they were clean and the fittings were all in good order, the linen quality was particularly good. Yes there is some noise from the runway but we were not affected by it. We spoke with the conceirge and they arranged a day excursion the next morning, good price for what we received but they were late picking us up, when in fact there head quarters were around the corner ? We didn't dine in the hotel but we had breakfast down the road in Dennys which I must say was excellent value for money. On our first night we walked around the corner and caught the Big Blue Bus to Santa Monica which was lovely to stretch our legs and wander around the shops. On our second night the conceirge informed us about the trolley which went to Manhattan Beach from the stop right outside the hotel front door which was nice to also stroll around. We also used the pool during the afternoon, even with the aircraft noise it suited us fine as it was a lovely suntrap. We were very impressed with the Hilton and we would definately recommend it for an over night stay if like us you don't want to drive as soon as you arrive into LA. The free shuttle from the airport made it easy for us to transfer back to pick up our car 2 days later and the day excursion let us see as much as possible without the driving. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: CabareteMassage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in a day room as we had long layovers in LA flying to and from Australia. It is super close to the airport and the shuttles are quick and run frequently. The rooms are very nice and the beds and bedding were exactly what we needed during a long trip. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. I want to give a big thank you though to Robert who works the front door of the hotel. On our second trip through, we messed up our flight times and almost missed our flight. Robert was amazing, unbelievably understanding and personally drove us to LAX and insured that we made our plane!! It is so wonderful to come across people like Robert who care and who go that extra mile to help you. Thank you for making our travels easier!

Reviews.Title: “Convienent airport stay”
Reviews.Author: beachgoers2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable and convenient to the airport. The free shuttle to and from the airport was reliable and not over crowded. The beds and linens were of excellent quality and I found the hotel to be fairly quiet. The breakfast buffet was overpriced for what it was, but there are few alternatives unless one is prepared to go out of the immediate area. I do recommend the Big Blue Bus #3 that picks up outside of the hotel and goes to Venice beach and Santa Monica. It is only $1 each way (50cents if you are over 65) and is a pleasant way to spend the day if you are on a stopover. There is a trolley to Manhattan beach and a local shopping mall, at $5 round trip this is also a good alternative especially if you want a change from eating at the hotel. The hotel provides a kiosk near the check-in for printing boarding passes for most common airlines; this is a very useful feature especially if you are not checking baggage. Dinner at the more casual restaurant was pleasant and if you are not a big eater I would recommend sharing as the price soon adds up. Coffee I think was $4 for example. There is a free tea and coffee maker in the room and this was a really nice feature that we used a lot. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night stopover”
Reviews.Author: MartaA1
Reviews.Content: Typical airport hotel, we staid one night after driving back from Las Vegas. Free shuttle to/from LAX 24 hours so very handy. Room was basic, but comfortable. Staff was really nice. Food was poor, we had dinner in the coffee bar downstairs and it wasn't great. The pool area is ok, but the towels provided were really old and too small. Overall ok for a one night stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christine050
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so convenient to Lax - they have a shuttle and after a longhaul flight it is ideal to try to recover from the jetlag. Staff are friendly and helpful and rooms are very comfortable - you can always get good online rates too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bring kids to this hotel - not for famlies.”
Reviews.Author: expatrick
Reviews.Content: I chose LAX Hilton last month because of the location and Hilton image, and I found myself staying at the same hotel as "Dom Con". I had to ask someone, given all of the inappropriately dressed people, and I was told it was the Dominatrix Convention. Being alone I just chuckled, but was glad I hadn't brought my kids with me. Even in LA where anything goes, this was an inappropriate crowd and the hotel should have disclosed this so other guests could select another property. On a normal day, the location would make this an attractive place to stay even thought the property itself is quite outdated. I had an early morning flight, so I took the hotel shuttle to the airport. The rental car agencies are within walking distance, so I dropped off my car the night before and was able to avoid parking charges. Next time I will stay a bit further out.

Reviews.Title: “Has anything you would expect in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyold
Reviews.Content: This is a big hotel that has everything you would expect. It's slightly old, but they do a good job maintaining it and my particular room has everything working as expected. The hotel itself is very big, so often times there are long lines for everything you might need. Some of the highlights include: 1. Stations to print airline boarding pass. This is very convenient especially if you don't have checked baggage, since you could go to the airport and go straight to the security line. 2. Shuttle service from/to LAX airport, a HUGE plus. 3. Valet parking. A little pricey at $33 per 24 hours, but it's worth it. I have to mention that if you do decide to park yourself, the parking lot goes down to six levels underground and even then, it's still hard to find parking, especially in the weekends when there are events in the hotel ballroom. 4. Excellent restaurant and cafe. 5. There is a Hertz counter in the parking lot, which could make your trip that much more convenient. Remember when booking on Hertz website to indicate your pick up and drop off as LAX Hilton, not LAX itself. The only bad thing I could say about this hotel is that sometimes the noise from the hallway is really audible in the room and vice versa. If you are a light sleeper, this might become an issue. Also, the internet here is NOT free. I forget exactly how much it is, but I remember that it was quite expensive, which is why I did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveinant to the airport, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: FlyingMan11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to LAX literally 5 minutes from the airport. They have a shuttle that will pick you up and take you to the hotel as well as they neighboring hotel. The lobby bar stays open untill 2 am. The hotel has a 24 hour room service as well as a bakery and small food shop also in the lobby. Next to the front desk there is a Hertz rent a car where you can rent a car directly out of the hotel. Prices were fairly reasonable. My room was an inside corner room which to be honest was massive. There was 1 king bed, and the room was probably 23 feet by 16. It was easily the biggest hotel room I have ever been in. I had a door on both sides on my room which led to 2 different hallways. The bed was very comfortable, the tv was a basic tube top tv. From here it took me about 25 minutes to get to Hollywood hills and 30 minutes to get to Santa Monica Pier. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: firecracker47
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest hotels that I have stayed at recently. We had an offer to upgrade the room for a small amount each night and we did. We ended up in a two room bath and a half suite. It was wonderful. The bed was better than my bed at home. The room was spotless. And for me, I loved the panoramic view of the LAX runways. I could hardly tear myself away. There seemed to be security everywhere. Going up and down from the garage, standing by the elevators and watching the lobby. About what you would expect from that size hotel. You still have to be your own advocate and not leave things in the room that have value. While we did not have much interaction with the staff since we were out and about most of the time, there seemed to be plenty of people to ask if you needed something. We like the location because it is close to relatives, close to going down to Long Beach and close to the marina. If you are looking to go shopping or walk to tourist attractions, you can't. It is an airport hotel. I can't wait until my next visit to LA so that we can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and cosy”
Reviews.Author: KDMumbai
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to stay at this hotel when I was in LA for a night catching early morning next day flight. Its very convenient to reach here, it took just 15 min in complimentary hotel shuttle. Room was good and enough for a single person. Better to book over internet 2-3 days in advance and you can get room at good rate. Coffee machine in the room was a boon as I reached late in the evening. They have a coffee shop, though, running 24X7, used for quick break-fast next day morning. Overall stay was good, but could not check / use any other facilities they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Off to a good start!”
Reviews.Author: emysand
Reviews.Content: Before boarding a ship for a 15 day cruise to Hawaii, I booked 3 rooms at the Hilton for my family, brother and sister in law. The pre-cruise days at the Hilton were just around the Christmas Holiday and I was going to be away from my grandchildren for this time. Thus, I invited my sons and their families to enjoy a few days in LA with their uncle, aunt. They had not seen my brother in over 20 years. It was a wonderful time and the kids enjoyed the trip. My granddaughter especially loved the Gingerbread house in the lobby. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The special dining area for breakfast and dinner drinks was very convenient as we do not like leaving the kids. The only negative thing was it was raining so hard there was water in one of the rooms. We did not appreciate the wet towels in the room but all in all it was a well spent time and we would do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: gittinsj
Reviews.Content: I will approach this review from a different perspective since I stayed here after missing a connection at the airport. The airline gave this as the hotel I was staying at. A shuttle picked us up at the airport, though this took a while. Once at the hotel, they quickly entered my voucher and I was in the room within 5 minutes. They even informed me that my food vouchers from the airline could be used in the bistro, which I thought was useful. The room itself was clean and comfortable. I was able to see the planes landing and taking off. There is some noise, but not as much as some other airport hotels I've stayed at. The shuttle runs 24 hours a day, which was great, since I was able to get to the airport for my very early flight without any worries. It was an enjoyable, though unexpected stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: chloes1
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Priceline - a little weary that we might get a "Priceline" room since it was mentioned in a prior review, but there wasn't anything wrong with it. We were on the 12th floor facing the city. Although we could hear the airplanes, it wasn't cause for concern (although you can definitely hear noise from the hallways). The room was clean, although the A/C & TV were old and the bathroom was TINY - but for the price I paid to stay Sat-Sunday during Memorial Wknd it was definitely worth it. I paid more than double to stay at a 4* in West Hollywood and I thought this was more than comparable. We parked in the lot downstairs - although the elevator was slow, we always found parking. My only issue was that when we got there around 1pm to check in, they wouldn't let us saying none of the rooms were available which I highly doubted since it did not seem full at all during our stay. Based on the location, everywhere we went was only a 20 minute drive at most. I would definitely book in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: thepieshop66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night having arrived at LAX before travelling further into the USA. Hotel shuttle was prompt for pick-up. Reception staff were friendly and polite although a little busy. The room was clean and tidy and of a fair size. Checkout was just as simple. There is also a hertz car rental desk within the reception area. We had booked to pick up a car from the main hertz lax premises however having enquired at the desk in the hotel the rep arranged for pickup from there at no extra cost. Located very near to the airport and within walking distance of the proud bird restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: DigitalPRMusic
Reviews.Content: All I can say is this, First off protect your possessions, They have a theft problem and when reported the staff was horrible in dealing with it. I can say some staff was amazing however I would stay at Hiltons again. JUST NOT THIS ONE.. Poor customer service, Disrespectful and overall staff lacks in Customer Service skills. I had to file a police report over the theft. I travel a lot and I do not pay for my rooms, My Record label has promised me that no one from the label will stay here again. I would stay at the Weston or any other hotel by LAX again. AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAUGE!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport. Far from everything else.”
Reviews.Author: eddies_advice
Reviews.Content: I liked it, but I wouldn't stay there again. The service is ok, but not very helpful. The rooms were nice, but don't ever get sucked into upgrading it to a larger room to also include breakfast. The standard room is just as good and you're better off having breakfast down in the restaurant. It's close to the airport and the Hilton provides a free shuttle service to and from the airport, but it's far from everything, in terms of entertainment and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great strides”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to the Hilton LAX; and this past visit, I noticed a marked improvement in service, staff demeanor, and product. This is not a hotel where one would vacation to say, Disneyland, it doesn't market itself as a resort, it is a (very large) airport property, with all the amenities that business and frequent travelers are used to: HHonors floors, HHonors lounge, room service, proximity to the airport. Service had fallen off here previously, but I am pleased to say that it has come back with force: with ONE exception: the shuttle. The shuttle is shared with the Four Points hotel, it can be slow, and frustrating. A suggestion to management: have one shuttle for Terminals 1-3, and another for TBIT-7, as the shuttle finds it's way to 7, it is almost always packed, and the passengers who have boarded at 1,2 and 3 are steamed.

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating & Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: sc121980
Reviews.Content: As per usual, I will do my pros and cons list. Pros: *The hotel has a lot of amenities in general. They have a gift shop, several restaurants on site, valet parking (if that's your thing), a business center, a pool, four jacuzzis (also if that's your thing), a gym, and so on. *The bistro and room service options are 24 hours. *I felt that the gym was well-furnished and convenient. My only suggestion for improving it would be to provide bottled water instead of a water cooler. *All of the staff members that I encountered were friendly and personable. *There are two self-serve kiosks in the lobby so you can check-in for a flight and print your boarding passes. *The bed was comfortable. Cons: *The pool is small and outdoors. It is heated but it didn't seem to be practical for anything other than kids who want to goof around. *Parking can be a headache. It was difficult for me initially to even find the self-parking entrance and if you skip the valet service, you will be parking way down in the depths. You must keep the parking ticket they issue you at check-in to be able to get into and out of the parking garage every single time. *The lines at the front desk were generally long, even at strange times of the day and night. *There seemed to be drama with the elevators constantly. At one point, only two elevators were working and the lines of people waiting to use them were insane. *Room service was a major price gouge. For two people to eat basic, small meals, it was $50. I expect that in NYC, but not so much in LA, particularly when the quality was not good. I did not get sick from my food but my friend did. *The bistro is over-priced and of similar dubious quality. If your choices are limited or time is not on your side, you can chance it but if you can go down the street, you are better off. There are convenience stores, a Subway, a Taco Bell, etc., within a short distance down Century Blvd. I ordered a pizza at the bistro and it was swimming in orange grease. They charged $15 for what seemed like a $2 microwave pizza. *I could not get anything in the "business center" to work. When I went in to make a photocopy, another hotel patron was trying to send a fax and he told me that he had not been able to get the copier to work either. *When the maids cleaned the room each day, they never provided an extra roll of TP. Upon arrival, I discovered some long hairs in the bathtub and some make-up smudges on the sink. *The size of our room itself was good but the bathroom and the closet were tiny. *The hotel is constantly busy and there is constant noise. It never stops. This is understandable, of course, but the walls are thin and there is a gap between the door and the floor. You can see the shadows of people coming and going down the hallway and before we checked out, at some point in the night, someone slid a bill under our doorway. Honestly, a gap that large under the door does not make me feel particularly safe or that I have privacy. If you do not sleep with ear plugs, you will get no rest. The noise factor is very high. You might expect it to be airplane noise but it is the loudness of guests plus the thin walls. *The location is good in terms of closeness to LAX and the rental car companies. I definitely think for business travelers, it makes sense. For leisure travelers not so much. *I know this will sound kooky to some people but we had some odd experiences in our room. To be specific, there were strange noises we could not account for (dog growling when there was no dog in the room, the sound of footsteps dragging across the carpet when none of us were moving) and we felt creeped out. If you don't believe in the paranormal, feel free to disregard this part of the review but if you do believe, I personally think something other-worldly was going on in our room. I wouldn't stay in there again if someone offered me a million dollars. Overall, I felt like it was worn out and they were giving people 2 and 3 star treatment in a "4 star hotel" with inflated prices.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY AT HILTON LAX”
Reviews.Author: NJEXIT7A
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 5 night stay while visiting family in LA at the Hilton. The location was perfect for us since we were doing day trips each day - i.e. Disneyland. The Concierge Staff was very pleasant and always had a smile on their face while assisting me with directions or my lost luggage from the airport. Our guest room was very clean and the shuttle service to the Airport was wonderful. I will definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but a symphony of bland and beige”
Reviews.Author: FozzyO
Reviews.Content: We had a late flight over from London to LA for a overnight stop before going up to Canada. So the trip was only going to be very short. We arrived a the airport, quickly through immigration, and then found the hotel shuttle stop. On the bus and a short ride with a few extra stops to the hotel. This is our second stay there and it is trying to hard to be inoffensive in design and decor that it just becomes the most boring hotel on the planet. Everything is beige with the occasional splash of taupe. For more then a few hours it is a very depressing colour scheme / decor. We checked into the room, very large, comfy bed, nice view of some air con units and carparks - but then this is an airport hotel so you don't expect views. We headed down to the 'Sports Bar' for some wings before retiring to bed. They say sports bar, yet more beige everywhere. And the plasma TV's on the bar showing some sport make it a Sports Bar. Still very good friendly service, and excellent wings so we ate and enjoyed. Back to the room and to bed. Jetlag got the worse of us so up early we decided to download the new series opener of Dr Who ... incredibly slow internet connection! But we managed it and plugged the iPod into the TV and enjoyed. So if you need a clean comfortable place to crash for a night on a layover its good. For a conference or any longer it could send me a bit crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed it to be”
Reviews.Author: aussie_possie
Reviews.Content: Arrived in LA at around 10am with 2 small kids, 6 & 3, who travelled well but were still a little tired. After the dash from the baggage/customs run we found the hotel shuttle and were so relieved to have a smooth (and fortunately very easy) transition from airport to hotel. When we arrived staff were helpful and polite. We were given our room which we were told was on the quiet side of the building. Fortunately they were right - we had a corner double room where we could watch (but not hear) the planes landing at LAX - certainly kept Mr 3 entertained while the grown-ups got their bearings. As per below reviews, that hotel is a little dated but wasn't something we dwelled on as we fell asleep within minutes of arriving. When we did surface, the concierge was very informative and was able to help us find a shopping centre to organise communications etc. My only suggestion would be to include some kids meals on the room service menu, certainly that would be my only gripe. Otherwise I would like to thank the staff at Hilton LAX for helping start out our holiday!

Reviews.Title: “"Do not take kids to this hotel"”
Reviews.Author: TheRojas6
Reviews.Content: **We booked our trip kind of as a last minute surprise for our kids and so we did not have a lot of options for hotels. This hotel was not a good choice. **It seems as though it is geared ONLY toward business people. Infact, I was traveling with my 10 and 8 year olds and two infants and I got quite a few nasty looks from not only other guests but STAFF as if we did not belong there. **There was NOTHING for my kids to do there. Even in the room there were ABSOLUTELY NO child friendly channels for my kids to watch and the TV was very outdated. **The restaurants were very expensive and again NOT CHILD friendly. **The parking was ridiculously expensive and we had to park very far and walk with four kids. **When we asked if we could get a room with a refrigerator because one of our children has a milk allergy and we needed a place to keep his Silk Milk we were told we had to uprade to another room for an extra $120.00 a day. So instead we had to fill up a tub with ice every few hours to make sure it stayed cold. **We asked for a crib when we got there and it took almost 8 hours and 4 phone calls to get it and it was a pack and play that looked like it was about 20 years old. **Dirty blankets and sheets were left in our room even after we requested a change. **Overall, the hotel was not at all family friendly and we will make sure we steer clear of it next time we are in L.A!!

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: FiAndyB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hilton for one night after a long flight. We had a King suite I think and it worked out around £140 which seemed about right. The rooms were spacious, clean but a little dated. It is very handy for the car rental companies, although obviously being an airport hotel, not good for visiting the city (Venice beach is about 15 mins by car). Good value, spacious and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Airport shuttle is a problem!”
Reviews.Author: Keepthepace
Reviews.Content: Airport transfers should be efficient. Yours along with the lack of assistance from 5 bellstaff and supervisor are not. Over 40 people waited 30 mins at 7:45am for an import shuttle. When two busses arrived, it was chaos with just one bellman helping load quite a bit of luggage from the mob of people needing to go to the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place for short stay”
Reviews.Author: zaneforce007
Reviews.Content: I needed to both visit a client, and then (the next day) pick up my aunt from the airport, and I figured I'd try to squeeze a little bit of recreation in. LAX is two hours from my house so I just needed a place to stay. I bid on priceline for a 3 1/2 star hotel for $55 and got the Hilton Los Angeles Airport. The hotel was relativly outdated. It had that motel style TV with 20 or so channels, and the movie menu. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. A big problem was that I needed the internet for work, and it didn't function. But I have no complaints about that I suppose because the hotel generously refunded the internet fee. The parking price is slightly absorbant but I do recomend using it, as opposed to the cheaper surrounding parking complexes, because 1. It's convienient to take an elevator to your car (even if the car is in a maze 6 floors underground) and 2. The area around the hotel didn't seem like the safest place to be walking around at night. The front desk people were pretty friendly. An important fact might be that you can hear each time an airplane takes off. While this didn't bother me (I might even consider it soothing), the noise has the potential to keep some insomniacs up all night. The bathrooms were pretty small and had a "motel feel". I personally had a nice view of the airport and got to see all the planes take off in room 1147. All in all, It's a decent place to stay if you need somewhere to stay for a connecting flight, or short trip of that type of nature. I however would not recoment spending your whole Los Angeles vacation there. It's labeled as a 3 1/2 star hotel, but It's a little bit more along the lines of a "nice" 2 1/2 star hotel or a "bad" 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, but clean”
Reviews.Author: jayhawkinva
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a beautiful lobby and entrance area, very similar to a Las Vegas style hotel. Past the lobby the hotel was worn and tired looking. The room and public spaces were clean, but they needed some updating and TLC. I'm glad we did not pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: Greevo1
Reviews.Content: Booked a suite after missing a connection to Australia. Service was great, room was good and very quiet. Food very good. Concierge were helpful and the 3.00pm late checkout was greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very big hotel with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: tohellor
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Hotwire for this hotel, it was only $60 a night, so I was pleasently supriseed to find such a large hotel. It has nice big rooms with tea/coffee etc, the rooms are a little dated and you can be walking a long time to your room as the hotel is very big. Overall I was happy with it, but then again I only spent $60 on it so couldnt really go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel. Very clean”
Reviews.Author: Irvine-Robbie
Reviews.Content: I arrived for check-in at 10pm and there was a very short (less than 5 minute wait). The person at the front desk was very nice. The hotel was in reasonably good condition and the room was perfect. I say reasonably good because the carpet in the hallway was a bit dirty. The lobby looked very busy (Friday night 10pm). The only beef I had was parking which was 20 bucks. There is plentiful airport parking all around the hotel for about 12-14. Parking is four floors below ground and spaces are VERY limited. Drivers were circling. I only got a spot because another person was affraid to squeeze into the one I took.... Tiny spaces!

Reviews.Title: “Very large LAX Hotel...........also incredibly friendly..........”
Reviews.Author: Imareserve
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of our LA vacation because of an early flight home. Many smiles and offers of assistance when you pull up to valet parking. We wanted to check in and then drive for lunch....and the gentlemen kept our car close by and handy for us. Check in very friendly and fast. OK, the tube TV needs a refresh......but the reception was crystal clear and lots of channels. Since it was our last night, we celebrated by eating at Andiamo........it was quite busy and that makes sense. Everything we had from the soup to the dessert was delicious. Andiamo is open Monday thru Friday evening and you should try to include it in your plans.

Reviews.Title: “More smiles please”
Reviews.Author: doesmeedin
Reviews.Content: No idea as to cost because the hotel was an overnight stop between flights on a package holiday. Initial impressions were good with polite front desk staff, however after checking in it went downhill. The room was large and comfortable, however, being British and having a love of tea, there was only 1 teabag in the room, when enquiring about trying to get some more, no one seemed accommodating, so had to give up on that. Also in the room there was a plug socket that was loose and we dare not use it. The TV was about the same size as the chest of drawers (old style tube) which to me showed signs of no updates to hotel for a long time. We tried the restaurant in the hotel, but wished we hadn't, and the waitress made me feel like I was an inconvenience rather than a customer We got the impression it was 'Look Glum Day', because none of the staff smiled at any time This was my first time in a Hilton hotel, and if this is the standard to expect, it will be my last.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT OVERNIGHT”
Reviews.Author: MiddleAgedTravlrs
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at this hotel the night before leaving for a cruise from LA port. We arrived at the airport at about 10:30pm and had concerns about the frequency of the free shuttle at that hour. We were pleasantly surprised by the arrival of the shuttle after only about 5 minutes. The driver was very pleasant and friendly and dropped us conveniently at the front door of the hotel. The hotel is beautiful and well maintained. The staff was helpful and room service (since we arrived late and hungry) delivered our food hot within about 1/2 hour. Our package included breakfast which was typical of the Hilton buffet: eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, fruits, breads, danish etc. All in all, a nice hotel and a great place to stop before or after your cruise. (Taxi to the cruise port was about $60 and took about 1/2 hour) Rooms were clean and comfortable. The only down side is that it is a little noisy untl about midnight with flights coming in and out of the airport. However, it IS an AIRPORT hotel, so this is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better for stay and staff here”
Reviews.Author: TassMazz
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault the service and staff here. MGM Grand in Vegas need to learn something from these guys. From reception right through to table staff in the restaurant helpful and curtious staff everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are great; property needs slight refresh”
Reviews.Author: rmushadisright
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is very good, especially for what we paid. The parking situation is pretty insane. There are separate elevators for the parking structure even though it's directly under the building. So you have to take an elevator from the parking garage to the lobby and then walk to another bank of elevators to take those to your floor. It's not that big of a deal but this, combined with the difficulty of getting in and out of the garage, really makes you think twice about leaving for something small. Speaking of the parking garage, it's probably the worst laid out garage I've seen. The first three levels are for valet but there are literally 30+ spots on each level blocked off just for the sole purpose of telling you that it's a valet level. Try to find a space on level 4 (the first self-park level) because anything lower than that requires you go through a maze of turns at each level to get out. The garage, for lack of a better term: sucks. Ok, but the hotel! The hotel is really good. The rooms are modern and clean. The only complaint I'd have (and it's small) is that the TV's are CRT and not flat panel but that's nothing to cry about. The common areas are modern but show wear in the form of many carpet stains. It's not that the hotel is outdated, in fact, it's really modern. It's just that the common area looks like it's heavily trafficked and often. Common area carpets need a very good cleaning at the least, but probably replacement. Don't let this scare you away though. The hotel doesn't feel dirty in the least and it's pluses overcome it's negatives by a long shot. I'd give it an 8 out of 10 overall. And remember, you're not sleeping in the common areas! :-) Overall for what you'll pay off one of the discount sites, you can't beat it. I'd return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Untouched since the 80s”
Reviews.Author: chocpro
Reviews.Content: Once you leave the very nice lobby you enter a world where the rooms haven't been upgraded (besides the beds which do rock) since the 80s. Tube television, formica furniture, dated soiled carpet. One day I get back in late to find out my room hadn't been cleaned, the next morning I stopped by the front desk and asked them to make sure it got cleaned. Arrived the next night to see it was now 2 days with no maid service. This time I sat in the lobby while they cleaned my room. Ate dinner one night in the restaurant since I didn't feel like going out. Big mistake. Horrendously bad food. Mushy over cooked pasta, overpowered by bitter powdered garlic. Prawns overcooked to a nice consistent chewy texture. Saw no need to complain since any 'chef' that let that food be served obviously didn't care at all. This Hilton Diamond member will never be back. It's a disgrace to the Hilton name.

Reviews.Title: “A decent, typical 3 star airport hotel with spacious rooms, a comfortable bed, and some minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: JBSay
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire for a very reasonable price. Overall I was pretty satisfied with my one night stay, although had I paid the full rack rate, I'd have been much less satisfied in terms of value-for-money. The king size bed was comfortable, the room was spacious, and the hotel itself was in fairly good condition. A few minor complaints: the room had not been cleaned as well as it could have been (there were still noticeable water marks from the previous guest on the nightstand). The TV in my room was an old CRT (rather than a flat panel) so no HDMI input for my laptop. A slightly annoying amount of noise emanated from the hallway outside my room throughout the evening and morning, but as a Hotwire user I'm accustomed to getting rooms in subpar locations. The complimentary shuttle to LAX was painless and took about fifteen minutes (for one of the later terminals). The hotel lobby area was very busy in the morning, as was the dr+iveway in front of the hotel. A 24hr Carl's Jr is a few minutes' walk, which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. Nice enough hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PhilipL4Ohio
Reviews.Content: I was wary after some reviews of this property, but found it to be fine. My wife and son commented that it 'smelled'. It smelled like a hotel to me. The hallway carpet and walls need a refresh. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The concierge was very helpful, although I wish he knew some routes better.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: Pittsburgh_AS
Reviews.Content: For a Hilton, this hotel is really outdated. The rooms are clean, but it isn't as great as a "Hilton" is made out to be. There is a Hertz return in the parking garage, which is an added perk.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: delledge
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member my family and, I received a corner room (9th floor) and Towers concierge level privileges. The corner room was quiet and better than expected. It was clean and room temperature controls were easy to make comfortable. As for housekeeping--we had 3 in the room and it should have been obvious that we were in desperate need of shampoo, conditioner, and lotion in the midst of our stay. But we did not receive replacement bottles during her cleaning. Thankfully I had a bit of shampoo left over from my previous trip. The front desk staff was actually quite friendly and accommodating. The entire first floor was a rat race because of a conference held there, so it wasn't exactly easy to get around. Getting an elevator was crazy at times. The most disappointing aspect of our stay: Towers Level Concierge breakfast. We did pay more for a concierge level room. With that, guests should have had fully stocked breads, pastry, fruit, and juice choices. Upon our arrival, the platters were wiped out.
