Very peaceful despite overlooking runway. Lounge great- nice breakfast and free soft drinks- though alcoholic drinks a little expensive. Staff generally very helpful and welcoming. Pool and 4 hot tuns- really nice. Very happy and great value all round. Highly recommmend and worth a bit extra for executive floor/suite.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, nice choice for meals, good service”
Reviews.Author: travelbugAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights in LA on 22 May on our way back from our holiday in French Polynesia. We chose the Hilton at the airport for its location. We were a bit disappointed with the waiiting at the reception, only one person was dealing with a queue of people that was getting longer, we had to wait several minutes before a second person came to the desk to help. The room we were given was a standard room, very small with the basics, no mini fridge and minimum amount of bathroom soaps and msicellaneous. The bathroo/toilet had a bathtub-shower, it was very timy, so much indeed that you first had to close the door before you could get into the bathtub. The windows were not noise proof, and since we were close to the airport we could hear the planes. Besides this, it was quite convenient and we had a nice breakfast and cocktails. The valet service was very helpful and friendly though. The short stay was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheMuggins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2010 and would stay again. We caught the shuttlebus from the airport to the hotel, which was convient and easy. Checkin was smooth and we got straight in to our 1 bedroom suite. Had great views of the airport which made our 2 year old very happy...he got to watch the big planes. The room size was fantastic. Enough for the 3 of us to have our own space. We got an extra rollaway put in the living area for junior so he had his own room. Beds were very comfy, pillows were very comfy. Plane noise was noticed but not annoying...it didn’t effect our sleep at all. The rooms are not new, however this is a good thing if you want the extra space like we did. The buffet breakfast was ok and we were glad the price was included in with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel accommodations with outstanding customer service!”
Reviews.Author: travelingwiththai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton for one night in May 2010. We had a large room (seemed recently renovated) on the 15th floor with a great view. Although we could see some airplanes landing on nearby runways, our room was quiet enough for a restful sleep in a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was small but clean, with plenty of towels. Our very reasonable military rate included access to the Tower Lounge and one breakfast. The Lounge had a excellent view of the airport, with complimentary snacks and non-alcoholic beverages available. Obviously, this benefit would have been more valuable if the wine and beer had also been complimentary, as is the case at their sister property Embassy Suites. The breakfast buffet had almost anything one could imagine. (If you don’t see your favorite item, just ask your waiter, and he may be able to special order it for you!) Hugo was our waiter, and he offered superb service for our table of three (my wife and I were joined by our niece). The adjacent lobby was huge and beautiful, and I have heard that wireless Internet there is free (management may clarify that??). The airport shuttle was free, fast, and convenient. The “icing on the cake” was the outstanding customer service. I have been traveling for almost 50 years, and I have never seen better. One example was the Front Desk. Christopher was extremely efficient at check-in, solved a parking dilemma that occurred “on the spot”, and he allowed early check-in, as our flight arrived in the morning. At checkout, Ava reviewed the charges on our bill to make sure that we received all the discounts to which we were entitled. Okay, I have to admit there was one small glitch: I asked for a 5:30 AM wake-up call, but my phone did not ring until 6:30. But being light sleepers, my wife and I were up early anyway. (And yes, I could have used the alarm clock.)

Reviews.Title: “My room was huge and the bed comfortable...”
Reviews.Author: Vinovixen
Reviews.Content: My room was huge and the bed comfortable. The bathroom was outdated and dirty. I noticed a lot of toothpaste splatters on the walls surrounding the sink. Not up to typical Hilton standards. The gigantic lobby is quite lovely but I didn't spend anytime there.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Morainelake
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after a 2 week stay in Hawaii as we had booked an over night stay before our final flight home to the UK. However our flight home was cancelled due to the Volcanic ash, we therefore spent an extra week at the Hilton. I cannot praise the staff enough for their help and their kind assistance with helping us enjoy our extended holiday. They suggested many activities that did not cost a lot of money as cash was running very low, they also suggested about buying a voucher the previous night for breakfast the next morning as it was cheaper that way. Our first room was very noisy as it was facing the airport, we informed the reception staff who moved us straight away - nothing was too much trouble. All the staff were marvellous, many thanks to you all

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL LOCATED VERY CLOSE TO LOS ANGELES AIRPORT, FOR 1 NIGHT IT'S PERFECT CHOICE.”
Reviews.Author: BORIS1969
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had to stay 1 night close to Los Angeles airport, arriving late in the evening from Honolulu and taking a rental car in the early morning. Our choice was the Hilton Los Angeles Airport Hotel. This was absolutely the best decision ! This hotel is extremely close to the airport, with a free shuttle bus service, located just outside arrival area, easy to find ! Check in was fast and efficient, probably as we arrived very late (around 23:00 local time, no queue !). Our room (nbr 9005) was a standard double bed room, with a normal quality and clean as it should be. Minibar was not available and fridge absolutely empty. This hotel is absolutely perfect for 1 night stay in between 2 flights or after a long haul flight. We also enjoyed breakfast and should say that staff were helpul and friendly. So, I would definitely recommend this hotel for a short stay in Los Angeles Airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a layover”
Reviews.Author: kkekert
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to LAX but wouldn't recommend it if you'd be doing some city sightseeing. Free shuttle service to the airport. Helpful staff, clean, good food. Had a good stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton LA Airport fullfills all requirements of the best top *****hotel in LA”
Reviews.Author: SafirahLasVegas
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Los Angeles Airport fullfills all requirements of an top *****-hotel, the rooms are top clean - the service fantastic - the restaurants absolut excellent - the service of all people extreme friendly, helpful. The location of the hotel besides the airport is very quiet, the shuttle bus to the airport very convenient. The lounge on the 16th floor, the main restaurant, the Italian restaurant are highly to recommend. Following Managers have given us in the past 20 years excellent service: Mr. Ricardo Catubig / Mrs. Theresa Snjwind / Mrs. Pilar Galvez / the manager of the main restaurant Mr. Jung / all people at the entrance (helping with the luggage) and even all the service ladies cleaning the rooms - everybody is very kind and absolutely cooperative. We spend every year 1-3 months in Los Angeles and we ONLY go to the Hilton Los Angeles Airport. We have travelled the world and we have seen all the other big and famous hotels in LA, but the Hilton LA Airport is the best *****-Hotel of Los Angeles. Very highly to recomend to everybody who wants to travel with class !

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: no_no_sheration
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after arriving at LAX from London. The room was lovely, as was the comfy king sized bed. The room was east facing so I decided to pull the curtains open. The next morning I awoke to a truly amazing sunrise, with the San Bernadino Mountains to the left. The gym is great as is the pool area, with no less than 4 hot tubs. The free wifi in the downstairs area is fabulous too. Visitors to the likes of Santa Monica and Venice should consider this hotel too. The Blue Bus stops only a matter of yards from this hotel. It costs around $2.50 and whisks you there in no time. This hotel should be a 4 STAR.

Reviews.Title: “ok...”
Reviews.Author: papeetee
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at the airport is just another typical airport hotel. There was a beautiful lobby, lots of restaurants, a 24/7 bistro. The room was nothing more than ok, it was very dark and had paperthin walls, so i couldn't really sleep at night. Our room was on the 3rd floor so we could walk outside to the patio, which was very nice! Overall the rooms are very aged and need make over! The restaurant however was a disaster, we went there for dinner, i ordered chiecked by a risotto al funghi with winter vegetables and what i git was chicken with some old rice( certainly not risotto) with carrots and bean as well as boiled carrots. It was the first time I actually sent a dish back to the kitchen, i mean i took this dish because of the rissotto al funghi...i don't know maybe the cook wasn't used to people who actually understood teh menu or something but it was uneatable! After sending it back, i got some rice with mushroom, but somehow i was having stomach ache for the rest of the evening after that dinner...we also had some problems at the reception because during checkin we were given a different room rate than the one which appeared on the bill later on, bu somehow we managed to sort that out! Also the charges were way too high (13 usd for internet, 20 for parking etc!) Next time I will try out a difefrent airport hotel at lax.

Reviews.Title: “Good transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyanColombo
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight to catch an early morning flight the next day, Check in was a breeze and I was quickly in my room. However, I did have noisy neighbors across the corridor, who I think were using the hotel as a base for their night on the town (it was a saturday night). All in all, a good hilton hotel with rooms that seemed larger than the usual hilton rooms. Will be back when i'm flying through LAX next.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: viaggiat0re_felice
Reviews.Content: Perfect for a one-night stopover. Rooms were clean, nice bed, and surprisingly quiet, except other lodgers. The night we stayed there was an Anime party/convention in the hotel and they like to party until the wee hours! Lounge was odd in that it seemed so outdated but bet they do a brisk business. Staff was very friendly and helpful. For an airport hotel, this was decent and we'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price ...”
Reviews.Author: jomicade
Reviews.Content: except valet parking was $30! .. self parking wasn't any better @ $20/night. BUT the room was very nice for the price we paid (through Priceline). the front desk was very kind and very helpful to our needs. we got in late and planned on doing room service but after 17% gratuity + $4.50 for service, well .. we went down to the 24hr cafe. again, the service was great, but after a sandwich, pizza, 2 drinks and a bundt cake and $45 later, we started to wonder whether room service would have been better? Ha! As far as the room is concerned (we were on the top floor), the bedding and carpet looked 'new', however the TV was dated (compared to hotels with flat screens) and the bathroom definitely needed a makeover (the entire shower was very, very dated) .. but again, for staying overnight, it was PERFECT. i'm sure this hotel has the 'upper creme de la creme' lodgings, but for those who got a deal through the internet, you're more than likely going to get the 'lower end' of the deal .. and truly ... its PERFECT for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton”
Reviews.Author: scrabblequeen11
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for $55 from hotwire. I was SO glad it wasn't the Westin. I almost booked the Westin but then when I checked their reviews on TA I couldn't help but notice all the 5 star reviews were written with a specific employee mentioned and they were ALL by someone with one contribution. Hmmm very fishy. I hate it when people do that to try to fluff up their rating. Anyway...I was only in the hotel for about 10 hours total, so didn't really get a chance to look around much. Hubby told me the pool area was very nice. I thought the room and bathroom was very clean and comforable. Nice plush comforters and pillows. The only thing I didn't like about the room was the window was small and you could only see out if you look around the corner. It was weird...made me kind of claustrophobic! You should request a room with a view. But I had gotten the room for so cheap I didn't really care about the view. There is a Carl's right next door and we grabbed burgers for our room. Parking is $20 (which is about the same as all the lax hotels) I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a night's stay near LAX”
Reviews.Author: misslcp
Reviews.Content: After a 12 hour flight, and 2 hours in LAX waiting for luggage/customs, the last thing you want to do is wait in yet another line. But unfortunately when we arrived we had to wait around 30-40 minutes to check in (something that seems a common theme in reviews of these hotels). There were only 2 staff at check in and the quick check in tills were not working... It took forever. No appology when we finally got to the front desk. As this is probably a common occurence, you'd hope the hotel would put extra staff on their front desk, but no.. Anyways, apart from the wait - no other complaints. The room was clean and a good size. The bed was also really comfy. The hotel is also very close to the airport - and has a free shuttle service to and from. The pool was closed, which we weren't told about when we booked, but it looked really pokey and small so I don't think we missed out on much. I've also stayed at the Rennaissance hotel near LAX and if i was going back, I would choose the Rennaissance over the Hilton. The rooms are a little smaller but found the service much better and the beds were much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton LAX /Blackstone Has Personnel Issues - Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: SteakSnob
Reviews.Content: Simply put - this hotel property has all the amenities to make it a quality 3.5 star rating. What destroyed the experience was the check in process. I arrived at 9:30 PM on a Friday night and the line to check in went from the front desk almost out the front door in the lobby. If you have been to this Hilton, you know the length of the lobby is a good distance. The line was 1 hour long to check in. The automated check in kiosks kept bombing out and would not let me check in. The front desk was simply way understaffed and overworked. For the weary traveler, this just made the entire experience all the more unmemorable and left an incredibly bad impression. Due to the fact that the vast majority of the reservations are made in advanced and the hotel is aware of how many people need to check in on a given day, the Hilton LAX management should have been on top of this issue. While we are on the complaint wagon - a general warning. You do not want a room anywhere near the eleveators. I was the second room over and I heard the elevator cars running all night long. If you work in a mine shaft and enjoy the background noise, you may be ok. Otherwise insist on being in a room away from the eleveators. One other thing to note on this property - this is not a deal killer, but if you experience the aforementioned hassle, parking is not cheap. The parking garage is extremely tight and is $20 for self park and the garage clearance is only 5' 8". You may not use the airport parking rates as they impose a minimum stay and of course if you move your car, it voids the rate. Hilton and its private equity owner, Blackstone, need to realize the branding and service is all they have to win over the business and casual traveler. Due to the number of other properties around LAX - consider those before getting trapped in the mother of all check in lines at the Hilton LAX.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite stop at LAX”
Reviews.Author: Fitch7600
Reviews.Content: First, the standard disclaimer: as a Hilton Honors Diamond member, I probably get better treatment. But I can say that I have booked Hotwire in the past and ended up here and was also pleased. The hotel is big and the rooms are comfortable. The TV's are old, though I don't watch a lot of TV myself. Great public areas, and I really like the pool/hot tubs area. My room included the free continental breakfast in the 16th floor lounge and it's pretty good. The shuttle service to LAX is excellent. The food is pretty basic and has the typical hotel pricing. Tip: if you just want a salad or sandwich, walk to the office building next door. The little deli in the lobby is very good and a much better value. Another tip: ask for a room with an airport view. Very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a night”
Reviews.Author: susie6505
Reviews.Content: Flew into LAX late and stayed at the Hilton. The shuttle service to and from LAX is the best. The room was a double/double, which was perfect. We did not stay too long because we were meeting someone in Santa Ana, but I will definately stay at the Hilton again for a quick nite in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfactory!”
Reviews.Author: awigg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Hilton February 26 and again March 6. My daughter and I were en route to and returning from Hawaii. We appreciated the convenience of the shuttle. As for meals, there is a little cafe in the lobby that is open 24 hours. How we appreciated it on our return at 11 p.m.! The breakfast buffet was very good. Easy access to meals is important these days when airlines no longer serve meals. The staff was courteous and efficient. The hotel amenities and decor were excellent. We enjoyed our brief stays and will certainly book rooms there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “No safe in room means we won't be back”
Reviews.Author: pleasantpeninsula
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton LAX for one night on the outbound leg of an international flight. The hotel is very convenient to LAX and the free shuttle service was excellent. We got a good rate which included a very nice buffet breakfast. Check-in and Check-out were fast and efficient. The employees we dealt with were friendly and helpful. There were, however, some downsides: the bathroom was very small and cramped feeling. There was mold on the tile in the bathtub. The room had not been vacuumed--as evidenced by debris on the carpet. And, finally, there was no safe in the room. This meant that we had to keep such things as money and passports with us all of the time, which was inconvenient. Since there are many hotels in the LAX area, next time we will stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful hotel, but we had...”
Reviews.Author: surfserpent
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, but we had quite a few problems. We booked through the hotel and paid for a tower upgrade. When we got to our room, the walls were litterally shaking, and we realized that we were next to the elevator. We requested a room change and had to switch to a new room. That room was ok, but nothing special. The bathroom had what looked like blood on the walls and was overall dingy. At dinner, I requested a specific seating area, and the hostess rolled her eyes at me and refused. Dinner was expensive but ok. The real kicker came when I went to dry off after a shower. As I was drying my face, I noticed that there were large brown stains all over my towel, which turned out to be clumps of feces. I almost threw up, and when I called the desk, it took half an hour for housekeeping to show up, and they did not bring any additional towels. I asked to report the incident, and was told if I filled out the form then they could "find out who cleaned my room and deal with them." Obviously I wasn't looking to get anyone in trouble, so I did not fill out the form. I have posted pictures with my review. This is NOT a four star joint people.

Reviews.Title: “An airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: withkidstravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times. It is a big airport hotel with a free shuttle to LAX. Close to car rental places. The rooms are comfortable and typical Hilton/any other airport hotel. Soundproofing on the windows was very good. Clean, comfortable for a night's stay. At well over $200 that seems like a lot for literally 8 hours, but that's the way it goes these days.... if I had not had an early flight there would have been a free continental breakfast. Upgrading is a charge and not offered with elite status very much anymore... this seems a shame for frequent guests with a lightly booked hotel... free Internet though.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort for a layover”
Reviews.Author: galtons
Reviews.Content: We had an imposed layover in LA en route from Mexico to Seattle. We had pre-booked but the check-in was agonisingly slow - we had to wait more than 45 minutes. We also then lined up for 15 minutes to speak to the concierge who then couldn't answer our question. So our service experience was poor but the hotel and its rooms are of the high standard and comfort one would expect from a Hilton. A comfortable and quiet night's sleep with a smooth, short transfer to the airport the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “+ $13/day for WiFi + $20/day for parking + $2/phone call + + + + + ...”
Reviews.Author: workcation
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago I had a workcation that took me to Los Angeles for five nights. Two of those nights were spent in a mid-range Sheraton property. Free WiFi and 25 cent local calls. Not that I judge a hotel on those things alone. But the other place I stayed was considerably different. After shelling out $150+ per night, including $20 to park in what can be best described as a clusterfxck of an underground garage, I was a little pissed when I realized there was no free internet access anywhere in the hotel. I was told I could pay $12.95 per day to check my e-mail and Facebook via my own computer that I'd schlepped over 4000 kms for this specific purpose. In the year 2010. What.the.fxck. I don't mind paying a little extra for a connection to the interwebs. I do mind being gouged. I grabbed a snapshot of the card in the room labelled "Telephone Dialing Information and Rates" for this establishment. $2 for a local phone call. $2 for a toll-free line. $2 to use my own calling card! Plus, if the conversation dragged on for over an hour, I'd be billed another 10 cents per minute. The bottom third of the card covers the direction of complaints. I can imagine they've had quite a few @HiltonLAX. Surprisingly, 911 calls are on the house, theoretically passing up a great opportunity to squeeze some extra pennies out of you while you're already bleeding. By the way, the Hilton LAX is around the corner from the Four Points by Sheraton LAX. They even share an airport shuttle. Stay on until the second stop. It's cleaner and half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Airport location”
Reviews.Author: nikki721
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great hotel if you need to stay close to the airport. Very clean and close to the airport. The airport shuttle is 24 hours so no matter what time you fly in or need to leave for the airport you can get a shuttle. Most I had to wait was 15 minutes. Only bad thing is you need to pay for the internet in your room. I think it was $12.95. The check-in process in fast

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: frida10
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about the noise being conveniently close to the airport but it was not an issue. Check in was easy and front desk was very friendly and helpful. The bed was extremely comfortable with feather down comforters. Room and bathroom was very nice and clean. Although, the tv didn't match the room it needed to be updated to a LCD. Over all, we had a nice stay except for paying $20 for parking and my partner and I were awakened @ 9am by the housekeeper who barged in the room right after she knocked. She might as well not even knock if she's going to open the door right away and not even give us a chance to answer the door!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: PTDperro
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at LAX airport is OK but nothing out of the ordinary. The bed at my room was OK and it had pretty comfortable feather pillows, but I guess if you are alergic this can be an issue. My room was really clean, but the size was quite small. All the staff was very attentive. Shutttle to LAX airport it's a plus. Food at the restaurant is decent, but in my point of view quite over price.

Reviews.Title: “This used to be a great hotel - but...”
Reviews.Author: cr8it
Reviews.Content: it has really gone downhill and takes advantage of travelers with extremely high prices. I used to always stay here. I have not traveled to LA in a few years, and stayed here on an overnight before a flight. The rooms have not been modernized (with the exception of the beds. I was on the club floor, and at the bar there I heard someone order a gin and tonic -- and it was $11.00 - usually hotel club floors don't gouge their clients. I have to believe there are better hotels around here.

Reviews.Title: “"At your Service!"”
Reviews.Author: ceedaworld
Reviews.Content: This is there motto and for the most part they are. Pros: Super location, clean rooms. reasonable rates, whacko LA clientele, comfy beds, good food at breakfast, warm heated pool, good amenities, Gus the concierge was helpful. Cons; Slow 10pm shuttle. passed us twice full of people. Grumpy tip hungry guys on the evening shuttle. Old bathrooms, clean. smoker near the pool. late pool opening hours, dark gym. If you need an overnight stay this is more than enough. You will hear the planes, it is next to LAX. Be ready for LA people as the clients are everything and more. Service was good. Great tip, avoid the king studio rooms. bad location and low floors.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of staying here...my diamond necklace was stolen from room.”
Reviews.Author: Jannamarie1020
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I were running late to catch our morning flight out of LAX when I realized on the shuttle bus over to the airport, that I had forgotten my diamond necklace on the sink counter in the my hotel room's bathroom. If I had stayed on the shuttle to turn around and get it, I would have missed my flight. So thinking the Hilton is known as being a nice, respectable establishment, I called the front desk to tell them of my problem, so they could go up to the room and retrieve my necklace and mail it to my home address. Well, I was shocked to here the person on the other end of the phone tell me my necklace was not where I had left it. I had been gone from the hotel not even 10 minutes. I knew exactly where I left it, yet they "couldn't seem to find it". Needless to say, my diamond necklace was never mailed to me. While trying to work this dilemma out, I was "disconnected" from the gentlemen I was speaking with not once but twice. They wouldn't put me on the phone with the hotel manager because "it wasn't an issue managers deal with!!???" I was then told an investigation would be opened. The next day I was then told the investigation was already closed, and that my diamond necklace is not their responsiblity. I was treated terribly by the staff. It was as if my situation was a joke to them. Even the corprate office said there was nothing they could do. I suggest everyone stays next door at the Marriot. Don't stay here. You can't trust the staff and they will treat you with disrespect!!!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of noise from the building itself”
Reviews.Author: hankpop
Reviews.Content: Being next to LAX, you'd think that noise would come from planes taking off and landing. I was on the top floor of this hotel and my room was very noisy. It seemed like it was sleeping next to the boiler room, which doesn't make any sense. The noise did prevent me from getting a good night's sleep. My other complaint is that the front desk took forever to pick up the phone when I called... I must have let it ring 30 times. And this happened more than once. Aside from that, the room was clean and the bed itself was big and comfortable. And it is really easy to get to the airport in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved My King Size Bed!”
Reviews.Author: travellingdeane
Reviews.Content: Only staying in LA for the night before flighing out the next day, I decided on the Hilton. Once taking the free shuttle bus from the airport I was checked in quickly and given my room key. I booked with Hotelclub and got a fantastic price of £28 for the night, so I wasn't expecting I would be given a great room...however I was soo wrong!The room so so spacious nice, I had a king size bed all to myself, a two window view, and Crabtree and Evelyn products in the bathroom! Being so close to the airport I thought I might hear plane noise...but heard none at all. Not much around, theres a Carls Jnr, Taco Bell and Pizza Hut just along the road but the area isn't great really, but I don't think Hollywood inparticular is a great area so it just felt the same. Overall I was very impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Louder72
Reviews.Content: When you need a room for the night near LAX, this is a great choice. The hotel has a bar, several restaurants / bistros, and gift shop. Online check-in for the next morning's flight was simple using the kiosks provided in the lobby. The lobby, btw, is very attractive. The rooms are standard Hilton hotel rooms. Sleep quality was excellent - the bed was very comfortable, and the surroundings were quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a room for the night close to the airport. If you are visiting Los Angeles for tourism, this hotel (although it is very nice) is not near any tourist attractions, so I would only stay here the final night of your trip, so you don't have to fight the notorious Los Angeles traffic on the morning of your flight out of LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Watch for food price gouging”
Reviews.Author: freebird121
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel from Jan 29 to Jan 31 and i have to say, the price they want for their foods, i could feed a small family for. Just a small example. One Single hot dog and bun $6.00 i could buy 3 packs ar the grocery store and have change left over for that price. One 12 oz can of coke $4.00 from restaurant $3.00 from vending machine, i could buy a 6 pack for that price. Roast beef sandwich and a pickle, not even chips or fries, $8.95. You can buy your own lunchmeat and cheese and bread for 1/2 the cost. Personal Pan Pizza and a soda $14.00. Pizza by itself $9.00. A large pizza and toppings is less from Dominos. I can go on and on about the prices but you get the idea, the hotel is fantastic to stay, the staff couldn't be more friendly and the rooms were clean but do ypurself a favor and walk 2 blocks and go to either Carl Jrs or Dennys,. It's a lot cheaper and you get more for your money. Also there's a Sunoco station right there you can get all your drinks and snacks and not spend a small fortune. Also mysteriously a sign appeared after the 1st day in the lobby, no outside food or drinks allowed, hmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm i wonder why?

Reviews.Title: “More than Happy”
Reviews.Author: scareyCornwall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 1 night as part of a pre-cruise package. Flew into LAX and got the shuttle here with little effort. Excellent check in, friendly staff, big reception area. Large room, nicely decorated, spotlessly clean, huge comfortable bed. Had bottle of wine pre-dinner in room and found it all very comfortable. Bathroom very small though (came here from a budget hotel in Las Vegas where the bathroom was HUGE!), plenty of hot water, toiletries, great towels, etc. Filter coffee machine in room which was very good, requested more coffee and housekeeper brought us loads! Very nice dinner at $24 each. Beautiful spacious seating areas to relax, where you can get drinks, snacks, etc. I woke the next morning to the most amazing sunrise, stunning view, and although close to airport we heard no noise at all. Great buffet breakfast at $21.95, very busy but we had a fab waitress. Some staff not so good though. We returned here for post cruise package, where we were looked after for the day. Coffee waiting for us, excellent lunch laid on and a few hours relaxing in the comfortable surroundings. We didn't use any of the other hotel facilities, but would definately recommend and stay here again if ever in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient hotel; clean guest rooms and nice hotel gym and facilities”
Reviews.Author: streamvista
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here on our last day in L.A. because it is VERY close to the LAX airport and would make it easier to fly out the next morning. We were very pleased with our decision. The hotel itself is modern and is nicely decorated with a variety of paintings and art. Also, it has a full service gift shop, restaurants, a full gym with treadmills, elliptical machines, weights, etc. Most importantly, our room was very quiet, did not let outside light in, and the bed was comfortable. Also, it had a nice flat screen TV. The bathroom was clean and had the basic amenities one would expect. The only downside to the room is that it seemed slightly smaller than others I've stayed in. For instance, since there was not an abundance of open floor space, there was little room to spread out a suitcase. This might be an issue for people traveling with kids (i.e. that need a place for a crib) or those with lots of luggage. So, it might be a good idea to verify with the hotel for those situations. We had to pay for parking ($20/nt) and that is a bit of a negative! It would be nice to be offered a more discounted rate. But, if you don't have a car, this hotel does offer an airport shuttle. We were offered the option of pre-paying for their breakfast buffet at $15 (inclusive of tax). Apparently, by pre-paying we saved over the regular price. Overall, we liked the breakfast. The servers, however, were not attentive and I'd rate their overall restaurant customer service as poor. My wife and I used the gym (located on the lower level). It was well-appointed and up to standard for this type of hotel. Overall: Recommended

Reviews.Title: “not up to hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a big disappointment for a Hilton hotel. When we checked in, we were given a key to a room that had not been made up -- beds not made, towels on the floor. There was no apology. The other room we got was average at best. The hallway didn't smell clean. The shower took a lot of jostling to get it started, and it had a weak stream. The bathroom was also kind of dark. The room needed updating. It would've been a nice room for a Days Inn or a Red Roof Inn, not for a Hilton. And there was no free WIFI. The free breakfast buffet was pretty good, however, and we had incredible service there. Anyway, we just needed a place to crash, and it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the beds at Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: Pula
Reviews.Content: We used the airport shuttle bus to get to the hotel. We were wowed at first by just getting to the lobby. An open space with a lot of gold tones, thick carpet and nice furniture. The room was also spacious. Beds were huge and so comfortable. We had the best sleep ever. I loved the breakfast area. Service was very nice. There was a meal for everyone. The food was nutritionally marked. They had low fat food, whole wheat bread, a wide variety of healthy food. We had a nice stay there and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast rip-off - tricky parking”
Reviews.Author: philo88
Reviews.Content: At rates of well under $100, this is good value - the rooms are decent and the service efficient if you need to be by the airport. Two major caveats - I booked with hotels.com and the price - $75 - included brekafast buffet. When I had eaten, the watiress refused to accept this and tried to charge $20 - a lot for an average breakfast. I sent her to reception who reiterated that breakfast wasn't included. I went to reception and was told that Hilton never sold inclusive deals. I then accessed my reservation on her computer whihc clearly stated that the buffet was included. She still refused to accept this and I asked for a manager who in fairness apologised and credited the breakfast. She also said that brekafast was never sold included, but if you check hotels.com, the same offer is there. Parking: Hilton prioritise trying to get extra revenue for airport parkers, so guests are relegated to a long drive underground for their parking - it is very inconvenient, hard to find places and get in and out and they charge guest around $10 extra.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: mrose1983
Reviews.Content: stayed here the night before the Rosebowl. The staff was very helpful and kind. Would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “great choice!”
Reviews.Author: NorthB
Reviews.Content: Large room and comfortable bed. Lots of elevators to accommodate all the guests. Easy shuttle to/from airport. Wonderful concierge! If there'd been a hot tub, it would've been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Made a great choice. Easy Access to LAX.”
Reviews.Author: mannym99
Reviews.Content: Came to LA for a few days and decided on the Hilton LAX solely based on proximity to the airport. It was a good decision. First off, the shuttle to and from the airport is free, runs 24 hours, takes all of 5-10 minutes and was an absolute breeze. It's also located close to most of the car rental spots, so renting and returning a car was easy (hotel self-parking is $18/day). All the staff I encountered were friendly and attentive, and a couple service requests were taken care of seemlessly. There is a fitness center and it's free, although I didn't use it. Also, I didn't eat at any of the restaurants. The rooms (at about $110/nt) were clean and of good enough size, even if a tad bit dated. For my purposes it was perfect. I wasn't in LA to hang out in the hotel, and the city is not for walking so to me, since I was driving, it didn't matter where I was staying. The 405 freeway is right down the street, so getting around was pretty easy (notwithstanding the LA traffic). The only potential downside to me is that if your room is facing the airport (and mine was) you will hear some noise from airplanes taking off, but it didn't wake me up so I didn't consider it a big deal but I am a fairly heavy sleeper. On the whole, LA is a monster, so the ease of access to LAX made the airport location really ideal. And the value for the money was really good. Just stay here and drive to and from everywhere you want to go. And when it's time to leave, that'll be a breeze. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: emdavis
Reviews.Content: Great spot to stay, close to the airport. Sizeable rooms, nothing to fault! Shuttle service is great. We stayed here prior to our international flight home the next morning. Our flight was then cancelled by the airline and they subsequently put us up at the hilton for another night - alongside the other 400 passengers. The hilton staff were great with the whole situation and provided everything we needed - toothbrushes etc (given that we had no access to our luggage) and all handled it fantastically, and went out of their way to ensure we were as happy as possible, given the situation. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel For Departing LAX”
Reviews.Author: elgringito
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the night of 2 January prior to a 5:35 am flight using HHonors point. A very good value at 25,000 points. We got a corner room on the 15th floor and it was very large and nicely appointed. The sports bar served Sierra Nevada pale ale on tap and the appetizer was nice - it was a bit pricey. The lobby was expansive and the overall "feel" was more like a large Las Vegas mega hotel - not a complaint but an observation. The Hertz counter is a real convenience. Would not stay so close to the airport for other than business or the proximity to LAX, however.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel to relax after long flight”
Reviews.Author: malbecblue
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly fine for a short stay if flying to or from LAX- but not for a longer stay. The hotel is near the airport with a free shuttle bus. There are also buses to get out and explore some of the northern beaches for a couple of hours. What I didn't like was staff arguing with each other in the cafe in front of customers (take it elsewhere guys) and having flown from the UK, could really have done without the drilling next door in the morning. Oh and we loved the "garden" (a paved area with only a few seats, which probably never gets any direct sunlight...) Also have to mention that the most helpful person at the hotel was the chap behind the Hertz counter - very friendly and very helpful for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for a LAX airport hotel-- great hotel and at a fair price!”
Reviews.Author: GOPBI
Reviews.Content: This is a 23 December, 2009 update to my original review of 20 July, 2009. I’ve stayed here many, many times in the past as this is my airlines’ designated “crew” hotel at LAX for short stays- and this stay was yet another one-night LAX layover. I really like this hotel. For starters the lobby is large and expansive and inviting... Not a typical hotel-lobby... Even the driveway leading to the front doors are grand-- and very large and quite busy... The main lobby is tastefully done in light taupe colors; very relaxing and cool in feeling; a nice change from the heat and humidity of the LA basin... Check-in was swift as always—as an airline employee our rooms are pre-paid and pre-assigned, and check-in is always hassle-free. My room was fitted with a standard sized king bed—complete with down-filled comforter, cover sheets and bolster pillows. The color palette is similar to that of the lobby—natural light woods, light taupe and shades brown.. Most all rooms are also fitted for those who need to do a little business as well.. There is a full sized business desk, complete with multiple electrical outlets and good lighting. The TV was a remote flat screen with full range of domestic and selected foreign language programming. A small sitting chair and coffee table, as well as a personal sized coffee maker with complimentary supplies were a nice touch... The half-sized closet allowed me to hang some clothes and there was mini ironing board and iron inside. The bathroom was equipped with a standard tub/shower combination. Water runs hot with excellent water pressure. They stock a good range of complimentary pre and post-bath toiletries, along with a full sized anti-fog make-up mirror with an attached wall mounted hair dryer. My specific room was one floor above, and facing the outdoor swimming pool... Despite this location, you could not hear *anything*—pool noise OR overhead low-flying aircraft, thru the double-thick glazed and tinted glass... One nice feature that I really liked was the floor length “blackout” drapes, that when closed render the room near pitch dark regardless of outside light conditions—nice for people like me who have to catch a nap during the daytime. The hotel has three restaurants on property; a 24/7 bistro that serves small snack—both hot and cold-- as well as a range of beverages.. There is also a traditional coffee shop-like venue and a more formal sit-down restaurant that serves primarily Italian fare. The hotel has a mini-exercise room, filled with workout machines, all in one windowless room… Good for a workout? Yes, but makes me a bit claustrophobic without a view outside… I do like the large outdoor pool which has several small 2-person tables where you can enjoy a poolside meal, snack or beverage.. Even the rooms just adjacent to the pool get very little, if any, discernible pool noise.. The sound insulation *is* that good! Since I don’t have access to a car while here, I normally walk along West Century Blvd. to one of the local restaurants along this busy street. For a wider selection I can also very easily take a short taxi ride to any of the close-by shopping centers if I want something different or specific. LA really is a heaven for “foodies”.. Overall, I really like this hotel.. Everyone on their staff treats their guests well and knows what a “road warrior” needs and expects from an airport hotel... You’ll get a reliably clean room with a good bed and furnishings- everything functioning properly; nice in-house amenities and guest services.. While I would like to see a better selection of on-property dining options, the hotels’ location makes walking (or a short taxi ride) to many area restaurants quite easy... I give this hotel very favorable rating and would recommend them without hesitation. ** PROS: This location knows what it takes to be an airport hotel and is constructed with that in mind. Excellent sound and light insulation make getting some decent rest very possible. Staff are always polite, willing to help and generally cheerful. ** CONS: Since it’s close to the airport, there aren’t as many options for casual dining or shopping that are within true walking distance. Not a very large selection of on-premises dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel-and-dimed”
Reviews.Author: Baggins42
Reviews.Content: The service was fine, but the hotel itself fell way below my expectations from such a respectable establishment as Hilton. They were nickel-and-diming me all the way. 1. The carpet in the corridor is not very clean and it smelled weird there. The pool area was no better - actually, much worse. I wouldn't recommend going barefoot anywhere in that area. It's just dirty. 2. The coffee maker in the room was broken - it made 1/8 cup of coffee and then turned off. So if you want a full cup, you have to ask it 8 times. Of course, by then the cup is almost all cold. Good luck making tea with it, if you don't like ice tea. 3. Once we have used the provided tea packs, room service didn't bother to replace them. Probably saved them a cent or so. 4. There's no free internet access in the business center and no free printing. I am staying in various hotels a lot and wasn't used before to being charged dollar-a-minute for printing a simple page of driving directions. I was used to getting it for free, as it was in most hotels of this class I visited. Hilton, however, decided to save yet another 1/10 of a cent. 5. Most hotels provide some sort of paper for the guests to write on. Hilton has post-it notes. Literally - tiny squares of paper, and that's it. If you want to write down something that's not 3 words - good luck, Hilton is not going to help, go find an Office Depot and buy it yourself. Here, another cent saved for Hilton. 6. Parking pricing is outrageous - I've parked cheaper in San-Francisco downtown, no discounts or anything for hotel guests - but don't expect that to mean easy and convenient parking. Parking lot is crammed, and spending 10 minutes looking for a random place somebody didn't notice, or trying to fit your car into the space that nobody dared to use because it's too small - is routine. All while a bunch of spaces stay empty - but general public is not allowed there, probably so that they can charge you 150% for valet parking in the same spot, in addition to the outrageous price paid for the parking - which a lot of hotels of this class provide for free. In Hilton, I not only got charged for it - I got charged twice in one of the days. They can't even make their system work properly. Summarily, the personnel of the hotel was very nice, welcoming and pleasant. They did what they could. However, the hotel itself fell below the expectations - I paid more than I expected to pay for less than I expected to get from Hilton. I understand the economy is tough and everybody has to save, but saving on a couple of sheets of paper and a couple of tea bags is too much for me. When I go to a brand-name hotel like Hilton I don't expect that. After this stay I would think twice - no, a dozen times - before ever staying at a Hilton establishment again. Hope the savings were worth it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT COMFORTABLE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sedona2003
Reviews.Content: I was at Hilton LAX for a week due to business. Great staff and very comfortable room. The room was spotless every night when I got back.

Reviews.Title: “I have no complaints, only compliments”
Reviews.Author: Joandio
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the Hilton.com site under packages, and the price was only $55 tax inclusive for 7 nights stay. Other reviews here focus on the carpet. The corridor carpets on the 6th floor were worn down, but not awful. The hall carpets, did however, smell like incense - but after a week in L.A., that smell is everywhere, along with the weed. Just down the street in the Motel 6 for $59 a night, so it was no problem at all tolerating the carpet. Wasn't like I was going to walk barefoot on it, anyway. I had room 6010 on a corner. I didn't have a view but the room was spacious and so was the bath. It was cleaned immaculately every day and the beds and linens were great - and the carpet was new in the room. The hotel staff was always courteous and helpful, and the restaurant, the bar, and the bistro all had good food. Self parking underneath was tight over Thanksgiving, but I could always find a space. Finally, the area is very convenient to Culver City, Downtown LA, Hollywood, and Manhattan Beach. Due to the price, the hospitality and room comfort, I rate this a 5 Owls experience :)

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay due to flight cancellation”
Reviews.Author: emdoc
Reviews.Content: I was given a free voucher from Alaska Airline due to a flight cancellation. Since it was the last flight out of LAX I was given the room and put on the next morning's flight. There was a free hotel shuttle that runs about every 20 minutes with a stop at the nearby Hilton Garden Inn as well. The check-in was quick and efficient with a sympathetic front desk staff. The room was spacious but the bathroom was a bit small in comparison to the size of the room. Everything was clean and well-maintained. The bed was very comfortable. Even though the hotel was close to the airport, the room was quiet. I managed to walk around the hotel a bit before going to sleep. There was a large exercise room with a separate aerobics room. Plenty of equipment to choose from. No one was there but it was late at night. There was a business center with pay-to-use computer terminals. There were multiple ballrooms and several places for food. The lobby was open, spacious, and nicely decorated. I caught the shuttle to LAX the next morning so my experience with the hotel was fairly limited. Overall, it was very nice and I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “just what a hilton should be”
Reviews.Author: ladette74
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights at the hilton as a last minute booking. really nice plush hotel, very close to the airport, nice crowd. just nice ambience. they offer free shuttle every 20 mins 24 hours a day to the airport. nice big rooms, very comfortable bed

Reviews.Title: “An older and acceptable Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Leadbelly98
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is located very close to the LAX airport and it has a beautiful lobby. However, the rooms have not been updated in a long time. While they are kept clean, the hotel room does not convey a comfortable feeling. The fitness center is fairly large and the lobby bistro & bar offer good alternatives to the expensive restaurant on site. This is an OK business hotel but it will not provide a Wow experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own bathroom spray”
Reviews.Author: aleon88
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but the hallway carpet was dirty. I loved thier cozy bed. Very elegant enterance. Parking is hard to find on the the fourth floor. first 3 floors are for valet. Parking is pricy 18 a day, but you can go in and out all you want. The only downfall was that the room they gave us didn't have a fan in the restroom. I like taking hot showers and turned the bathroom into a steam room everytime. the toilet got clogged, but an engineer came up to the room asap. it was okay after that. I was assigned this hotel through priceline's name your own price.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: onewheel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in Oct09 after an overnight flight, arriving in LA in the afternoon. The eception staff could see we had young children so they allocated us a room by the pool, which was perfect for the kids to unwind and have a swim. We had a nice meal at the buffet even though it is rather pricey but convienant as we were tired from our overnight flight. The beds were extremly comfortable and the room nicely decorated. Due to jet lag we woke at 3am and headed to the 24 hour cafe for a snack before settling down to sleep again. We did not hear any flight noise at all and we all had a good sleep in, as the dark curtains kept out the daylight. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and close to airport”
Reviews.Author: UtahEnjoytraveling
Reviews.Content: My son and I ended up having an overnight layover in L.A. We booked a room at the Hilton and it was a great choice! The airport shuttle picked us up. We enjoyed the swimming pool and the in-room dining. It was a quiet place that was very comfortable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “good for a short layover”
Reviews.Author: poidog7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a little less than 12 hours. Shuttle bus runs every 20 minutes to and from the airport, and I got one after waiting about 10 minutes. Arrived at the hotel about 8PM. Long line to register, so took the shorter Hilton Honors line. Room was nicely furnished with great bed. Only minor complaints-- the bathroom was quite small and there was a beat up looking refrigerator in the room (I pulled the power plug since it was noisy). Got a good price for a government rate online ($110/night), and so for a short layover this was an excellent place for location, price, and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great for lay overs”
Reviews.Author: charliegirl_b
Reviews.Content: We didnt actually spend the night at this hotel - we checked in at 3pm and checked out at 10pm. We had flown in the previous night and spent the night at the Sheraton and then moved to the Hilton for a couple of hours before our late night flight home. It was perfect for what we wanted - clean comfortable rooms to relax in, clean bathroom and a nice meal in the bistro. It is looking a little bit tired - especially some of the carpets in the hallways but it certainly wasnt tatty looking. Our room had 2 double beds - it looked as if it was a shared room as we could hear the people next door through the internal door. The bathroom was a little on the small size but it did the job. There is the ocean shuttle bus that leaves from just outside the hotel and for $3 you get a return ticket. The shuttle stops at 2 different shopping centres and the beach. The service staff at this hotel were friendly and efficient and considering we got the hotel for a great deal on Priceline it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The "Travellers" choice - no doubt about it !”
Reviews.Author: hitthebutton
Reviews.Content: We have used this Hotel on many occasions.We always experience excellent service,beginning with the very warm welcome at the front desk. The rooms are clean,spacious and, bearing in mind it's closeness to LAX, quiet. The restaurants and Bistro cater for all tastes with a good variety of foods. There is an excellent, and regular, shuttle service to and from the airport. The ideal place to stay for any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Comfortable Room, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Shebb
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for one night before catching a morning flight at LAX, after we landed from Sydney, Australia. The service was the best we had at any of our hotel stays whilst in the USA, so that was a plus! We were greeted by a friendly gentleman at check-in, and although he and my husband had to repeat themselves a few times due to not understanding each other's accents, it was always smiles and kind words. :) Our room was perfect for an overnight stay. We were upgraded to a Tower guestroom, which worked out brilliantly as we used the Towers Lounge for a complimentary continental breakfast at our discretion before checking out and heading back to LAX. The room was nicely furnished with the usual decor - king bed, bedside tables, lamps, desk & leather desk chair, small chair & coffee table, chest of drawers with a TV. It also had a great full length mirror on the cloak cupboard door, and also a magnifying mirror in the bathroom - great for the ladies and makeup application/removal! I recommend staying there, especially with its proximity to the airport, and complimentary airport transfers.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fading Hilton”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaMim
Reviews.Content: It must be a huge capital project to keep the Hilton chain up to date. They vary from great to terrible. This one is "middle of road" and looking a bit worn after the tread of countless travellers. It is still though probably the best on the strip, but that does not say much for its competition, of which I have tried 4 or 5, but keep coming back to this Hilton. For an airport hotel it is reasonably quiet, being well designed. In spite of a Hilton Platinum level, I have never had an upgrade at this hotel. in maybe 20 stays. Food in the restaurant is stodgy and expensive so I stick to the bar and bistro, where the offerings are expensive but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Able to relax at the Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: Aikster
Reviews.Content: Monster-sized airport accommodation with great sound proofing considering the proximity tot he airport. Large room but a proportionately small bathroom. The hotel did the trick for a few nights on arrival into the States - giving us chance to acclimatise and get over jet lag. It's not an ideal location for the main tourist attractions of the area but the shuttle bus to Manhattan Beach is a great value service!

Reviews.Title: “marvelous week at the Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: eibbedhsawpmek
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton devotee, yet I didn't know what to expect from an "airport" hotel. I was very surprised when I pulled up in front of the Hilton LAX. The front desk staff was extremely accommodating ... my flight arrived fairly early in the day (9 am). I asked the staff if there was any way I could check in early and they obliged my request. I was very impressed with the service, the cleanliness and the attention to detail. I can't comment on the restaurant(s) because I never dined in the hotel ... I was on vacation and spent most of my days and evenings close to the beach. I would definitely stay at the Hilton LAX again!

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the "extra" charges!!!”
Reviews.Author: LightworkerinPHX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Airport Hilton for two nights (09/12/09 - 09/13/09). Hotel and rooms were clean. The main reason we decided on this hotel was the special rate that included breakfast for the room guests. The reservations were made via phone through Hilton. We had two rooms with three people in each room. The special included a voucher for the "buffet" breakfast each morning. As it turns out, the "special" only includes breakfast for two people, and not three. We were never told this when we made the reservations, yet we clearly told them we had three people in the room. The buffer runs $21.95 per person and is not worth half that amount. The so called "buffet" is a glorified continental breakfast. When we made a comment to the desk clerk we were told "Reservations is a different department." We also had a waitress attempt to charge us $20 in tip for a party of six at the same buffet. Luckily a register operator asked us if we were "ok" with the tip. We told her we had been told that it was included for parties of six or more. As it turns out, the tip was optional. I was a fan of Hilton before this incident. I will definitely be taking my business elsewhere from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Don't tick off the Valet”
Reviews.Author: silver33
Reviews.Content: If you stay at the Hilton LAX, be careful not to give the wrong vehicle ticket number to the valet. I believe his name is Roberto...he is a yeller and screamer. He scared the heck out of me when I called down from our room to get our vehicle out of valet...I mistakenly gave him the bag check number, and he just started yelling and hollaring at me. Husband talked to the night manager about it, and not 15 minutes later when we were getting the vehicle, the guy went ballistic and began to hollar at him. We both walked away. Then, we drove away - real fast! My husband likes to stay at the Hilton a lot, but I think in the future I'll let him do that and I'll stay at the Marriott. You would think in these economic times that management of hotels would try hard to keep their employees from going postal. It's difficult enough to keep a business going without having nutso employees. And, there are so many choices out there - a soft bed is always around the corner, thank goodness. The Hilton LAX gets a huge black mark in my book for this type of "out there" behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: LondonVossy
Reviews.Content: You can get a free shuttle from the airport which was very handy. The room was ok, we only stayed one night. The hotel is close if you are picking up or dropping off a hire car. Great buffet breakfast it is around $20 each and you can eat as much as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service sets them apart”
Reviews.Author: ashramm
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was not able to stay at the Hilton LA Airport due to a last minute cancellation, but nevertheless i had a pleasent experience. I had booked my room through an airline that operates out of Chicago. I had called them to cancel the room but had asked several times if there was going to be a cancellation fee. The operator expediently cancelled my reservation and told me that I had been billed $273 for my stay that I wasn't going to. After several days of getting the run around I was contacted by a very helpful person that was the Director of operations at the hotel. She was very pleasent, extremely helpful, and without hesitation confirmed my cancelled rooms, did this at no charge, sent an email that I could forward to the airline to get my credit. I the world of hotels that are all pretty much the same, the one thing that sets them apart is the service. This hotel has a great role model to follow. They were extremely helpful and pleasent to deal with, a step or two above the rest. I hope to stay at the hotel n th near future, and i will make a point of saying thanks to the person that helped me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Factory”
Reviews.Author: negalloc
Reviews.Content: This is a megahotel close to the airport. Overall, nice, clean, simple. Paid about $60 per night via priceline, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob2003
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a one-night layover. We hit the jackpot with an outstanding room and watched the take-off and landing of many aircraft. Excellent check-in service and met all of our requests. We booked through Hilton and not a discounter, and we're glad we did. Food was pricey and room service was efficient, yet boring food. We would stay there again with no qualms about service or problems with a room. You really do get what you pay for! (PS--Our room was quiet or I would have left!)

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service-Beware”
Reviews.Author: prada777
Reviews.Content: Was given a room next to elevator shaft and linen room-had booked on discount booking service. Elevators up and down all night only to be followed by the housekeepers carts at 7am! When I called to ask about the constant noise the desk clerk stated "of course-that room is next to the elevator shaft"....why do they even use thes rooms unless the hotel is fully booked andd/or they tell you that you will be up all night listening to the elevator. Beware of this hotel if you use an online booking service-you will be guaranteed a substandard room.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: trisha009
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times while on business its always a pleasure although make sure you ask for a non smoking room if you dont smoke other that ive never had any problems

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but a little expensive.”
Reviews.Author: damatam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night while traveling through California. It was the nicest hotel room that we stayed in for our entire trip. We had a double since we(my husband and I) were traveling with our daughter and niece. The room was very clean and comfortable. It was the most expensive hotel that we stayed at - $130 for one night - but you get what you pay for. My only complaint is that we had to pay to park and it was $18 for one night. Other than that, we had a good experience with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Day room”
Reviews.Author: tess21
Reviews.Content: Great for a long break between flights, day room at a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ki855montreal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a couple of hours on a stopover, we paid the day rate which was very reasonable. The free shuttle from the airport was fast and convenient both when we arrived and when we left. We made the most of our time in LA and took a 4 1/2 hour tour, it was the best thing we could have done. The concierge was very helpful. Having the room allowed us to leave our luggage there and not worry about it and shower before our next flight. The room was bigger than what I expected, it was renovated and the bed was great. The only thing that could have been improved was the bathroom, the bathtub looked a little old but still good. The hotel was very nice, the staff at the front desk was very nice and helpful, they let us check out an hour later than usual. If we are ever in LA again we will stay here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Only stay there if you have to.”
Reviews.Author: bigange23
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't want to stay here out of choice. Is a decent drive away from most of the action and I have only stayed here due to flight delays etc when an airline has put me up. The hotel has a nice lobby but when you head to the rooms you will be disappointed. The interiors are badly in need of renovations with the hotel looking really dated at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Treated me like a king”
Reviews.Author: fredtaylor4
Reviews.Content: The Hilton LAX does an outstanding job taking care of its patrons. I stay there 1x/month, and I have found the accomodations and staff to be outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotwire Value”
Reviews.Author: lindengroves
Reviews.Content: The desk clerk noted I had reserved the room through Hotwire so I was a little concerned I would get a below average room. I was surprised to get a very large corner room with windows on two sides. The curtains fully covered the windows and had a valance that totally blocked out the light. Everything worked fine. The mattress was wonderful. Airport noise was minimal. I used no amenities the hotel offered so can't comment on those. The only negatives I can come up with was that the bathroom was fairly dark and the small cube refrigerator rested on the floor and not a cabinet. The hotel shuttle takes longer to get to and from the airport than I would have thought so factor that in to your plans. That's pretty minor stuff. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent and swift service”
Reviews.Author: kasskop
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with husband as part of a business trip. Fast and courteous check-in. Expedient room-service. Convenient parking

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: dpyo10
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel after my wedding because it is close to LAX. We had to leave early the next morning for our honeymoon. I had such a great experience, I referred my younger brother to stay at this hotel after their wedding this past weekend. If there was one word I can use to describe this hotel it would be "classy".

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a really big impersonal hotel this is it”
Reviews.Author: Stevied888
Reviews.Content: They give good rates buit make up for it by nice; diming you things like $2 for a toll free call and #12 for an hours parking. That was with the first 30 mins free. What a deal! I was shocked the bellman will only help customers who use valet parking. Anyone else doesn;t matter apparently. It is a nice room average within Hilton style and decor but there so many other options at LAX yyou should shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SparklingM
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay. Beds were the most comfortable I remember sleeping in! And you could not hear the planes. Fridge situation was a little strange, but at least there was one.

Reviews.Title: “always good value”
Reviews.Author: bwsSydney
Reviews.Content: This is a Hilton of good value and location. Our last stay related to family business was actually 2005, but we have been staying at the LAX Hilton in transit, over a number of years since 1980! We've seen many transformations and improvements, mostly related to facilities and customer service. If you are a frequent guest of the Hilton chain and not already a member, join HiltonHonors for rewards and more often than not, upgrades! When you visit the SportsBar, even though they no longer advertise them, ask for the Buffalo Wings-superb!! Cheers, Bruce and Margaret Spryer, Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: lil_star04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 night when our flight was delayed. Although we did not pay for the room, the Hotel itself is very pretty. However, one of the restaurants was very expensive and not at all worth the $70 we ended up paying. The rooms were very comfortable and roomy but the walls were very thin and we could hear people talking and walking outside our rooms which meant we did not sleep very well. In the morning, we could hear the cleaning staff moving around and it was very noisy. You have to pay for internet which I found strange as even the budget hotels I have stayed at have never charged for wifi. The free shuttles come every 15 minutes and the driver was very helpful with our bags.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect option for early morning flights”
Reviews.Author: tarheelblue89
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Hilton Los Angeles Airport. My experiences have been consistent. Friendly front desk staff with easy, fast check-in. Large , clean rooms. Being only few minutes from LAX and offering the free airport shuttles every 15 minutes makes it the perfect option for an early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “It's airport close”
Reviews.Author: LindySez
Reviews.Content: This is an older Hilton, been around for a while, and it shows. But not overly so, just so. The girl at the counter gave us a nice big corner room - some spread out room. It overlooked a parking lot, but I wasn't planning on spending a lot of time staring out the window anyway, so no big deal. I did notice that while they had the "corporate" designed stupid oval trash cans in the room, they also had a couple of regular square nondescript generic white plastic ones too. Ones that you can actually get trash in to. Score one for housekeeping! The room didn't have any outside noise coming in, but the air conditioner was LOUD! When you turned on the shower, half the water came out the tub spout, they only give you two bath towels (nice sized); and two calls to housekeeping never resulted in any more being delivered. But that's o.k. my husband didn't mind drying off with a slightly damp towel. LindySez: It's a Hilton. It is what it is; but the beds are comfy; and it's a quick hop to return your rental car and get on your plane."

Reviews.Title: “Overal satisfaction? Yes, that for sure...”
Reviews.Author: Shahbanoe
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and having reading the reviews of all tripadvisors about the LAX hotels, I decided to stay here and was a little bit disappointed when I entered the room. The room was big, roomy and very good size. But... a bit disappointed when I discovered that the $15,- extra that I 'd payed online for an upgrade to a club floor and a 1x bedroom suite, wasn't anything but a hoax. The so called suite didn't exactly look like a suite but more like a spacious king bedroom. The bed however, was very good and comfortable. But the bathroom wasn't that clean, pretty much out of date and the city view wasn't exactly the city view I 'd expected. And I had to admit that this hotel is surely a good value for your money as it in most cases concerns a one night stay as starting or departing point for most travellers/guests. My overal satisfaction is yes, I was and still am satisfied, but it can be a bit better. However, the front desk staff were very friendly esepcially the young gentleman who helped me to check-in. As soon as he understood that we arrived and will start our holiday instead of most people who check in prior to their flight back home, he immediately arranged a good meal and room service for us providing us free parking for the night as well as a dinner voucher/coupon that was even more than we needed to order what we wanted. So, yes, the room wasn't what I expected, but if you fly to Los Angeles and arrive late and need a place to stay with attentive and friendly smiling staff who takes good care of you being exhausted and tired, then stay here at Hilton LAX. Thank you Hilton LAX for the parking and the tasty hamburgers!

Reviews.Title: “More than anyone would expect from an airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: conradbaines
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Stayed here for an early morning flight the next morning (we were there for the night of September 1). We were on the top floor and had a great view. There was a restaurant downstairs with great breakfast food. There is also a Carls Jr. next door. There is an airport shuttle which is very convenient. I didn't stay here for this reason, but there was a wedding while we stayed there and the hotel looks like a nice place for one. In conclusion, this was way more than I expected. Two thumbs up!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location by airport, clean and good value!”
Reviews.Author: travelfromOhio
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, especially if you want to stay close to the airport. We did as this was our base for sightseeing. Check-in and check-out are a breeze. They have food available 24/7. One huge plus is guest coin-operated laundry! Was very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: desicutie515
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It was sooo nice. The bed was the soooo comfortable. I had the best night of sleep. The room was really clean and the staff was friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of thebest airport hotels”
Reviews.Author: ericlaudia
Reviews.Content: Convenient, feantastic staff, loud though when young "not so fine" americans around...

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want...”
Reviews.Author: Maurice07
Reviews.Content: I only stayed 3 nights, but it seemed like every need a traveler could have was anticipated by Hilton, and this LAX Hotel was one of the best Hilton's I have ever stayed at. From the speed of checkin/checkout, quality of the roomand its amenities, the food services and selections, the friendliness of the staff, the huge parking lot, and convenience to the Airport and other locations in LA - there was simply nothing that was lacking or that I am able to say was disappointing. Highly recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, but staff not professional”
Reviews.Author: TripComment
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well localized. I had a problem with my Internet booking as it did not show up on the Hotel Reservations. The efforts to solve the issue were minimal, and I had to be the one taking care of calling the Helpdesk of the Internet reservation, to make them call back the Hotel I asked for Internet access to show the reservation, and was denied. My room in 3 days was never clean. I was leaving in the orning around 11:00 AM, so nobody was comig after to take care of cleaning it. All the rest, despite this problem was Ok, as I would anywat recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like A Star”
Reviews.Author: LawDawg01
Reviews.Content: It was as though I was the only guest at the Hilton. Quick, Convenient, Clean and Personalized with all the amenities and then some. I was pampered like a star and felt very relaxed and comfortable. The employees were genuine and sincere and very accomodating. Definately 5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a layover”
Reviews.Author: LennW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is serviced by free airport shuttle and just minutes away from the terminals. As one can expect, almost all hotel guests are waiting for a flight connection. I got a room at the "Towers" level. This is on the top floors and I had access to a lounge with complimentary continental breakfast. My room was actually a living room, guest toilet, bedroom and master bathroom. Wifi available for a fee. Bed very comfy and I had a good nights sleep despite the fact that the room faced LAX runways. The bar at the ground level has basic food and drinks. I can recommend this hotel to anyone that has a layover at LAX. I wouldn't stay here for any other reason.

Reviews.Title: “Without a Doubt the Worst Brand Name Hotel in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: nasdcop
Reviews.Content: The room was filthy. Clumps of hair on the carpet, stains on the carpet and upholstered furniture, and sticky countertops. I am sure my room had not been vacuumed in days and that the countertops had not been wiped with disinfectant cleaner in weeks. Don't take your shoes off until you climb into bed. Only the sheets were clean in my room which was along with the comfortable bed were the only positive aspects to the hotel. The front desk personnel must be instructed to or simply enjoy seeing whether they can assign the worst rooms without objection. Never accept the first room assignment because invariably it is a test to determine what the clerk can get away with. Hallways are dirty and dingy. There really is absolutely no reason to select this hotel. I got stuck here by Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton LAX treats Hotwire clients like dirt”
Reviews.Author: bella7777
Reviews.Content: The Hilton at LAX seems to have a problem with those of us that use Hotwire to book their rooms.
