The female front desk staff, in particular, goes out of their way to assure you are assigned the worst rooms in the hotel-third floor with smokers and unsafe open dark courtyards where any other guest can come right up to your glass door. I recently booked my fifth or sixth stay with them and have only had problems with the foreign female front desk staff-they take delight in assuring you the hotel is full and only the third floor is available-Deborah even "showed" me the booking screen-as if to say "see I am not lying to you"...but she was---as proved only a few minutes later when miraculaouly another room was found after my protests regarding the third floor rooms assignment. She was quite patronizing in explaining that Hotwire clients do not receive the same priviledges as other guests...wow....what a high level of service from this major chain. In this economy it is hard to believe that any property is willing to treat guests with such disdain. I travel 50 weeks out of the year and even two star properties are more customer friendly. (I also stay at many four and five star properties) Is the Hilton doing so well that they can afford to leave their rooms empty? And by the way, the room I was given had one broken light and no tub plug...must have looked long and hard to find a room in need of repairs for this Hotwire client. What a shame that discrimination by booking source exists in this day and age...was going to join the Hilton frequent stay program but wouldn't consider it now..won't recommend the hotel either. Congratulations to the formidable foreign female front desk staff for making my buisness stay a miserable one to remember and share with colleagues all over the country. Debborah's customer service training in scamming Hotwire clients has paid off.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: VegasJenn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights and was very disappointed by this hotel. Firstly the rooms are small and have a tiny wardrobe, which may be OK for a single traveller, but for a family of 3 with clothes for 10 days it is unacceptable. Luckily we managed to be upgraded to a corner room which was significantly larger. We had hired a car as part of our stay and we couldn't have managed without it as it was a 25 minute drive into Los Angeles. If you are looking to stay in LA for more than a day I wouldn't stay here as it is not in a good location or accessible. We also had issues with the facilities on site. Firstly the pool was closed due to maintenance and we hadn't been made aware of this prior to arrival. Small gripe maybe, but we were hoping to take our son there. Secondly the hotel details included there being a fridge in the room , however this was a $25/day extra. The shop on the premises only sold water, no juice/milk etc so you would buy from the bar, at inflated prices. This hotel would only suffice as an overnighter if passing through LAX, I would avoid under any other circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, Personal and Secure”
Reviews.Author: auratravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I needed a secure place to leave our car in Los Angeles before flying to South America for three weeks. We chose the Hilton at LA airport for convenience but were very pleased we did for many reasons. Each encounter with an employee, from front desk to dining, was a pleasure. Everyone was professional and helpful. Our room was more than just comfortable and clean; it was lovely. We plan to stay there again with our family for our upcoming summer trip. Ask for a room away from the runway.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the LAX Hilton”
Reviews.Author: eBzky
Reviews.Content: This review is based on a four-night stay for business (conference) in March, 2009. My room was on the 11th floor overlooking the airport. I received a conference rate discount for my room. The free airport shuttle arrived within 10 minutes. Although crowded, the driver was pleasant and helpful and it is a quick ride to the hotel. I was extremely pleased with the service at the front desk and housekeeping. There were no problems whatsoever with the room, which was clean and comfortable. Yes you can hear the airplanes taking off, but considering how close you are to the runways, I thought it was about as quiet as one could expect. Room service was prompt with a late Sunday night dinner. My only disappointment was the wireless internet in the rooms, which was slow and sometimes dropped my connection (the wireless in the meetings rooms was very fast). I'd also caution that the pool is closed for repairs until April 18, 2009. Overall I'd recommend this hotel to anyone needing a stay or meetings near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “It's about the people....”
Reviews.Author: MauiBoy1
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of great hotel buildings in LA. The LAX HIlton is a great property with a bonus, great people. They understand who their customers are, and how to make it right. Is it perfect all the time? Nothing is, but they continue to get better. I have no reason to look any where else.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok, does the job.”
Reviews.Author: the_savman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a standard Hilton without the frills or extras, it's fine for an overnight stay for Transit LAX Passengers which I assume is their primary client base. We were less than impressed at trying to be charged more for the room at check-in than the rate we had booked, you don't expect this from such a big chain... There was also some serious aggro in the hotel lobby as fighting and arguing broke out between a large group, the hotel (in our humble opinion) were fairly slow to react and get it sorted. Other than that the rooms are comfortable and 'functional' rather than luxurious, if a little on the pricey side for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations, Conventions, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: PragmaticTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton LAX for a layover from the east coast on our way to Hawaii. We were upgraded to a poolside room. Unfortunately they did not tell us that the pool floor is also the smoking floor, and the pet floor. So, keep this in mind if offered this "upgrade." There are also renovations underway at the hotel which created a fair amount of noise. When checking in, you may want to ask where they are working and to make sure you get a room in a distant location. The lobby was packed with a convention which made it hard to find a seat (so that I could work while the rest of the family tried to sleep). The hotel restaurant was very expensive and not particularly inspired. The executive floor lounge had a great breakfast. The hotel was very responsive to our complaints. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. The hotel is very near the airport. I would give them another try when I need to stay by LAX in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value--close to LAX”
Reviews.Author: ResortSpaLady
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel last minute for a quick stayover in LA. I was very happy with the convenience and shuttle from the airport. Check in was easy and friendly. They were sold so very busy--said that I was lucky to get a room. Airport hotels accomodate a large number of pilots and flight attendants and this was no different. Several international flights checking in at same time. I was very hungry and looking for a place to eat--late lunch since it was 2;30 pm. I went to the finer dining area (the front desk suggested it). A manager was working behind the reception area and when I asked him is the restaurant was open---he looked at me like I was an idiot and said, "does it look like it is open?" I was very surprised at this rudeness and did not dine there during my visit for this reason. He could have said we have a dining area next door (partition) if you would like to dine now but maybe he was just having a bad day. There is also a bistro that serves coffee, salads, pizza, sandwiche,etc and that worked for the short term. I dined outside the hotel for dinner. The work out area was one of the best that I have seen (other than resorts). It was very large and well equipped with cardiovasular in one room and weight machines and free weights in another. I would stay here again just for the work out area. The room was VERY SMALL but comfortable. The hallway was a little noisy in the room and the bathroom outdated but again I was comforable and everything was VERY CLEAN. The gift shop was closed several times while I was there. There was a clock on the door to say when they would return but there always seemed to be someone waiting to visit the gift shop. I don't think the staff was gone lone butit was inconvenient and I am sure that they lose the impulse shoppers like me. I have attached several photos for your viewing. I would stay here again and recommend it to friends--when looking for a short stay without a car.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet for a hotel at the end of a runway!”
Reviews.Author: Shauny_A
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a one night stopover on the way to Mexico. I used the hotel's bus shuttle from the airport and the service was excellent. Check in was good and quick. My room was excellent with a king sized bed. Despite being only 10mins from the airport and basically near the end of one of the runways, my room was not noisy. I could just about hear some of the heavier jets but I went to bed at 6pm (jet lag) and had no trouble sleeping. I ordered breakfast in my room and the order was correct and on time. I used the hotel shuttle back to the airport and remember that there was a online map showing the location of the shuttles at the entrance to the hotel. Overall I had no problems what so ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarrellNI
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a good location and we received nothing but courtesy from the staff, the charges for car parking are a bit of a bind but as we stayed only one night and did not pick up our rental car until the next morning it did not cost us. The check in girl was very pleasent and gave us a good room with a view toward the city, as Hilton Honors members we were able to use the executive club although I am not sure if they approved but no-one asked us for proof so we used it anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great hotel near the LAX airport”
Reviews.Author: dlbNa
Reviews.Content: After a multi-day business trip I arrived tired and hungry during the evening hours at the hotel. I planned to drop off my luggage first so I wouldn't have to carry it around when I headed towards the rental car location at the airport to drop off the car. The doorman explained he would take care of everything and return the car for me. All I needed to do was drop my rental car info in a mail carrier just inside the hotel. It was a wonderful service. From there everyone treated me very well from the registration attendant to the bellman. I ordered room service and the food was outstanding. The rooms were very clean and quiet even though we were within just a couple of miles from the airport. You would think one would hear airplanes taking off all night but that was not the case. I had a very early flight the next morning (6am) and a bellman was at my door right on time at 4:30am to take my luggage downstairs. A shuttle comes through the hotel every 15 min to take the guests to the airport. The hotel has installed a GPS so you can track how far the shuttle is from the hotel. Overall, everything was easy, no stress and all Hilton employees were very acommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Conference-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: FastCarRental
Reviews.Content: The hotel is huge and impersonal, a bit outdated, but nice. The restaurants lack personality, but are adequate. The room was super clean and spacious. Staff were very helpful. The free shuttle from the airport are all shared at LAX. The Hilton shares with one other hotel, it seems to come every 20 minutes but it's more often normally. There are more than one, but when I was waiting it took longer than 20 for some reason. It's on a route for a $3 trolley to the beach and shopping, tickets at the conceirge, that is worth it. Great views of the beach and beach houses, really good shopping and a taste of LA life if you have an extra 3 hours to enjoy a restaurant and shop. Overall I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Seemonkey
Reviews.Content: Located on the South west of LA, perfect for heading East downtown , or West to Santa Monica There is a Hertz desk on site with parking at $20 ATM in Lobby Breakfast buffet on Executive floor (ask for the upgrade upon check in around $15) is above average , (open from 0600), with views of the runway. Fitness centre is located in basement ( no pool), is large with free weight and cardio machines Rooms are standard Hilton setup, a couple of hiccups , but no more than any other hotel chain. Resolution quick and efficient Take the shuttle from the airport ( outside in courtesy buses area), sit at front of bus and get off first, so you can check in first... Dennys and Carls Jr , are next door

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: daysmith
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hilton for a stay the night before flying home to the UK. When we did, it transpired that the lobby area was being used to film a HBO movie. The effect of this is that we were made to feel as trespassers not guests. I know that this is probably a one-off but the rest of our experience wasn't and it was perhaps an illustration of how customers are treated. When we arrived, I also wanted to just leave my rental car for 5 minutes whilst dropping off our bags but the conceirge's way of dealing with this for me was to valet it - which subsequently cost me $9 (as this is the minimum charge). Then we went for lunch in the Cafe on site where the waiter did not really speak English and thus we waited for our drinks for 20 minutes before a pretty poor meal. We should thus probably have known better when we later ordered room service. The pizza we had delivered was like a frisbie and half as tasty. We also had to pay $13 plus taxes, plus a delivery charge plus a mandatory 17% gratuity for the pleasure. There are other things but hopefully you've got the gist of our experience. In summay, our recommendation really would be to stay somewhere else if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “Unfreindly Deception”
Reviews.Author: WineAuctioneer
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors Gold VIP I stay at Hilton Member hotels all of the time. This particular Hilton is the second worst Hilton I have ever stayed in, and second only to the Hilton Oak Lawn - a Hilton in a Chicago suburb. 1. The room assigned was not as promised. 2. Unfriendly staff 3. Confrontational management that truly does not like or wish to respond to concerns. 4. Mediocre food in all of the restaurants. 5. Noisy. 6. The suites are certainly nothing special, and the one I was assigned was tantamount to dungeon. The Hilton corporation would be wise to send their Q.A. Team to look into this hotel that bears their flag.

Reviews.Title: “Got Cheated at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: exdoublexx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice enough looking - clean, well maintained, etc. But..... 1) Paying $13 for internet is bad enough. But when the connection is excrutiatingly SLOW, it is inexcusable. 2) They actually charge you to use the business center. Never at any other hotel have I been charged for that service. 3) The restaurant was exactly what I expected at a hotel: mediocre overpriced food. 4) But worst of all, after I signed my meal ticket to my room, the waiter added more charges to the ticket without my knowledge. I only found out about it when I checked my room charges later. Note: the restaurant refunded the overcharge when I confronted them later.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean”
Reviews.Author: Irishgirl_286
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before flying back to Dublin. We drove from San Diego to LA and arrived approx 1pm. The first major problem was the lack of signs showing us where to leave our rental car. We ended up lifting a chain to a space marked Hertz and dumped it there. After queing for over 15-20 minutes at the Hertz desk we were told we were late returning the car...........hmm maybe thats because you left us standing here for the last 20 minutes and now we are 15 minutes late returning the car, anyway after explaining the situation the Hertz rep said it was ok and would ignore the charge and said where we parked the car was fine.....ok then! The queue for check in was approx 10 minutes and eventually we got to our room. The room was what you would expect from an airport hotel, compact but comfortable. The only thing about this hotel is, when you are there, you are there, there is nothing else around, no shops, restaurant etc hence the reason they can overcharge you in there coffee shop and restaurant. The pool area is actually really nice, the noise of aeroplanes taking off and landing did not bother me and it was nice to squeeze in one last bit of sunshine. There are also 4 lovely hot tubs to relax in. The food in the restaurant was quite nice and we also had some drinks in the sports bar. The lobby of this hotel is constantly buzzing and I liked the busy atmosphere. The free shuttle to the airport was also appreciated even if it was a squeeze. Overall its an airport hotel and the pool is an added bonus 7/10

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight layover at LAX.”
Reviews.Author: BigDubya
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an overnight layover at LAX. Booked through Hotwire at about $85 including taxes, so no complaints about price! Although we arrived late at night, the hotel was fairly active with people checking in and out. Check in was fast. They had a small snack shop, typical hotel prices, but at least it was open at that time of night. Decent room, nothing fancy, but clean. Had the usual comfortable Hilton bed, and our room was quiet. We used their free shuttle which operated every 10 to 15 minutes to and from the airport. Good for our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: pnmdotcom
Reviews.Content: Had a one night stay. Nice lobby, rest of the hotel very corporate and dowdy. Good sized room, big comfortable bed. Clean and tidy. Buffet breakfast good although typically pricey. Nothing outside of hotel of interest, shuttle every 10 to 15 minutes to all terminals. Good for a night's stay, wouldn't want to stay in this area any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: muttnjeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel one night prior to a cruise and one night following the cruise. First, the positive side: the guest rooms and baths are spacious and clean. The windows are large, and offer a good view from some rooms. The TV reception was excellent. The public areas are upscale and nicely decorated. The free shuttle to/from the nearby LAX airport is handy, and runs on a frequent schedule, but it's only fair to tip the driver for moving heavy luggage. Now the negative points: jet takeoff and landing noise from the nearby airport continues all night long, and intrudes into the room. While internet access may be free in the rooms or public areas for your laptop (I don't know), there is a heavy charge for use of the hotel business center computers. The three restaurants, including the Bistro sandwich shop, are very expensive. The elevators, while attractive in appearance, seem to operate with excessive noise and vibration. The guest room alarm clock is wonderously complex and counter-intuitive, confounding any attempt to reset it. Ours went off at 4:13 a.m., courtesy of a previous guest. We finally gave up on the clock and used the automated wake-up system. Bottom line, I will not again pay $239 per night to lie awake while listening to jet noise. We won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Avocat1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back to NZ from Dallas Tx. The room was small but still very nice. The location, free shuttle, very friendly staff, made this a very pleasant stay indeed. The pool and hot tubs were also great and the rooms were very quiet with little or no noise from nearby aircraft taking off and landing. The view of the airport runway was a bonus! I suppose the only complaint was the over priced food at the hotel restaurant ($16 for cereal!) and the rather cold and unfriendly staff at the brasserie downstairs. And must they serve that awful Starbucks coffee!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch!”
Reviews.Author: tricia28
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two children decided to spend a Friday night at the hotel prior to flying out saturday morning. I booked the hotel on the Hilton website the same day we were to arrive (OI am a Hilton Hhonors Gold member). I paid for and received an e-mail from Hilton for the Concierge Level floor I had booked which included an ugraded room, and a private lounge for evening hors doeuvres and breakfast. (We have done this in the past and the kids love to watch the planes take off and land from the lounge while having evening cookies and morning breakfast). Upon arrival after waiting in the Hilton Hhonors line over 20 minutes(!) to check-in (the regular line moved faster) we were told the lounge was closed and had been for the past week. We were also told we couldn't stay on the Hilton Hhonors floor because "the floor was closed". We were given breakfast vouchers for the restaurant and no apology for missing any of the amenities we had paid for. Then we were given the keys to a small cramped room (I have stayed at this property over 10 times in the past and I have never received a room this small). We called back down and insited they open the Hhonors floor rooms and give us the room we paid for. They relented and gave us a standard room on the Honors floor which was deserted so at least it was quiet. The next day we had to go wait for a breakfast table and of course tip our waitress (I won't cheat employees working hard despite the hotels bait and switch). This was nothing short of fraud and we should have been given an apology from the management and our room should only have been charged at the standard rate (not the concierge rate at $40.00 more!) What a rip-off. Beware, the Hilton has been bought out by a private investment company called Blackstone and they are hell bent on ruining the Hilton name in pursuit of profits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but some aircraft noise”
Reviews.Author: hove-traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a 24hr stopover on the way from the UK to Mexico. On arrival at LAX, we took the free airport shuttle to the Hilton, which took about 10 minutes. There was no queue at check in, and we were quickly given our keys for an upgrade to an executive room on the 17th floor. The room was large and contained 2 very comfortable double beds. The furniture and decor were all spotless- no chips or scratches here. The bathroom was very big, spotlessly clean and contained a small selection of the usual complimentary toiletries. The most imposing feature of the room, however, was the large windows looking out over the runway. You can literally sit in bed and watch the planes taking off and landing in front of you! Unfortunately, that did mean some aircraft noise (those pesky DC10s and MD80s!) so if you are a light sleeper I would recommend a room at the back of the hotel. Being jetlagged, we went straight to bed and woke at 5am. At 6am, we headed to the executive lounge on the 16th floor for complimentary breakfast (for executive rooms and HH golds only). Again, the room was spotlessly clean and had a great selection of breakfast: bagels and toast, muffins, pastries, cereals, hard boiled eggs, and fresh fruit. Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I was Surprised”
Reviews.Author: FairwayFound
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting here, otherwise I generally prefer other hotels. I have been in some Hiltons that were in need of some TLC. I was surprised by the comfort of the beds, the soft towels, the ease of a very late night check-in, and the cleanliness. No doubt the hotel manager cracks a loud whip! The only complaint was the cost of the food in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hilton Ever”
Reviews.Author: Daoda2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a lot of Hiltons over the years and this one was surely the worst. The lobby is nice, but once you get past it, the hotel is dingy: poorly lit hallways, stained carpets, chipped furnishings, sagging closet doors. Bed was okay and it was quiet, but those were the only good things. Would not stay again and would be more skeptical about Hiltons in general in the future. Hotels like this do a real damage to their brand.

Reviews.Title: “Rev. and family”
Reviews.Author: G1956
Reviews.Content: I would like to say this hotel is very clean and I felt very safe there. The guest services was wonderful and accommodating. My room was very comfortable and it was amazing to be so close to the airport and not have the the planes distrub my rest. The location is great for travelers who like getting to and from the airport in a short time ex-specially at a busy airport like LAX.

Reviews.Title: “A short stay...”
Reviews.Author: Nette05
Reviews.Content: CHECK-IN : Was quick and easy. I had just returned from a cruise and asked if it was ok that I check-in early. The check-in person was very nice and was joking with me when he said oh no now that you are coming from a cruise, you're going to have to wait. I told him that I didnt have to come I could've just went straight home and not give any money to Hilton. Lets just say he saw it my way. By the time my husband went over to have the bell desk hold our luggage we were all checked in so the front desk offered to have our bags sent up, thats what you call fast service. ROOM: 1345 -This room was not that bad but not great either .As soon as we opened the door there was a dirty towel left on the floor, so I went and found a housekeeper who came and picked it up. The bed was sooooo nice. The bathroom was ok. Had HBO which was nice. This room didnt have a fridge for some reason but the room I stayed in my last stay did.... didnt really matter only stayed one night. My husband was very anoyed with tapping coming from the windows. He wanted to change rooms but I was too lazy and tired to go downstairs....We just turned the tv up louder. Sorry cant comment on pool,restaurants,business/fitness centers I didnt use these services... CHECK-OUT: Was nice and easy I did the Zip-Out which takes all but 1 minute. Just pick up the phone and leave a message telling them you're leaving and leave the keys in the room and thats it. SHUTTLE: Not a good experience at all. We had to wait about 20 minutes for a pick up...Then when leaving we told the driver what airline we were on but he drove pass it then stopped the shuttle about a mile away and me and my husband had to walk aways back to our airline terminal..with alot of luggage I might add. It wasnt a terrible stay but wasnt excellent either.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the reverse park & fly package experience”
Reviews.Author: amildon
Reviews.Content: Dropped our car off at the hotel and was promptly transferred to LAX by schuttle. A week later we returned from Maui at 10:30 pm and checked into the Hilton using their electronic quick check-in. Our keys were issued within minutes and we were on our way to our lovely room. We were treated to an executive continental breakfast the next morning which was terrific. Sorry we could only spend one night. Our stay capped off a wonderful vacation. Thanks Hilton!!!

Reviews.Title: “REALLY Liked this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: michbren
Reviews.Content: Liked many other contributors we stayed here at the end of an LA trip prior to an early flight home. We arrived about 7pm exhausted after a long day of "tourist activities". The lobby size and check-in desk was somewhat overwhelming with alot of people (we usually stay at smaller boutique hotels). I was glad we had reserved a tower lounge room and it was great going up the 16th floor to the lounge check-in where there was no one else. Our room was perfect - large, nice furniture, very clean and a great view. The only disappointments were the small "70's" bathroom and the older-style TV. The tower lounge was great - very personalized, quiet, great view, good food and drinks. It is definitely worth the additional cost. We had dinner at the hotel and the food was pretty good, but the service was rether inconsistant and slow (perhaps because is was later in the evening). The shuttle to and from the airport worked out well. All in all it was a real enjoyable stay for a short time. The hotel had a great buzz.- everyone seemed to be having a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Tidy”
Reviews.Author: Craig0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we had an early flight out the next morning to New York. We booked it on wotif for about $126 US I think. They let us check in at 9am in the morning, which was a great help. The rooms were clean and tidy. Staff were helpful in giving us advice on how to get to Santa Monica by bus. We didn't eat in any of the restaurants, but there is a Denny's about a 5 minute walk away for an authentic American meal! The shuttle bus was a good service, and got us to the airport with plenty of time. Overall, a pretty good hotel for the money and location to the airport. And yes, you can hear the planes!

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hippotours
Reviews.Content: We booked a great deal directly with the hotel to stay at the Hilton for 1 night before flying on to Vegas to get married. We normally stay at 5 star properties but were more than happy with the Hilton for a one night stay. The check in was quick but this might change based on when you turn up as there appeared to be some tour groups arriving just after we checked in. The room itself was a little tired decor wise but perfectly spacious, clean and the bed was superbly comfortable. I slept very well until 4am (jet lag!) The view from the room was great, I loved watching the planes land and take off. We ate in the 24 hour bar in the evening. A word of warning if you order nachos the portions are big enough for 2. The staff were friendly and if you like sports then they have TVs at the bar. We had access to the executive lounge for breakfast which was well presented and plentiful in supply. The decor was nice, this part must have been recently renovated. In summary would we stay here again, yes at the rate of $89 per night it was unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Great crash-pad”
Reviews.Author: LPKent
Reviews.Content: Booked one night here after landing at LAX. Fairly easy to find and park, although you will have to pay for parking. Room was slightly "tired" for Hilton but bed was very comfortable, room was quiet and we had a good night's sleep. Happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: smitty195
Reviews.Content: I needed a nice hotel near LAX for a weekend trip, and after checking on TripAdvisor and seeing that this hotel looked pretty good, I booked an internet rate for $99/night. This was for a two night stay on a Saturday and Sunday night (rate was fully pre-paid and non-refundable). The good: -Right next to the airport -Free shuttle service 24 hours a day -Beautiful lobby -Clean -Nice restaurants -24 hour bistro located in lobby for hot food, snacks, drinks, coffee -24 hour room service (menu is limited between 11PM and 6AM) -USA Today newspaper delivered to your door -Room service breakfast was very good, and delivered to my room 15 minutes after the call on a busy Monday morning The bad: -Right next to the airport (bring earplugs) -Look at my photos.....This was a very weird room with the smallest window in a hotel I've ever seen. How do you like the view? -The free shuttle service runs at random intervals. When you call the Hilton and ask about the shuttle service, you will be told that it runs "every 20 to 25 minutes after the half hour". This is absolutely false--do not rely on this. The shuttle service is not a Hilton shuttle. It is an LAX shuttle, and many of these mini blue buses serve most of the hotels and motels around the airport. When you catch your bus curbside outside of baggage claim, many of these buses will drive by---you need to look for the bus with the bright orange digital display that says, "HILTON LAX FOUR POINTS LAX". This bus stops at both the Hilton and the Four Points by Sheraton around the corner. -When the bus drops you off at the hotel, be prepared to stand in line to check in. Everyone on the bus is doing the same thing you are---checking in. If there are 25 people on the bus, then there will be 25 people in line. (My advice if you don't mind spending a few extra bucks is to skip the free shuttle and instead pay a taxi 10 bucks to take you to the hotel. Same thing for returning to LAX because the shuttle bus shows up "when it gets there"---there is no set schedule). -If you are flying on Virgin America Airlines, you can not print your boarding pass from the kiosk in the hotel lobby. For some reason, they do not have this airline in the system yet even though VA has been in service for over a year. -In order to understand my strange room, you need to picture how the hotel is built. Imagine a big "plus" sign, and this is the hotel. On each floor, there are four rooms (on at each corner) in the middle where the "plus" sign meets. All four of these rooms (on each floor) will be small and have the weird window as shown in my picture. My room number was 1042, so make sure you ask when you check-in if they are putting you in one of these rooms. I asked the clerk at check-in for an "airport view" so that I could watch the planes takeoff and land. He said "no problem"---and look where he put me! What a joke. I might try this hotel again, because it was clean and the service was good. The downstairs coffee shop was good also, and they have both a breakfast buffet and a dinner buffet. The steakhouse is only open Monday through Friday (to my disappointment). Housekeeping also did a great job. Besides the strange window and the horrible view, my last gripe would be the bathroom. Take a look at the picture and you will see that not only is it small, but the wallpaper is peeling and there are black mold spots throughout. It is a very old bathroom, with a water knob like I have never seen before. The bathroom was the only part of the room that did not seem updated.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: stainedglasslass
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had an early flight so we elected to spend the night at Hilton at LAX. It was wonderful from the first moment to second we left the shuttle at the airport. Check in was a breeze! It was fun to read the name tag and learn a little bit about the young woman behind the counter, a real ice breaker. Within minutes we were on our way up to the room, which was quite large, in the Tower. This gave us access to happy hour and breakfast in the lounge, both of which were lovely and a good value. But the best part was the bed. It was like sleeping on a cloud with plenty of pillows; no matter how many you like to use you won't have to call for extras! Wireless internet. Clean bathroom with great toiletries. I'll definitely use this hotel over all the others when I have a flight out of LAX. The only problem we ran into was the room service staff not knowing the difference between a gin and tonic (white) and whiskey and something (yellow). It took quite a while to get a replacement. All our problems should be so minor!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly”
Reviews.Author: auntj13
Reviews.Content: Great ease to stay right at the airport for those early morning flights without having to worry about traffic. And to include a week of free parking with transportation to and from the airport made spending the night almost free! Staff friendly and efficient and surprisingly the rooms were so well insulated never heard a plane coming in for a landing right at the end of the runway. Would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Leetraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hilton for 1 night to catch an early flight the next morning. The Hilton Hotel at LAX airport in Los Angeles was extraordinary in every respect. Not only was the staff attentive at check in, but the room was quiet, comfortable and above all, clean. The hotel bar was buzzing with visitors, but the service was prompt and attentive. The best thing about the service at the Hilton was the promptness of the airport shuttle both going to the airport and arriving back in LA. We parked our car for 2 weeks and picked it up with ease. On top of that we got a very special Park and Fly rate considering the high quality of this hotel. We would definately stay there again for all our early morning travels by air at LAX and would highly recommend it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: shumate45
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the LA Airport Hilton and very impressed with the quality of the Hotel. They have an excellent breakfast buffet and the rooms are spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay at the Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: TravlFam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a one-night stay at the LAX Hilton. The lobby is clean, modern and nice. We arrived after 10 pm and were made to wait in line even though we are Hilton Honors members. Had, what felt like, a good 10 - 15 minute wait. Check in person was ok - not super friendly nor overly welcoming. Our room was ok. It was spacious but felt like it needed to be painted or remodeled. Beds were comfortable. We had breakfast buffet at the Hilton Cafe. Food was quite good at $20 per person. The hotel was convenient for one night but I wouldn't go out of my way to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights - 2 different experiences”
Reviews.Author: usroadman
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Hilton twice within a few days, but had different experiences each time so wrote two reviews. First Stay: I flew into LAX on a Thursday morning and arrived at the Hilton at around 10:00 in the morning. I thought $17 for self-parking was a little expensive (I thought it was more like $12 when I made the reservation), although this does allow in & out privileges. They allowed me to check in at mid-morning with no problem, gave me a room on the 13th floor in the south wing of the building facing west (above the pool). During the day I was a little concerned about aircraft noise, but it was not a problem at night. I could hear the departures, but it was not overly loud and did not keep me awake. The room was pretty standard for a full service Hilton. The exercise facilities were free and very nice. The facility is open 24 hours, and had a large selection of new equipment. As at many full-service hotels, there was a charge for internet access. The business center was undergoing renovation, so was closed while I was there. Because I'm an HHonors Diamond VIP member, I was given access to the executive lounge. During the afternoon they had coffee, soft drinks, and a few muffins available. It was nice to have someplace to sit quietly and get something to drink. In the evening they had a couple of hot dishes, cheese & crackers, etc. available. Alcoholic drinks were also available, but were not free as they are in some hotels. Later in the evening cookies were available. At breakfast, there were no pre-made hot items, but there was a good selection of fruit, muffins, danish, cereal, toast, bagels, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, etc. Checkout was quick and easy. Overall this was a good stay. Second Stay: I returned with my wife a couple of nights later. Since we were flying out early the next morning, we planned to drop off the rental car later that evening and take the hotel shuttle back to the airport in the morning. I didn't want to pay $17 to park for a couple of hours (or even $6 to park for the 1 hour minimum), so I attempted to pull into the hotel entryway to unload the bags and check in, then park on the street until dropping the car off. Most of the entryway is blocked off with orange cones so you can't pull over. I pulled over where there was room (and where they told me to pull over), but in the 2 minutes it took to get most of our bags into the front door, they were already complaining about my car being there. I parked the car out on 98th Street (there are a few 2-hour spaces on the street behind the hotel) and carried the rest of our belongings from the car back around to the lobby. It is absurd that you can't park for 10 stinking minutes to check into the hotel without paying a $6 parking fee. Either let people park in the entryway for a few minutes to check in, or allow guests to park in the garage for 30 minutes for free to check in. If you have a car with you and don't need to park it there, I'd recommend choosing another hotel. This time we were given a room on the 11th floor, still above the pool, but in the west wing facing south. The carpet and wallpaper in the hallway looked really grimy. I seemed as though if I took a wet towel and rubbed it across the wall it would come out black (I didn't actually try it, but that's what it looked like). I felt like I was in a budget motel that hadn't been renovated in 30 years. In the room, the beds were the new Hilton beds (which are comfortable), but the other furniture was badly worn, and packing tape was holding up the wallpaper. One of the water glasses had never been replaced, and there were no bottles of water in the room (all HHonors members are supposed to get water, to say nothing of their top-tier members). Although this room was only around the corner from the previous one, aircraft noise was much worse. The loud booming of departing aircraft woke me up about 5 times during the night. Apparently the south-facing rooms catch a lot more noise than the west-facing rooms. Because this was a weekend, the executive lounge was closed. Instead they gave us vouchers for a free appetizer in the evening and continental breakfast in the morning from the hotel restaurant. The appetizer choices were chicken wings or a quesadilla. I had the quesadilla, which was quite good. We left before breakfast the next morning. The shuttle van back to the airport worked well. It runs every 15-20 minutes 24 hours per day. It stopped at one other hotel to pick up passengers, but only stops at terminals where someone needs to get off. Even though we stopped at most terminals, the trip was still pretty quick (less than 15 minutes). I was much less impressed with this second stay.

Reviews.Title: “I higly recommend the Hilton Los Angeles Airport”
Reviews.Author: ManufanQuincy
Reviews.Content: I travel a great deal with my job and recently stayed at the Hilton Los Angeles airport. I have never experienced such fantastic customer service as i did at this hotel by everyone who worked there. Checking in was easy and quick especially after a long flight. I was greeted with a hello and a smile by all members of the staff, the front desk were extremly helpful and answered every question i had. I experience many hotels on my travels throughout the U.S and this ranks amongst the best. The rooms were very clean and smelt fresh, the restuarant served outstanding food and the gym was filled with all the latest workout equipment for those who wish to work out during their stay. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to experience an enjoyable stay. I cannot say enough about this Hilton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: 1HeartNevada
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent service from the valet parking to room service. Every encounter with the staff was personal, warm, and friendly. We loved the soft green tones used in the decor of the room because it created a tranquil relaxing atmosphere. The king size bed was incredibly comfortable. The Hilton exceeded all of my expectations because I have never found a hotel near an airport with great prices, great service, and outstanding quality. I highly recommend the Hilton Los Angeles Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hilton Get away!”
Reviews.Author: KevinSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Hotel personel, Professional, Courteous, happy to be there! Housekeeping staff made our room a castle of comfort and cleanliness. Front desk personal gave excellent advise on convenient inexpensive shuttle to local shopping and Manhatten Beach. Manhatten Beach is a must visit for fun,food and entertainment. At departure bellman, Joseph will make your departure cordial and easy! Looking forward to next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ufoshit
Reviews.Content: stayed here the night before i took a flight.. everything is fine.. i have problems with my door latch... called, they come up within 10 mins to fix it.. the only thing bad was the room service was expensive, but that's every hotels...

Reviews.Title: “Convience of Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: 1fitz
Reviews.Content: I am American living in Australia. I make approximately 2 trips per year to the USA. I usually stay at Hilton LAX for the convience. As a woman travelling alone I feel comfortable and secure and do appreciate your helpful and friendly staff. I enjoy using the Trolly facility to the local shopping center. I will continue to use Hilton in my travels. Wanda Fitzgerald

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: lizmusic
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hilton was very comfortable and easy. The staff were pleasant and extremely helpful, and despite the huge numbers of people coming and going at the hotel, we felt that we were well taken care of and not anonymous. The convenience to the airport was also a plus. I would definitely feel comfortable recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park and Fly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smart_bird
Reviews.Content: We frequently use a park and fly hotel near LAX, but this was the first time we'd used the Hilton. The price was almost the same as the other hotel but it was so much nicer! The bed was wonderful, the hotel is very comfortable with most amenities, the valet service was excellent and prompt. We're definitely staying here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Works For Me!!”
Reviews.Author: Kuya-Dan
Reviews.Content: I was in room 1552, and though I asked for room 1572, I was ok with the room I got. The room was spotless and everything was in order... Check-in was quick and the check-in staff was affable, even considering how busy it was. there was some kind of chess tournament going on, a couple of wedding receptions and other events, and lots of people checking in and out... I had dinner at The Cafe, and busy though it was, the food and service was superb. My waiter (name of Victor) was great... I ordered room service breakfast the next morning, and I requested it be delivered at 7:15, and at 7:13 it arrived. The eggs were cooked exactly as requested to my happy surprise. It was a most enjoyable breakfast to be sure... The shuttle to the airport was quick, and the wait like 7 or 8 minutes. That was acceptable considering how busy it was when I left... I didn't see any justification for some of the recent negative reviews. On previous overnighters I've stayed at the Sheraton Gateway and once at the Radisson, and I feel that's a good basis for comparison considering I fly to/from Manila 4 - 5 times a year and always do an overnight before flying out to Manila... I will make the Hilton my overnight choice in the future... Mabuhay!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel..needs upgrading in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eldorado500
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good for location to the airport, it was clean, and the restaurants were good, breakfast was great. Sadly the rooms are very run down, and need upgrading. Good for the price for a one night stay. Great hamburger place a few doors awa\yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hilton Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: CPInut
Reviews.Content: I spent just one day in July at the Hilton Los Angeles on my way back to the east coast. I have stayed there before, and the service was just as excellent as always. Check-in is quick, they arrange for your parking lot ticket, and then I am off to a great room. It is close to LAX and the rental car locations, so I can drop off my car the night before and take the hotel shuttle. The staff is friendly and helpful from the doorman to the check in to the shuttle diver. They have several choices off the lobby to eat and drink. The Hilton has the best variety of all the hotels near LAX. I use the shuttle to go to the airport. I do not remember a driver that was a pleasant and worked to help everyone with their luggage and make sure they got off at the right stop. I know it is hard to stand out as a shuttle driver, but this person did. The attitude of all the staff is just great. In my travels I stay at a lot of hotels, and I look forward to my stay at the Hilton. The staff is great, the rooms are always clean and comfortable, there a lots of choices to eat and drink, and the internet access works every time. I highly recommend the Hilton when you are in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “LAX Hilton is a convenient "layover."”
Reviews.Author: Wasabe126
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were scheduled for an afternoon flight to Tokyo on a Tuesday. Even though we could have driven to LAX on Tuesday morning (about 90 minutes), we opted to spend Monday night at the LAX Hilton. We wanted to get the CA freeways out of the way before the day of our long flight. The LAX Hilton has always provided a pleasant, convenient "first stop" on our overseas sojourns. We've spent the night there prior to long trips several times and will do so again. We have found the beds to be notably comfortable and the room service surprisingly delicious. We arrive at the airport on hotel-provided transportation , calm and rested and ready to stand in those long crowded lines at the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & convenient hotel - minor parking problems - excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: CACoastTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a long-term parking / hotel package (ParkSleepFly.com). This was a good arrangement for our needs. The website price at the hotel was not honored ($179 plus taxes and fees) for hotel and 15 nights parking) - it was actually $184 including all taxes and fees!!!!!!! Terrific rates for parking and a good hotel room. The minor problem is that in collecting your car, the same parking garage cashier handles these claims as the valet and the 'normal' airport parking customers. She was way overloaded - took about 30 minutes standing in line to get my claim turned in. But the car appeared moments later and I left a happy - uh - camper I guess. Great value. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Posh”
Reviews.Author: cjocolumbus
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family onway to Austraila for 48 hrs. The entance was beautifull, The staff were polite and helpfull at all times. It had a Gym, Sauna and swimming pool. totoaly great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Far and close”
Reviews.Author: ALEXIM
Reviews.Content: Nice, comfortable and practical. Actually, I had a very pleasant stay. Being at the airport area, it could seem to be far of everything but you're really close to any trip purpose: business, leisure, pleasure, shopping, tourism, etc. With a car, you're moving and getting a very good hotel at a very reasonable cost. It was a real pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: Verdad
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in a junior type suite (bedroom, living room, 2 baths) on the concierge floor. My husband was there for business and myself and two teenage daughters joined him. We found the property lovely. Well appointed, good service, pleasantly decorated. The beds were wonderfully comfortable. The housekeeping was excellent. The concierge level's lounge was fantastic. We enjoyed having a continental breakfast there and drinks and appetizers each afternoon. True the hotel is right next to the airport (good for business), but I found it really easy and fun even to drive into the LA downtown/Beverly Hills sights. Overall, I was happy with our experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Generally a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Laserglo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at LAX Hilton for 4 days in June. Have stayed there several times in the past few years. The staff is always professional and efficient. The rooms are comfortable and mostly clean. They are however,showing their age/wear and could use new furnishings, carpet and wallpaper. The bathroom also had lots of cracked and chipped tiles. Did not see any cockroachs in my room, but did see one in the hallway outside my room that was about 11/2 inches long. One of the other hotel guests in the room across the hall smashed it. They do, like most other hotels nearby, charge for parking and internet use. One of the things I do appreciate about the hotel is that the rooms, so close to the airport runway, are still fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a One-Night Stand”
Reviews.Author: BigP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton LAX hotel both going and coming from a two-week vacation in Hawaii and though there is nothing that makes one want to shout praises about the place, it is cefrtainly perfectly acceptable for a one-night stay. The beds were, in both cases, comfortable and restful. It was also nice to have several choices of tea to choose from in the morning and a free and convenient shuttle to the airport that leaves every 15 minutes all day and night through was certainly a "plus." The cleaning staff was, the nights we were there, inconsistent. The first night, for instance, the bath had not been cleaned very well (there were a number of hairs in the tub) but the second night was far better with every thing neat and clean. One of the most disappointing aspects of the Hilton LAX is the fact that though there is a so-called business center, even the use of the computers to access the Internet require an additional charge. In this day and time, such a failure to be traveler-friendly, is rather ridculous. But would we stay again? Probably. The Hilton is convenient to the airport and though there are few restaurants other than a Carl's Jr. within walking distance, a one-night stand at a reasonable (for Los Angeles) rate make it at least a strong possibility.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was great”
Reviews.Author: Sruta
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay. Next to airport and got a great deal on priceline. Clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Orlando_Fam
Reviews.Content: Beware when staying at this Hilton branded hotel. The hotel service and employees are very friendly and cordial but I wouldnt consider this hotel a 4 star hotel . It closer to 3. My family and I stayed there at the end of June for 2 nights and were dissapointed in the decor of the rooms. The rooms are dated from the 1980's. It was obvious that the room had not been updated since then. The floor tiles in the bathroom were cracked the furniture was that fake oak particle board and warped from water damge, the carpet in our room had stains througout. I was also a Hitlon Honors Silver member and asked for an upgraded room only to be offered one for an additional charge. Not sure it would have been better......... Bottom line 2-3 star hotel with a Hilton logo on top.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Londonbound
Reviews.Content: We needed a decent hotel at LAX that had a park , stay, and fly deal where we could leave our car for 20 days. This was the only hotel that offerred a reasonable deal at this time. All the other airport hotels would only cover a week or so. We were upgraded to a very nice suite which included the concierge amenities. Free sodas, coffee, pizza, eggrolls, veggies, etc. and a continental breakfast. The shuttle was convenient and the hotel staff was pleasant. Unfortunately some of the workers went on strike right after we were already checked in. I hope they settle things soon. Many food choices, restaurants, etc. Nice lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Suprise”
Reviews.Author: melargo
Reviews.Content: Booked my one night stay through Hotwire for $70. We drove all day from Reno on 06/01 to catch our flight to Honolulu the following morning. Arriving somewhat tired...check in did not take very long and we were assigned a room on the 6th floor somewhat near the elevators. I was concerned at first but after lying on the bed after a minutes...I knew I would get a good nights sleep. Didn't hear any planes taking off that some other reviewers mentioned. We tried the buffet dinner at The Cafe in the lobby...$20 per person. It seemed just ok...but maybe I was too tired to enjoy it. If you're looking for a place near LAX for a few days...book through Hotwire and cross your fingers. A few blocks away is the Marriott which seems to be a nice place too. Parking at the Hilton is $17/day but it seemed to be a secure underground garage. I would definitely stay here again but only if I booked it through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: docajenk
Reviews.Content: Excellent in all respects. Rooms very comfortable, location for airport is perfect with a free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay here”
Reviews.Author: JFann823
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights while on vacation in LA. I am normally a business traveler but this time I was staying in LA for a vacation. I chose this hotel based on price and location. I normally HATE airport Hiltons and I was frankly worried about the quality of this hotel based on prior airport hotel experience and the reviews on this website. However, because of the incredible price I got, I was still willing to stay here. I have to admit that I actually enjoyed my stay. The bed was comfortable and the room was semi-updated. My room was clean and when we asked for special requests from the housekeeper, they granted them. The service was acceptable and I enjoyed that they had 24 hour room service and a 24 hour cafe. My only complaint about my stay was the shower. The bathroom sink was updated but the shower had not been. It was clean and mold free but the shower had difficulties keeping temperature and the fixtures were extremely old. As for noise, I honestly did not hear any airport noise but my room did not face the runway. I am a Hilton platinum member so I have executive lounge priviledges. The executive lounge was very nice and comfortable. I could have spent hours there. The location was great and convienent to Santa Monica, the Getty, and Dodgers Stadium. We had no problem getting around. I know a lot of reviewers complained about the $17 parking. I guess I am just used to staying in big cities like Chicago, DC and New York that $17 overnight parking does not bother me. Warning though - if you have a very tall car, you will be unable to park in the structure and will have to do valet. We had a Toyota Highlander though and had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed & pillows, but airport noise was excessive.”
Reviews.Author: MightyClong
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ the LAX Hilton on the tail end of a business trip b/c I had an early morning flight. I was only their briefly (got in @ 10:00pm & had to check out @ 4:00am), so I cannot evaluate the entire hotel, but I can say that the building was aging. It's obvious (some of the fixtures & some structural observations), but it's also obvious that the hotel is well taken care of. My room was of decent size, the furniture was nice & the bed/pillows were the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The bathroom was a bit small & dated (original tile), but the vanity was nicely done. that the hotel has been there a while, but my room was nice. A major negative was the airport noise. This hotel is right on the runway...and what's worse, it's right by the end where the planes take off, so you hear nothing but an unending stream of jumbo jets taking off. My biggest pet peeve is that they charge for internet access. I find it funny that nice hotels, that typically have a lot of business travellers, charge for internet access on top of their rates. This really gets me b/c I've stayed in much lesser hotels that have FREE, hi-speed internet access. As an FYI, parking was $17 per day. If you don't mind the noise, the room was nice & the bed was extremely comfortable; however, if I'm in the area again, I'll probably stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't leave me Hilton LAX”
Reviews.Author: rzl
Reviews.Content: On a Saturday night in Los Angeles, I would say the crowd was 'funky' and the hallway does have a few stains on the carpet but luckily the rooms are a breathe of fresh air. Speaking of which, I like a window that can open but I don't know if that's possible in this style of a building. The workers were all definetly hospitable. But In general, if I could, I'd LOVE to stay here over any other place I've been to (in it's class...)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For One Night”
Reviews.Author: OCragazza
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel because I had to wake up early in the morning for an event held there (I live about an hour south and didn't want to risk sitting in traffic in the morning). Everything about the hotel is pretty average - not shabby but not spectacular either. The restaurants inside looked good, but all I had was a croissant and coffee in the morning, which tasted pretty standard. Other than the airport, the surrounding area is a bit sketchy (there's a nude bar two doors down - enough said, eh?) and definitely not safe to walk around at night, especially if you're traveling with young kids. I would recommend this hotel only for those who just need to spend the night to catch an early flight or if you're attending a meeting in the hotel (convenience factor). Otherwise, if you're purely vacationing from out of town, there are plenty of other nicer hotels in better locations to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “nice deskclerk”
Reviews.Author: viejolucio
Reviews.Content: We booked by the hilton site on the web, from a 15 minutes and $5 rented computer in Las Vegas. Once you put your credit card number, the confirmation is easy and quick; Two days later, we arrived at 11:30 P.M., the staff was handsome and the room was ready and clean, with a bathroom plenty of little bootles of shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, soap, and that stuff. After a quiet night, our 8 year old daughter wanted to go to the pool all the morning, so the checkout time was coming. We went to the front desk asking if it's possible to keep for an hour or two our luggage in the service room meanwhile my young lady enjoyed the wet area, but in a really charm gesture of courtesy, the lady wrote down on the computer that we could leave the room at 3:00 P.M with no extra charge and not needing to take the suitcases off there. For us, that nice behavior paid for the whole stay, despite of the $17 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton airport is fair but not great”
Reviews.Author: bagjag27
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay if you're in LA and flying out early in the AM because it takes cross-town traffic entirely out of the equation. However, it wasn't great for a Hilton property. Pretty lobby, but the room looked dated, and while they claimed that they had upgraded me to a tower room it did not look like the pictures on the website. Bathroom had cheap fixtures and no flat-panel TV as advertised. Bed was great though, and the room was perfectly quiet despite being on the side facing LAX. The biggest problem in my mind is that they did not give me a wake up call and I nearly missed my flight. Not what I expect from Hilton, and I would not pay full price for a room here (I paid a rate of $118 though which was pretty good).

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyguyAustin
Reviews.Content: Good hotel convenient to the airport. Frequent shuttle or you can walk to it in 15 minutes. Nice rooms, but not exceptional. Contrary to some other comments, I found the hotel to have quiet rooms. I think I was on a housekeeping training floor because they seemd to stop working on my room when it was half done. I ran into the supervisor when I was leaveing and mentioned this, but she did not seem to care. Overnight parking is expensive. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place / Super Dinner Buffet”
Reviews.Author: charlotteguy
Reviews.Content: American Airlines paid for my stay since I missed my connection to Hawaii. The hotel lobby and rooms were extremly nice...way more than I expected for an airport hotel. The airline food voucher was good for the hotel restaurant. I expected typical "hotel food" but was extremly pleased with the dinner buffet options. A large salad bar and hot items included fish, steak and chicken. All of the items were soooo good. The rooms were typical with a comfortable bed and shower. The hotel offers a free shuttle from LAX.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Clean and a Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: UsaTraveler13
Reviews.Content: I have to say I do not agree with some of the other opinons about the Hilton LAX Hotel. I guess it's always possible that some others have had a bad experience. However, my experience was fantastic! I booked on Priceline for $80. Yes, you do have to pay the daily $17 parking fee, but that is still much cheaper for this class of hotel in the LAX area than any others. My check-in was very quick and polite, they added my stay onto my hilton honors account and made absolutely no mention of me booking on Priceline. I asked for a quiet room as I had to be up the next day very early and desparately needed a good nites' sleep. Also I should add that I have a VERY sensitive nose and allergies and am very cautious about where I stay due to the all too common "stinky" hotel rooms that we've all encountered! My room was on the 13th floor, the insulation was outstanding and I heard no noise from the airport or street below. I was very impressed with the luxurious feel and cleaniness of my room. There was no smell at all. Shower worked great. And the A/C worked just fine. I slept like a dog! In the morning, I did hear the usual hotel mornings sounds, some doors slamming and maids outside in the hall, but I don't know of any hotels that don't have that. Overall it was a fantastic stay and for $80 I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: travelfoolIndiana
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. The hotel looks great from the lobby, but don't let that fool you. First, I was given a room that had not been cleaned - unmade beds, dirty towels on the floor, etc. This involved notifying the front desk and lugging my luggage around some more to get a new room. Second, someone from the staff woke me up at 11PM knocking repeatedly on my door to fix a "TV cable". Wrong room, oh , so sorry, but now I was awake. The soundproofing in this hotel is non-existent. I was kept awake the ENTIRE night (once I was rudely awakened by the knock at the door) by the sounds of jets taking off every 5 minutes. Try someplace else - I've had decent luck at the Radission at LAX - a little run down too, but the soundproofing is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: AGM78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the LAX Hilton for one night and enjoyed a great nights sleep after a long journey from the UK. Hotel was easy to find (Regular free shuttle service from all terminals), check in speedy & friendly, room was spacious, clean & comfortable, and very quiet despite close proximity to the runways! I had breakfast brought to my room first thing in the morning and this was fine. All in all, a good experience - met my expectations. My travel agent managed to get me an excellent rate for this hotel, so overall good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Skip it unless you are in transit”
Reviews.Author: Business_Asia
Reviews.Content: Skip this hotel unless you are only in transit. I used my Hilton points to stay two nights and would have felt ripped off otherwise. There was a long line for check in at 12:30 AM and I had to ask if there was anyone availabel for H-Honors check in. Even when I did get someone, it took 10 minutes for a confirmed reservation. The first night my room was an "upgraded" room facing the active runway at LAX. The windows are only single-unit glass and they shook violently for 747 take offs and landings and a mild "roar" for all other aircraft. No-sleep even with ear plugs. The second night I was switched to another room on the opposite side of the hotel - much better on the Aircraft noise but the walls are thin and I agree with the other writers comments. Checkout in the arly AM is also time consuming as they only staff with one or two people yet this is a busy time for traveler check out. This was at 4:30 AM. Caution: If you plan to take the shuttle to the airport, plan about 30 minutes for the ride as the busses fill up, they stop at the Four Points Sheraton and stop at several places at each of the 8 terminals. If you don't have a Premium Airline card or access plan to be in the airport check in line two (2) hours before your flight AT LEAST. The hotel is clean and everything in the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. Annoyed at some things.”
Reviews.Author: HL950
Reviews.Content: Pricelined this room for $65. Was pleasantly surprised. Getting up early for a flight out of LAX and decided to spend the night closer to the airport. Did the HIGHLY convenient computerized check-in - no problems. I most definitely checked off a 'non-smoking' room for our stay. Got to our room (3rd floor), and were immediately hit with that stale, disgusting old cigarette smell. I decided to wait it out - perhaps the entire hotel smelled like this, and while definitely undesirable - we were exhausted and just wanted to go to bed. The smell became worse as it was apparent we were on a smoking floor. Decided to switch rooms, and began on my quest to get a hold of someone, ANYONE at the front desk (or management). To my horror, the phone rang ... and rang ... and rang ... and rang. I sat with the phone to my ear, calling various extensions, for a total of 20 minutes ... no one ever picked up. Furious, finally I marched downstairs to tell my concerns to an extremely unprofessional young man at the front desk. No apology, just switched rooms as fast as he could. I know this isn't the Four Seaons, but come on. Terrible customer service. Our room on the 6th floor was lovely and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Forget it! Use only in emergencies!”
Reviews.Author: carefultraveler50
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton Los Angeles hotel for one evening on February 9, 2008. I wanted to be close to the airport for an early morning flight. The hotel is in a great location! However, parking a car takes one six stories underground and a fee of $14.00. Registration was fine, and the staff was polite. However, the hotel was packed--it is, after all, a conference hotel. Being sold out is not a problem if the elevators were working properly. Three out of the six elevators were not working for over three days. On the second day, the hotel had to place guards at the elevator entrances to prevent riots. Getting to one's room took a very long time. In addition, after paying premium prices for a room, the room was small with very low ceilings and an antique television. The bathroom was fit for a hobbit, not a tall man. In addition, the tub surround was not clean. I would most certainly not stay at this hotel again, only in the case of an emergency. There are too many other nicer hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “I've had better stays here”
Reviews.Author: Female_Traveler5689
Reviews.Content: The Hilton is my normal LAX airport hotel choice. I've had very good stays in the past but this one was lacking as far as rooms go. The first room I was given was on the Executive Floor. It was tucked in a corner, near the elevator(contrary to the what I always ask for) with a very small window on the side wall of the room. It seemed that this room was almost an "afterthought." I went down to the front desk and very politely asked for a different room. The woman who helped me was very nice. Due to the hotel being very full, she offerred and I accepted a slightly smaller room on the 4th floor. This room had another very limited view but this time it was of what appeared to be a courtyard between the towers. It was again very close to the elevators which I don't like and they were doing construction on the tower I was in. The floor was covered in plastic and they'd laid plywood over it. Everytime someone walked by it was noisy. I didn't hear any construction noise but this set-up was "low-rent." The room looked ok on the surface but after being in it for awhile I noticed some deficiencies......it was very humid and the room never did cool down to my preferred comfortable sleeping temperature. The TV needed to be repaired or replaced - - the sound was awful. The shower in both the original room and my second and final room needed to be cleaned or have the caulk replaced. One suggestion I have for the hotel if their representatives read this is to reconsider the placement of the small table they have which holds the coffee pot and ice bucket. The placement of it is in the direct line you make from the bed or desk to the bathroom. I ran into at least twice. Finally, despite my displeasure with the room situation, the staff at that hotel is wonderful. The bartenders are great! One of them very kindly gave me a book he'd finished reading. The breakfast room service delivery gentleman was polite and kind as he'd been for my previous stays. The staff that work the front desks are alway pleasant and do their best to be accommodating. I will stay here again as I'm hopeful my room experience was just a "one-time" occurrence.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Statikfeed
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a business trip and was very happy with the location and cleanliness of the rooms. The hotel was very well decorated and the rooms were well appointed. The only complaint I would have is the lack of good restaurants in the hotel (Marriott near by had better choices) and the smell of jet fuel exhaust when you walked outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andriyko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel to ctach an earlt monring flight out of LAX. The hotel is conveniently located, and the property offers free shuttle from/to the airport. The check-in was a breeze and we were in our room within a few minutes. The room was of an average size and offered basic amenities (although no mini bar!). The bathroom was really small. As we had to leave rather early we did not get to ahve brekfast. Overall, a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to saty!”
Reviews.Author: aceupmysleeve777
Reviews.Content: This was a good place to saty the night before we flew out from LAX. Nice rooms, good food choices, and about 2 blocks away from LAX. Also you can leave your car here during your trip and take there airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Hilton...”
Reviews.Author: Reggie3cl
Reviews.Content: I'm glad this was a freebie from Airmiles! Usual Hilton thing- quite nice lobby, scruffy room. Shuttle took forever to pick up at LAX, and if we'd had luggage we wouldn't have been able to get on. Check in was OK, although clerk was disinterested. Room service food was average, although it was delivered by a cheerful chap. BA had lost our luggage and the shop downstairs couldn't even sell me some shaving foam.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Jekajo
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the New Year period. As far as a hotel goes, Hilton was way above average. However, the meals are below what I would have expected. Breakfast is $18.50 and quite limited in selection for that type of price, with some food quite dried. We got a very good rate, so felt that our value for the rooms was excellent. The beds were comfortable and everything, rooms, foyer presentation was of a high calibre. We found the LAX Hilton excellent value for money - except for the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: VaTravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hilton LAX for one night to catch a plane in the morning. Room was clean, beds were very comfortable, linens were nice and crip, bathroom outdated but clean and hallways ugly but clean. Nice lobby, decent Italian restaurant. Very good soundproofing – even though we could see the planes landing, we could never hear them. Got a good night sleep and was on my way the next morning. I think as far as the airport hotel goes, it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay simply overnight”
Reviews.Author: AvidTravler123
Reviews.Content: My family recently spent a night at the LAX Hilton due to our plane on the way from Fiji to LA was 7 hours delayed and we missed our connection. We arrived in to a chaotic scene of mass check ins and we ended up waiting for about 20 minutes to be checked in. We had a room on the 17th floor with a nice view and the beds were nice. The restaurant was okay, service was very slow and unappreciated by my family, who hadn't had anything but airline food in over a day. The decor of the hotel was decent, obviously faded and worn. The food was very average, and did not touch the food at the Beverly Hills Hilton. Our stay was short and average, the LAX Hilton is really just somewhere to stay overnight.

Reviews.Title: “There's a nice Marriott right next door”
Reviews.Author: Ragoczy
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably nice looking hotel located very close to LAX, but I had several problems. First, when I went to shower the night I checked in a large, nasty clump of hair floated up from the drain. I took it down to the front desk the next morning and they handled the situation, but it wasn't an auspicious start to my stay. The second thing that happened is that I got food poisoning four days into my stay and spent a day vomiting (among other things). Since I had only eaten one meal anywhere other than the hotel (and that three days before), my belief is that the illness was caused by the hotel's food. Again, the hotel staff tried to make things right, and if my stay hadn't ended so badly, I'd actually be writing a positive review. The worst problem I had was that they got my rate wrong (to the tune of $350). I had originally booked at a rate of $209, but called the hotel a month and a half before my stay to change it to a rate of $139 that was available because of the purpose of my trip. When I explained this at check-out, I received the worst customer service experience I've ever had at a hotel. The front desk manager on duty was surly and unresponsive, despite my opening the conversation with a smile and cheerful "good morning", she never cracked a smile. Well, when I angrily asked her "Is this how you want a guest to leave your hotel?", she did shrug and smirk a bit. Ultimately, she refused to adjust the rate and I had to catch a plane. I faxed a complaint to the hotel the next week and spoke to someone who actually seemed responsive. He asked me "What can we do to make it up to you?" and I thought he'd correct the issue, but, ultimately, he too refused to adjust the rate, despite it being the hotel's screw-up to begin with. The "explanations" I received had to do with policies and the computer "not letting" the rate be changed.
